YLT_Original: And the ark of Jehovah is in the field of the Philistines seven months,
YLT_Paraphrased: seven months ago, the ark of Jehovah was in the field of the Philistians.
DRA_Original: Now the ark of God was in the land of the Philistines seven months.

YLT_Original: and the Philistines call for priests and for diviners, saying, `What do we do to the ark of Jehovah? let us know wherewith we send it to its place?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "what do we do with the ark of Jehovah?" The Philistines ask, "What do we do with the ark?"
DRA_Original: And the Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying: What shall we do with the ark of the Lord? tell us how we are to send it back to its place? And they said:

YLT_Original: And they say, `If ye are sending away the ark of the God of Israel, ye do not send it away empty; for ye do certainly send back to Him a guilt-offering; then ye are healed, and it hath been known to you why His hand doth not turn aside from you.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "if you're sending the ark of God, you don't send it away empty; for you're sure to send it back to God; then you'll be healed, and it's all right."
DRA_Original: If you send back the ark of the God of Israel, send it not away empty, but render unto him what you owe for sin, and then you shall be healed: and you shall know why his hand departeth not from you.

YLT_Original: And they say, `What  the guilt-offering which we send back to Him?' and they say, `The number of the princes of the Philistines -- five golden emerods, and five golden mice -- for one plague  to you all, and to your princes,
YLT_Paraphrased: "what is the price of the Philistines - five gold emeralds, five gold mice - for one plague?" And they say, "What's the price of the Philistines - five gold mice?"
DRA_Original: They answered: What is it we ought to render unto him for sin? and they answered:

YLT_Original: and ye have made images of your emerods, and images of your mice that are corrupting the land, and have given honour to the God of Israel; it may be He doth lighten His hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land;
YLT_Paraphrased: you've made images of your emerods, and images of your mice that destroy the land, and they're honored by God.
DRA_Original: According to the number of the provinces of the Philistines you shall make five golden emerods, and five golden mice: for the same plague hath been upon you all, and upon your lords. And you shall make the likeness of your emerods, and the likeness of the mice that have destroyed the land, and you shall give glory to the God of Israel: to see if he will take off his hand from you, and from your gods, and from your land.

YLT_Original: and why do ye harden your heart as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their heart? do they not -- when He hath rolled Himself upon them -- send them away, and they go?
YLT_Paraphrased: when He rolled himself on them, and they were hardening their hearts, did they not -- when He rolled himself on them?
DRA_Original: Why do you harden your hearts, as Egypt and Pharao hardened their hearts? did not he, after he was struck, then let them go, and they departed?

YLT_Original: `And now, take and make one new cart, and two suckling kine, on which a yoke hath not gone up, and ye have bound the kine in the cart, and caused their young ones to turn back from after them to the house,
YLT_Paraphrased: and now, take a new cart, and two young kines, and you'll be on your way, and the kine will be on the cart, and the young ones will be on the cart, and they'll be on the way.
DRA_Original: Now therefore take and make a new cart: and two kine that have calved, on which there hath come no yoke, tie to the cart, and shut up their calves at home.

YLT_Original: and ye have taken the ark of Jehovah, and put it on the cart, and the vessels of gold which ye have returned to Him -- a guilt-offering -- ye put in a coffer on its side, and have sent it away, and it hath gone;
YLT_Paraphrased: you took the ark of Jehovah, and you put it on the cart, and the gold vessels you took to God -- a sin-offering -- you took them to the cart.
DRA_Original: And you shall take the ark of the Lord, and lay it on the cart, and the vessels of gold, which you have paid him for sin, you shall put into a little box, at the side thereof: and send it away that it may go.

YLT_Original: and ye have seen, if the way of its own border it goeth up to Beth-Shemesh -- He hath done to us this great evil; and if not, then we have known that His hand hath not come against us; an accident it hath been to us.'
YLT_Paraphrased: if the way of the border is going to Beth-Shemesh, then we know that He has done us a great evil; and if not, then we know that He hasn't done it to us.
DRA_Original: And you shall look: and if it go up by the way of his own coasts towards Bethsames, then he hath done us this great evil: but if not, we shall know that it is not his hand hath touched us, but it hath happened by chance.

YLT_Original: And the men do so, and take two suckling kine, and bind them in the cart, and their young ones they have shut up in the house;
YLT_Paraphrased: they do it, and they take two suckers, and bind them to the cart, and they're in the house;
DRA_Original: They did therefore in this manner: and taking two kine, that had suckling calves, they yoked them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home.

YLT_Original: and they place the ark of Jehovah upon the cart, and the coffer, and the golden mice, and the images of their emerods.
YLT_Paraphrased: they put the ark of God on the cart, the coffer, the golden mouse, the picture of the emerald.
DRA_Original: And they laid the ark of God upon the cart, and the little box that had in it the golden mice and the likeness of the emerods.

YLT_Original: And the kine go straight in the way, on the way to Beth-Shemesh, in one highway they have gone, going and lowing, and have not turned aside right or left; and the princes of the Philistines are going after them unto the border of Beth-Shemesh.
YLT_Paraphrased: they go straight to Beth-Shemesh, and they go down the road, and they go down, and they don't turn, and they don't turn, and they don't turn.
DRA_Original: And the kine took the straight way that leadeth to Bethsames, and they went along the way, lowing as they went: and turned not aside neither to the right hand nor to the left: and the lords of the Philistines followed them as far as the borders of Bethsames.

YLT_Original: And the Beth-Shemeshites are reaping their wheat-harvest in the valley, and they lift up their eyes, and see the ark, and rejoice to see .
YLT_Paraphrased: the Beth-Shemeshites are harvesting wheat in the valley, and they look up, and they see the ark, and they are happy to see.
DRA_Original: Now the Bethsamites were reaping wheat in the valley: and lifting up their eyes they saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.

YLT_Original: And the cart hath come in unto the field of Joshua the Beth-Shemeshite, and standeth there, and there  a great stone, and they cleave the wood of the cart, and the kine they have caused to ascend -- a burnt-offering to Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: the cart is on the field of Joshua, and the Beth-Shemeshite is standing there, and there's a great stone, and they're climbing the cart.
DRA_Original: And the cart came into the field of Josue a Bethsamite, and stood there. And there was a great stone, and they cut in pieces the wood of the cart, and laid the kine upon it a holocaust to the Lord.

YLT_Original: And the Levites have taken down the ark of Jehovah, and the coffer which  with it, in which  the vessels of gold, and place  on the great stone; and the men of Beth-Shemesh have caused to ascend burnt-offerings and sacrifice sacrifices in that day to Jehovah;
YLT_Paraphrased: the Levites took the ark of Jehovah, and the coffer that was with them, and the gold-colored vessels of the great stone; and the men of Beth-Shemesh took them.
DRA_Original: And the Levites took down the ark of God, and the little box that was at the side of it, wherein were the vessels of gold, and they put them upon the great stone. The men also of Bethsames offered holocausts and sacrificed victims that day to the Lord.

YLT_Original: and the five princes of the Philistines have seen , and turn back  Ekron, on that day.
YLT_Paraphrased: on that day, the five princes of the Philistians turned to Ekron, and they turned back.
DRA_Original: And the five princes of the Philistines saw, and they returned to Accaron the same day.

YLT_Original: And these  the golden emerods which the Philistines have sent back -- a guilt-offering to Jehovah: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;
YLT_Paraphrased: for Ashdod, for Gaza, for Ashkelon, for Gath, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Gath, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for
DRA_Original: And these are the golden emerods, which the Philistines returned for sin to the Lord: For Azotus one, for Gaza one, for Ascalon one, for Geth one, for Accaron one:

YLT_Original: and the golden mice -- the number of all the cities of the Philistines -- for the five princes, from the fenced city even unto the hamlet of the villages, even unto the great meadow on which they placed the ark of Jehovah --  unto this day in the field of Joshua the Beth-Shemeshite.
YLT_Paraphrased: the golden mice -- the number of all the cities of the Philistines -- for the five princes, even to the village of the village, even to the great meadow.
DRA_Original: And the golden mice according to the number of the cities of the Philistines, of the five provinces, from the fenced city to the village that was without wall, and to the great Abel (the stone) whereon they set down the ark of the Lord, which was till that day in the field of Josue the Bethsamite.

YLT_Original: And He smiteth among the men of Beth-Shemesh, for they looked into the ark of Jehovah, yea, He smiteth among the people seventy men -- fifty chief men; and the people mourn, because Jehovah smote among the people -- a great smiting.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's looking into the ark of Jehovah, and he's looking at the people of Beth-Shemesh, and he's looking at the people of Beth-Shemesh, and they're crying.
DRA_Original: But he slew of the men of Bethsames, because they had seen the ark of the Lord: and he slew of the people seventy men, and fifty thousand of the common people. And the people lamented, because the Lord had smitten the people with a great slaughter.

YLT_Original: And the men of Beth-Shemesh say, `Who is able to stand before Jehovah, this holy God? and unto whom doth He go up from us?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "who can stand before God's holy God?" And the men of Beth-Shemesh asked.
DRA_Original: And the men of Bethsames said: Who shall be able to stand before the Lord this holy God? and to whom shall he go up from us?

YLT_Original: And they send messengers unto the inhabitants of Kirjath-Jearim, saying, `The Philistines have sent back the ark of Jehovah; come down, take it up unto you.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "the Philistians have sent the ark of Jehovah to Kirjath-Jearim, and they have sent the messenger to the inhabitants of Kirjath-Jearim."
DRA_Original: And they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Cariathiarim, saying: The Philistines have brought back the ark of the Lord, come ye down and fetch it up to you.

YLT_Original: A Song of the Ascents. Those trusting in Jehovah  as Mount Zion, It is not moved -- to the age it abideth.
YLT_Paraphrased: the ones who trust in God's Mount Zion, they don't move - they're not moving to the age they're staying.
DRA_Original: When the lord brought back the captivity of Sion, we became like men comforted.

YLT_Original: Jerusalem! mountains  round about her, And Jehovah  round about His people, From henceforth even unto the age.
YLT_Paraphrased: from the moment of her birth, the mountains around her, the people around her, the whole of them, from the age of the world.
DRA_Original: Then was our mouth filled with gladness; and our tongue with joy. Then shall they say among the Gentiles: The Lord hath done great things for them.

YLT_Original: For the rod of wickedness resteth not On the lot of the righteous, That the righteous put not forth on iniquity their hands.
YLT_Paraphrased: the rod of evil is not resting on the lot of the righteous, but on the hands of the wicked.
DRA_Original: The Lord hath done great things for us: we are become joyful.

YLT_Original: Do good, O Jehovah, to the good, And to the upright in their hearts.
YLT_Paraphrased: good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good,
DRA_Original: Turn again our captivity, O Lord, as a stream in the south.

YLT_Original: As to those turning  their crooked ways, Jehovah causeth them to go with workers of iniquity. Peace on Israel!
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah will bring them to the workers of sin.
DRA_Original: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

YLT_Original: And Agrippa said unto Paul, `It is permitted to thee to speak for thyself;' then Paul having stretched forth the hand, was making a defence:
YLT_Paraphrased: "you can speak for yourself," Agrippa said, "but you can't defend yourself." Then Paul raised his hand and defended himself:
DRA_Original: Then Agrippa said to Paul: Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretching forth his hand, began to make his answer.

YLT_Original: `Concerning all things of which I am accused by Jews, king Agrippa, I have thought myself happy, being about to make a defence before thee to-day,
YLT_Paraphrased: I was happy to think of the defense before you, king Agrippa, for all things I have been accused of Jews.
DRA_Original: I think myself happy, O king Agrippa, that I am to answer for myself this day before thee, touching all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews.

YLT_Original: especially knowing thee to be acquainted with all things -- both customs and questions -- among Jews; wherefore, I beseech thee, patiently to hear me.
YLT_Paraphrased: I beg you, patiently, to hear me, both Jews and Jews, to know everything -- both customs and questions -- among Jews.
DRA_Original: Especially as thou knowest all, both customs and questions that are among the Jews: Wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

YLT_Original: `The manner of my life then, indeed, from youth -- which from the beginning was among my nation, in Jerusalem -- know do all the Jews,
YLT_Paraphrased: the way I've lived since my youth, which began in Jerusalem -- all Jews know, the way I've lived, I've been among them.
DRA_Original: And my life indeed from my youth, which was from the beginning among my own nation in Jerusalem, all the Jews do know:

YLT_Original: knowing me before from the first, (if they may be willing to testify,) that after the most exact sect of our worship, I lived a Pharisee;
YLT_Paraphrased: I've lived a Pharisee before, if they're willing to testify, that I've lived a Pharisee in our worship;
DRA_Original: Having known me from the beginning (if they will give testimony) that according to the most sure sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

YLT_Original: and now for the hope of the promise made to the fathers by God, I have stood judged,
YLT_Paraphrased: I stood in judgment for the promise God made to my father.
DRA_Original: And now for the hope of the promise that was made by God to the fathers, do I stand subject to judgment:

YLT_Original: to which our twelve tribes, intently night and day serving, do hope to come, concerning which hope I am accused, king Agrippa, by the Jews;
YLT_Paraphrased: by the Jews, I'm accused of being a Jew, king Agrippa, by the Jews, who are very eager to come to our service.
DRA_Original: Unto which, our twelve tribes, serving night and day, hope to come. For which hope, O king, I am accused by the Jews.

YLT_Original: why is it judged incredible with you, if God doth raise the dead?
YLT_Paraphrased: if God's dead, is it amazing to you?
DRA_Original: Why should it be thought a thing incredible, that God should raise the dead?

YLT_Original: `I, indeed, therefore, thought with myself, that against the name of Jesus of Nazareth it behoved  many things to do,
YLT_Paraphrased: in fact, I thought it was necessary to do many things against the name of Jesus Christ.
DRA_Original: And I indeed did formerly think, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

YLT_Original: which also I did in Jerusalem, and many of the saints I in prison did shut up, from the chief priests having received the authority; they also being put to death, I gave my vote against them,
YLT_Paraphrased: I have also voted against them in Jerusalem, and many of the saints I've been in prison, they've also been killed.
DRA_Original: Which also I did at Jerusalem, and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority of the chief priests: and when they were put to death, I brought the sentence.

YLT_Original: and in every synagogue, often punishing them, I was constraining  to speak evil, being also exceedingly mad against them, I was also persecuting  even unto strange cities.
YLT_Paraphrased: I was often punished, often punished, and often punished, and I was often angry with them, and I was often angry with them.
DRA_Original: And oftentimes punishing them, in every synagogue, I compelled them to blaspheme: and being yet more mad against them, I persecuted them even unto foreign cities.

YLT_Original: `In which things, also, going on to Damascus -- with authority and commission from the chief priests --
YLT_Paraphrased: in which, the chief priests and the priests of the Holy See are also involved --
DRA_Original: Whereupon when I was going to Damascus with authority and permission of the chief priest,

YLT_Original: at mid-day, I saw in the way, O king, out of heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me a light -- and those going on with me;
YLT_Paraphrased: I saw a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light, a light,
DRA_Original: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me, and them that were in company with me.

YLT_Original: and we all having fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew dialect, Saul, Saul, why me dost thou persecute? hard for thee against pricks to kick!
YLT_Paraphrased: I heard a voice, and said in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why do you hate me?
DRA_Original: And when we were all fallen down on the ground, I heard a voice speaking to me in the Hebrew tongue: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? It is hard for thee to kick against the goad.

YLT_Original: `And I said, Who art thou, Lord? and he said, I am Jesus whom thou dost persecute;
YLT_Paraphrased: and I'm saying, who's the Lord? And he said, I'm Jesus, you're the one who's persecuting me.
DRA_Original: And I said: Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord answered: I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.

YLT_Original: but rise, and stand upon thy feet, for for this I appeared to thee, to appoint thee an officer and a witness both of the things thou didst see, and of the things [in which] I will appear to thee,
YLT_Paraphrased: for I have appeared to you, and I have appointed you a witness to what you saw, and I have promised you that I will appear to you.
DRA_Original: But rise up, and stand upon thy feet: for to this end have I appeared to thee, that I may make thee a minister, and a witness of those things which thou hast seen, and of those things wherein I will appear to thee,

YLT_Original: delivering thee from the people, and the nations, to whom now I send thee,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'll give you to the people, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations, the nations,
DRA_Original: Delivering thee from the people, and from the nations, unto which now I send thee:

YLT_Original: to open their eyes, to turn  from darkness to light, and  the authority of the Adversary unto God, for their receiving forgiveness of sins, and a lot among those having been sanctified, by faith that  toward me.
YLT_Paraphrased: to open the eyes, turn to light, and the power of the enemy to God, for their forgiveness of sins, and a lot among those who have been saved.
DRA_Original: To open their eyes, that they may be converted from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and a lot among the saints, by the faith that is in me.

YLT_Original: `Whereupon, king Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision,
YLT_Paraphrased: I did not disobey the heavenly vision, king Agrippa.
DRA_Original: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not incredulous to the heavenly vision:

YLT_Original: but to those in Damascus first, and to those in Jerusalem, to all the region also of Judea, and to the nations, I was preaching to reform, and to turn back unto God, doing works worthy of reformation;
YLT_Paraphrased: I have been preaching reform, and turning to God, doing works worthy of reform, and I have been preaching to the whole region, and to the nations, and to the whole world, I have been preaching to reform, and to turn to God.
DRA_Original: But to them first that are at Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and unto all the country of Judea, and to the Gentiles did I preach, that they should do penance, and turn to God, doing works worthy of penance.

YLT_Original: because of these things the Jews -- having caught me in the temple -- were endeavouring to kill .
YLT_Paraphrased: the Jews -- who caught me in the temple -- tried to kill me.
DRA_Original: For this cause the Jews, when I was in the temple, having apprehended me, went about to kill me.

YLT_Original: `Having obtained, therefore, help from God, till this day, I have stood witnessing both to small and to great, saying nothing besides the things that both the prophets and Moses spake of as about to come,
YLT_Paraphrased: I have witnessed the small and the great, as they were prophesied and Moses spoke of them, nothing but the things that both the prophets and the priests said were about to happen, and I have not spoken a word of it.
DRA_Original: But being aided by the help of God, I stand unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying no other thing than those which the prophets, and Moses did say should come to pass:

YLT_Original: that the Christ is to suffer, whether first by a rising from the dead, he is about to proclaim light to the people and to the nations.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "the Christ will suffer, whether he is alive or dead, he will be the light of the world."
DRA_Original: That Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light to the people, and to the Gentiles.

YLT_Original: And, he thus making a defence, Festus with a loud voice said, `Thou art mad, Paul; much learning doth turn thee mad;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you're crazy, Paul," said Festus loudly, "you know, much learning is going to make you crazy;"
DRA_Original: As he spoke these things, and made his answer, Festus said with a loud voice: Paul, thou art beside thyself: much learning doth make thee mad.

YLT_Original: and he saith, `I am not mad, most noble Festus, but of truth and soberness the sayings I speak forth;
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm not crazy, but I'm really sober and honest, Festus," he said.
DRA_Original: And Paul said: I am not mad, most excellent Festus, but I speak words of truth and soberness.

YLT_Original: for the king doth know concerning these things, before whom also I speak boldly, for none of these things, I am persuaded, are hidden from him; for this thing hath not been done in a corner;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm sure he knows about these things before he speaks, for none of them, I'm sure, is hidden from him; for this thing has not been done in a corner.
DRA_Original: For the king knoweth of these things, to whom also I speak with confidence. For I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him. For neither was any of these things done in a corner.

YLT_Original: thou dost believe, king Agrippa, the prophets? I have known that thou dost believe!'
YLT_Paraphrased: I know you're thinking, Agrippa, the prophet? I've known you're thinking!'
DRA_Original: Believest thou the prophets, O king Agrippa? I know that thou believest.

YLT_Original: And Agrippa said unto Paul, `In a little thou dost persuade me to become a Christian!'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you're gonna convince me to be a Christian in a minute!" Said Agrippa.
DRA_Original: And Agrippa said to Paul: In a little thou persuadest me to become a Christian.

YLT_Original: and Paul said, `I would have wished to God, both in a little, and in much, not only thee, but also all those hearing me to-day, to become such as I also am -- except these bonds.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'd like to say, both in a little, and in a big way, not only you, but everyone who hears me today, to be like me - except for those bonds."
DRA_Original: And Paul said: I would to God, that both in a little and in much, not only thou, but also all that hear me, this day, should become such as I also am, except these bands.

YLT_Original: And, he having spoken these things, the king rose up, and the governor, Bernice also, and those sitting with them,
YLT_Paraphrased: the king rose and the governor, Bernice, and the others who were sitting with them.
DRA_Original: And the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them.

YLT_Original: and having withdrawn, they were speaking unto one another, saying -- `This man doth nothing worthy of death or of bonds;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "this man doesn't deserve death or bonds; he's just saying something worth dying for."
DRA_Original: And when they were gone aside, they spoke among themselves, saying: This man hath done nothing worthy of death or of bands.

YLT_Original: and Agrippa said to Festus, `This man might have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "if he hadn't appealed to Caesar, he might have been released," Agrippa said.
DRA_Original: And Agrippa said to Festus: This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed to Caesar.

YLT_Original: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Timotheus the brother,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Lord Jesus Christ, the Holy Spirit, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord, the soul of the Lord
DRA_Original: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, and Timothy, a brother,

YLT_Original: to the saints in Colossae, and to the faithful brethren in Christ: Grace to you, and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ!
YLT_Paraphrased: God bless you, and peace be with you, my dear brothers and sisters in Christ!
DRA_Original: To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ Jesus, who are at Colossa.

YLT_Original: We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, always praying for you,
YLT_Paraphrased: thank God and the Lord of our Lord Jesus Christ, we thank you.
DRA_Original: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ. We give thanks to God, and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you.

YLT_Original: having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love that  to all the saints,
YLT_Paraphrased: I have heard of your faith in Jesus Christ and the love you have for all saints.
DRA_Original: Hearing your faith in Christ Jesus, and the love which you have towards all the saints.

YLT_Original: because of the hope that is laid up for you in the heavens, which ye heard of before in the word of the truth of the good news,
YLT_Paraphrased: for the hope that you will be able to hear the truth of the good news, which you have heard before in the words of truth.
DRA_Original: For the hope that is laid up for you in heaven, which you have heard in the word of the truth of the gospel,

YLT_Original: which is present to you, as also in all the world, and is bearing fruit, as also in you, from the day in which ye heard, and knew the grace of God in truth;
YLT_Paraphrased: and from the day you heard, and saw the grace of God, you have seen the fruit of it, as well as in you, from the day you heard, and knew the truth.
DRA_Original: Which is come unto you, as also it is in the whole world, and bringeth forth fruit and groweth, even as it doth in you, since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth.

YLT_Original: as ye also learned from Epaphras, our beloved fellow-servant, who is for you a faithful ministrant of the Christ,
YLT_Paraphrased: you know, Epaphras, our beloved friend, who is a faithful minister of the Lord, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know,
DRA_Original: As you learned of Epaphras, our most beloved fellow servant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ Jesus;

YLT_Original: who also did declare to us your love in the Spirit.
YLT_Paraphrased: he also said he loved us in the spirit.
DRA_Original: Who also hath manifested to us your love in the spirit.

YLT_Original: Because of this, we also, from the day in which we heard, do not cease praying for you, and asking that ye may be filled with the full knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding,
YLT_Paraphrased: we have not ceased to pray for you, and we ask that you will be fully aware of His will, and that you will be able to understand it with all wisdom and spiritual understanding.
DRA_Original: Therefore we also, from the day that we heard it, cease not to pray for you, and to beg that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will, in all wisdom, and spiritual understanding:

YLT_Original: to your walking worthily of the Lord to all pleasing, in every good work being fruitful, and increasing to the knowledge of God,
YLT_Paraphrased: in every good work, and every increase in knowledge of God, you will be worthy of the Lord's worthily.
DRA_Original: That you may walk worthy of God, in all things pleasing; being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God:

YLT_Original: in all might being made mighty according to the power of His glory, to all endurance and long-suffering with joy.
YLT_Paraphrased: the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory of the glory
DRA_Original: Strengthened with all might, according to the power of his glory, in all patience and longsuffering with joy,

YLT_Original: Giving thanks to the Father who did make us meet for the participation of the inheritance of the saints in the light,
YLT_Paraphrased: thanks to the father who gave us the opportunity to meet the inheritance of the saints in the light.
DRA_Original: Giving thanks to God the Father, who hath made us worthy to be partakers of the lot of the saints in light:

YLT_Original: who did rescue us out of the authority of the darkness, and did translate  into the reign of the Son of His love,
YLT_Paraphrased: we were rescued from the darkness, and we have been translated into the love of the Son of God.
DRA_Original: Who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love,

YLT_Original: in whom we have the redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of the sins,
YLT_Paraphrased: the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of
DRA_Original: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the remission of sins;

YLT_Original: who is the image of the invisible God, first-born of all creation,
YLT_Paraphrased: the invisible God, the first born of all creation, the first born of God.
DRA_Original: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature:

YLT_Original: because in him were the all things created, those in the heavens, and those upon the earth, those visible, and those invisible, whether thrones, whether lordships, whether principalities, whether authorities; all things through him, and for him, have been created,
YLT_Paraphrased: everything in him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for him, and for
DRA_Original: For in him were all things created in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones, or dominations, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him and in him.

YLT_Original: and himself is before all, and the all things in him have consisted.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's all in himself, and everything in him is in the way.
DRA_Original: And he is before all, and by him all things consist.

YLT_Original: And himself is the head of the body -- the assembly -- who is a beginning, a first-born out of the dead, that he might become in all  -- himself -- first,
YLT_Paraphrased: he's the head of the body -- the body -- who's the beginning, the first born of the dead, that he might be able to become -- himself -- first,
DRA_Original: And he is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he may hold the primacy:

YLT_Original: because in him it did please all the fulness to tabernacle,
YLT_Paraphrased: he was pleased with the whole of the fulness of the tabernacle, and he was pleased with the whole of the tabernacle.
DRA_Original: Because in him, it hath well pleased the Father, that all fullness should dwell;

YLT_Original: and through him to reconcile the all things to himself -- having made peace through the blood of his cross -- through him, whether the things upon the earth, whether the things in the heavens.
YLT_Paraphrased: he made peace with his blood, whether on the ground, whether in the sky, whether in the sky.
DRA_Original: And through him to reconcile all things unto himself, making peace through the blood of his cross, both as to the things that are on earth, and the things that are in heaven.

YLT_Original: And you -- once being alienated, and enemies in the mind, in the evil works, yet now did he reconcile,
YLT_Paraphrased: once he was separated from the good, and enemies in his mind, but now he's reconciled,
DRA_Original: And you, whereas you were some time alienated and enemies in mind in evil works:

YLT_Original: in the body of his flesh through the death, to present you holy, and unblemished, and unblameable before himself,
YLT_Paraphrased: to be holy, and unblemished, and unblameable before his body, and he will be holy and unblemished.
DRA_Original: Yet now he hath reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unspotted, and blameless before him:

YLT_Original: if also ye remain in the faith, being founded and settled, and not moved away from the hope of the good news, which ye heard, which was preached in all the creation that  under the heaven, of which I became -- I Paul -- a ministrant.
YLT_Paraphrased: I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul, I Paul
DRA_Original: If so ye continue in the faith, grounded and settled, and immoveable from the hope of the gospel which you have heard, which is preached in all the creation that is under heaven, whereof I Paul am made a minister.

YLT_Original: I now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and do fill up the things lacking of the tribulations of the Christ in my flesh for his body, which is the assembly,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm glad you're happy with my suffering, and I'm happy to fill the things I don't have to suffer for you, my body, which is the body of Christ.
DRA_Original: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up those things that are wanting of the sufferings of Christ, in my flesh, for his body, which is the church:

YLT_Original: of which I -- I did become a ministrant according to the dispensation of God, that was given to me for you, to fulfil the word of God,
YLT_Paraphrased: I've become a ministrant in God's name, that's what God gave me, so I can fulfill the word of God.
DRA_Original: Whereof I am made a minister according to the dispensation of God, which is given me towards you, that I may fulfill the word of God:

YLT_Original: the secret that hath been hid from the ages and from the generations, but now was manifested to his saints,
YLT_Paraphrased: the secret that has been hidden for ages and generations, but now he's revealed to the saints.
DRA_Original: The mystery which hath been hidden from ages and generations, but now is manifested to his saints,

YLT_Original: to whom God did will to make known what  the riches of the glory of this secret among the nations -- which is Christ in you, the hope of the glory,
YLT_Paraphrased: the glory of the secret among the nations, which is Christ in you, the hope of the glory,
DRA_Original: To whom God would make known the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ, in you the hope of glory.

YLT_Original: whom we proclaim, warning every man, and teaching every man, in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus,
YLT_Paraphrased: we will teach every man, and every man, in all wisdom, that we can present them to the perfect man Jesus.
DRA_Original: Whom we preach, admonishing every man, and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus.

YLT_Original: for which also I labour, striving according to his working that is working in me in power.
YLT_Paraphrased: I work, I try to do what I'm working for, and I'm working hard to do it.
DRA_Original: Wherein also I labour, striving according to his working which he worketh in me in power.

YLT_Original: And Job answereth and saith: --
YLT_Paraphrased: he says: -- He's a job, and he's a job, and he's a job.
DRA_Original: But Job answered, and said:

YLT_Original: O that my provocation were thoroughly weighed, And my calamity in balances They would lift up together!
YLT_Paraphrased: they would lift my anger, and my disaster in balance.
DRA_Original: O that my sins, whereby I have deserved wrath, and the calamity that I suffer, were weighed in a balance.

YLT_Original: For now, than the sands of the sea it is heavier, Therefore my words have been rash.
YLT_Paraphrased: then I was rash, because the sea is heavier than the sea.
DRA_Original: As the sand of the sea this would appear heavier: therefore my words are full of sorrow:

YLT_Original: For arrows of the Mighty  with me, Whose poison is drinking up my spirit. Terrors of God array themselves  me!
YLT_Paraphrased: the Mighty, who drink my soul, are my enemies!
DRA_Original: For the arrows of the Lord are in me, the rage whereof drinketh up my spirit, and the terrors of the Lord war against me.

YLT_Original: Brayeth a wild ass over tender grass? Loweth an ox over his provender?
YLT_Paraphrased: a wild ass in the grass? Loweth an ox in the grass?
DRA_Original: Will the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or will the ox low when he standeth before a full manger?

YLT_Original: Eaten is an insipid thing without salt? Is there sense in the drivel of dreams?
YLT_Paraphrased: isn't it a little silly thing to dream?
DRA_Original: Or can an unsavoury thing be eaten, that is not seasoned with salt? or can a man taste that which when tasted bringeth death?

YLT_Original: My soul is refusing to touch! They  as my sickening food.
YLT_Paraphrased: I refuse to touch my soul! They're sickening me!
DRA_Original: The things which before my soul would not touch, now, through anguish are my meats.

YLT_Original: O that my request may come, That God may grant my hope!
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm asking God to grant my hope, so that God may be happy!
DRA_Original: Who will grant that my request may come: and that God may give me what I look for?

YLT_Original: That God would please -- and bruise me, Loose His hand and cut me off!
YLT_Paraphrased: God will be pleased - and I'll be bruised, Loose his hand and cut me off!
DRA_Original: And that he that hath begun may destroy me, that he may let loose his hand, and cut me off?

YLT_Original: And yet it is my comfort, (And I exult in pain -- He doth not spare,) That I have not hidden The sayings of the Holy One.
YLT_Paraphrased: yet I'm comforted by the fact that I didn't hide the Holy One's words.
DRA_Original: And that this may be my comfort, that afflicting me with sorrow, he spare not, nor I contradict the words of the Holy One.

YLT_Original: What  my power that I should hope? And what mine end That I should prolong my life?
YLT_Paraphrased: what power do I have to hope for? And what will I prolong my life?
DRA_Original: For what is my strength, that I can hold out? or what is my end that I should keep patience?

YLT_Original: Is my strength the strength of stones? Is my flesh brazen?
YLT_Paraphrased: is my strength the strength of the stone?
DRA_Original: My strength is not the strength of stones, nor is my flesh of brass.

YLT_Original: Is not my help with me, And substance driven from me?
YLT_Paraphrased: I don't want my help, but my substance?
DRA_Original: Behold there is no help for me in myself, and my familiar friends also are departed from me.

YLT_Original: To a despiser of his friends  shame, And the fear of the Mighty he forsaketh.
YLT_Paraphrased: he is ashamed of his friends, and he is afraid of the mighty.
DRA_Original: He that taketh away mercy from his friend, forsaketh the fear of the Lord.

YLT_Original: My brethren have deceived as a brook, As a stream of brooks they pass away.
YLT_Paraphrased: brothers, as a brook, they pass like a stream of brooks.
DRA_Original: My brethren have passed by me, as the torrent that passeth swiftly in the valleys.

YLT_Original: That are black because of ice, By them doth snow hide itself.
YLT_Paraphrased: it's black because of ice, and the snow is hiding it.
DRA_Original: They that fear the hoary frost, the snow shall fall upon them.

YLT_Original: By the time they are warm they have been cut off, By its being hot they have been Extinguished from their place.
YLT_Paraphrased: when they are warm, they are cut off by the heat, and they are extinguished.
DRA_Original: At the time when they shall be scattered they shall perish: and after it groweth hot they shall be melted out of their place.

YLT_Original: Turn aside do the paths of their way, They ascend into emptiness, and are lost.
YLT_Paraphrased: they turn away, they go down, and they fall.
DRA_Original: The paths of their steps are entangled: they shall walk in vain, and shall perish.

YLT_Original: Passengers of Tema looked expectingly, Travellers of Sheba hoped for them.
YLT_Paraphrased: the passengers of Tema looked expectantly, hoping for the arrival of the Sheba.
DRA_Original: Consider the paths of Thema, the ways of Saba, and wait a little while.

YLT_Original: They were ashamed that one hath trusted, They have come unto it and are confounded.
YLT_Paraphrased: they were ashamed to trust, and they came to him and were confused.
DRA_Original: They are confounded, because I have hoped: they are come also even unto me, and are covered with shame.

YLT_Original: Surely now ye have become the same! Ye see a downfall, and are afraid.
YLT_Paraphrased: you're the same now, and you're afraid.
DRA_Original: Now you are come: and now seeing my affliction you are afraid.

YLT_Original: Is it because I said, Give to me? And, By your power bribe for me?
YLT_Paraphrased: and, by your power, will you give me the money?
DRA_Original: Did I say: Bring to me, and give me of your substance?

YLT_Original: And, Deliver me from the hand of an adversary? And, From the hand of terrible ones ransom me?
YLT_Paraphrased: and, from the hand of a terrible enemy, ransom me?
DRA_Original: Or deliver me from the hand of the enemy, and rescue me out of the hand of the mighty?

YLT_Original: Shew me, and I -- I keep silent, And what I have erred, let me understand.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm silent, and I'm thinking what I've done wrong.
DRA_Original: Teach me, and I will hold my peace: and if I have been ignorant in any thing, instruct me.

YLT_Original: How powerful have been upright sayings, And what doth reproof from you reprove?
YLT_Paraphrased: what powerful words have you spoken, and what do you regret?
DRA_Original: Why have you detracted the words of truth, whereas there is none of you that can reprove me?

YLT_Original: For reproof -- do you reckon words? And for wind -- sayings of the desperate.
YLT_Paraphrased: for reproof -- you think words? And for wind -- the words of the desperate.
DRA_Original: You dress up speeches only to rebuke, and you utter words to the wind.

YLT_Original: Anger on the fatherless ye cause to fall, And are strange to your friend.
YLT_Paraphrased: your fatherless son is a strange thing to your friend.
DRA_Original: You rush in upon the fatherless, and you endeavour to overthrow your friend.

YLT_Original: And, now, please, look upon me, Even to your face do I lie?
YLT_Paraphrased: look, I'm lying to you, even in your face.
DRA_Original: However finish what you have begun, give ear, and see whether I lie.

YLT_Original: Turn back, I pray you, let it not be perverseness, Yea, turn back again -- my righteousness  in it.
YLT_Paraphrased: turn back, I beg you, don't be a fool, turn back -- my righteousness.
DRA_Original: Answer, I beseech you, without contention: and speaking that which is just, judge ye.

YLT_Original: Is there in my tongue perverseness? Discerneth not my palate desirable things?
YLT_Paraphrased: do you want to know what I want to say?
DRA_Original: And you shall not And iniquity in my tongue, neither shall folly sound in my mouth.

YLT_Original: And I say, `Hear, I pray you, heads of Jacob, And ye judges of the house of Israel, Is it not for you to know the judgment?
YLT_Paraphrased: "I beg you, Jacob, and you, the judges of the house of Israel, do you know the judgment?
DRA_Original: And I said: Hear, O ye princes of Jacob, and ye chiefs of the house of Israel: Is it not your part to know judgment,

YLT_Original: Ye who are hating good, and loving evil, Taking violently their skin from off them, And their flesh from off their bones,
YLT_Paraphrased: who hate good, and love evil, and take their skin off them, and their bones.
DRA_Original: You that hate good, and love evil: that violently pluck off their skins from them, and their flesh from their bones?

YLT_Original: And who have eaten the flesh of My people, And their skin from off them have stript, And their bones they have broken, And they have spread  out as in a pot, And as flesh in the midst of a caldron.
YLT_Paraphrased: they ate the flesh of my people, and their skin was torn, and they were broken, and they were like meat in the middle of a caldron.
DRA_Original: Who have eaten the flesh of my people, and have flayed their skin from off them: and have broken, and chopped their bones as for the kettle, and as flesh in the midst of the pot.

YLT_Original: Then do they cry unto Jehovah, And He doth not answer them, And hideth His face from them at that time, As they have made evil their doings.
YLT_Paraphrased: they cry to God, and He's not answering them, and he's hiding his face.
DRA_Original: Then shall they cry to the Lord, and he will not hear them: and he will hide his face from them at that time, as they have behaved wickedly in their devices.

YLT_Original: Thus said Jehovah concerning the prophets Who are causing My people to err, Who are biting with their teeth, And have cried `Peace,' And he who doth not give unto their mouth, They have sanctified against him war.
YLT_Paraphrased: he who is not giving his mouth, he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and he's a war, and
DRA_Original: Thus saith the Lord concerning the prophets that make my people err: that bite with their teeth, and preach peace: and if a man give not something into their mouth, they prepare war against him.

YLT_Original: Therefore a night ye have without vision, And darkness ye have without divination, And gone in hath the sun on the prophets, And black over them hath been the day.
YLT_Paraphrased: the day was dark, and the sun was down, and the prophet was gone, and the sun was down.
DRA_Original: Therefore night shall be to you instead of vision, and darkness to you instead of divination; and the sun shall go down upon the prophets, and the day shall be darkened over them.

YLT_Original: And ashamed have been the seers, And confounded have been the diviners, And covered their lip have all of them, For their is no answer, O God.
YLT_Paraphrased: the seers, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the diviners, the div
DRA_Original: And they shall be confounded that see visions, and the diviners shall be confounded: and they shall all cover their faces, because there is no answer of God.

YLT_Original: And yet I have been full of power by the Spirit of Jehovah, And of judgment, and of might, To declare to Jacob his transgression, And to Israel his sin.
YLT_Paraphrased: yet I'm full of power, and I'm ready to tell Jacob, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel, and Israel
DRA_Original: But yet I am filled with the strength of the spirit of the Lord, with judgment, and power: to declare unto Jacob his wickedness, and to Israel his sin.

YLT_Original: Hear this, I pray you, heads of the house of Jacob, And ye judges of the house of Israel, Who are making judgment abominable, And all uprightness do pervert.
YLT_Paraphrased: I beg you, Jacob's head, and the head of the house of Israel, who are the judges of the house of Israel, who are guilty of sin.
DRA_Original: Hear this, ye princes of the house of Jacob, and ye judges of the house of Israel: you that abhor judgment, and pervert all that is right.

YLT_Original: Building up Zion with blood, And Jerusalem with iniquity.
YLT_Paraphrased: the blood of Zion, the blood of Jerusalem, the blood of Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: You that build up Sion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.

YLT_Original: Her heads for a bribe do judge, And her priests for hire do teach, And her prophets for silver divine, And on Jehovah they lean, saying, `Is not Jehovah in our midst? Evil doth not come in upon us.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "isn't there a judge, a priest, a prophet, a prophet, a silver-eyed God?" And they lean, saying, "Isn't there a judge, a priest, a prophet, a silver-eyed God?"
DRA_Original: Her princes have judged for bribes, and her priests have taught for hire, and her prophets divined for money: and they leaned upon the Lord, saying: Is not the Lord in the midst of us? no evil shall come upon us.

YLT_Original: Therefore, for your sake, Zion is ploughed a field, and Jerusalem is heaps, And the mount of the house  for high places of a forest!
YLT_Paraphrased: for your sake, Zion is building a field, and Jerusalem is a heap of rubble!
DRA_Original: Therefore, because of you, Sion shall be ploughed as a field, and Jerusalem shall be as a heap of stones, and the mountain of the temple as the high places of the forests.

YLT_Original: And after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra son of Seraiah, son of Azariah, son of Hilkiah,
YLT_Paraphrased: Ezra son of Seraiah, son of Azariah, son of Hilkiah, son of Azariah, son of Hilkiah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah, son of Azariah
DRA_Original: Now after these things in the reign of Artaxerxes king of the Persians, Esdras the son of Saraias, the son of Azarias, the son of Helcias,

YLT_Original: son of Shallum, son of Zadok, son of Ahitub,
YLT_Paraphrased: son of Zadok, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahitub's son, Ahit
DRA_Original: The son of Sellum, the son of Sadoc, the son of Achitob,

YLT_Original: son of Amariah, son of Azariah, son of Meraioth,
YLT_Paraphrased: son of Amariah, son of Azariah, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Meraioth, son of Mer
DRA_Original: The son of Amarias, the son of Azarias, the son of Maraioth,

YLT_Original: son of Zerahiah, son of Uzzi, son of Bukki,
YLT_Paraphrased: Zerahiah, son of Uzzi, son of Bukki, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of Uzzi, son of U
DRA_Original: The son of Zarahias, the son of Ozi, the son of Bocci,

YLT_Original: son of Abishua, son of Phinehas, son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the head priest;
YLT_Paraphrased: Abishua, son of Phinehas, son of Eleazar, son of Aaron;
DRA_Original: The son of Abisue, the son of Phinees, the son of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest from the beginning.

YLT_Original: Ezra himself hath come up from Babylon, and he  a scribe ready in the law of Moses, that Jehovah God of Israel gave, and the king giveth to him -- according to the hand of Jehovah his God upon him -- all his request.
YLT_Paraphrased: according to the word of God, the king gave him to him, and the king gave him to the king, according to the word of God, the king of Israel.
DRA_Original: This Esdras went up from Babylon, and he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which the Lord God had given to Israel: and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the Lord his God upon him.

YLT_Original: And there go up of the sons of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the gatekeepers, and the Nethinim, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
YLT_Paraphrased: in the seventh year of Artaxerxes, the king of Jerusalem, the king of the Jews, the king of the priests, the Levites, the Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, the Nethinim, the king of Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the children of the priests, and of the children of the Levites, and of the singing men, and of the porters, and of the Nathinites to Jerusalem in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.

YLT_Original: And he cometh in to Jerusalem in the fifth month, that [is in] the seventh year of the king,
YLT_Paraphrased: in the seventh month of the king, he comes to Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: And they came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, in the seventh year of the king.

YLT_Original: for on the first of the month he hath founded the ascent from Babylon, and on the first of the fifth month he hath come in unto Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him,
YLT_Paraphrased: on the first of the month he was in Babylon, and on the first of the fifth month he came to Jerusalem, according to God's good will.
DRA_Original: For upon the first day of the first month he began to go up from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month he came to Jerusalem according to the good hand of his God upon him.

YLT_Original: for Ezra hath prepared his heart to seek the law of Jehovah, and to do, and to teach in Israel statute and judgment.
YLT_Paraphrased: Ezra has prepared his heart to seek the law of God and to be taught by the law of God.
DRA_Original: For Esdras had prepared his heart to seek the law of the Lord, and to do and to teach in Israel the commandments and judgment.

YLT_Original: And this  a copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest, the scribe, a scribe of the words of the commands of Jehovah, and of His statutes on Israel:
YLT_Paraphrased: this is the letter of the king Artaxerxes, the priest, the scribe, the scribe of the words of the king's orders, and the king's statutes on Israel:
DRA_Original: And this is the copy of the letter of the edict, which king Artaxerxes gave to Esdras the priest, the scribe instructed in the words and commandments of the Lord, and his ceremonies in Israel.

YLT_Original: `Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, a perfect scribe of the law of the God of heaven, and at such a time:
YLT_Paraphrased: Artaxerxes, king of kings, to the priest of the God of heaven, and at this time:
DRA_Original: Artaxerxes king of kings to Esdras the priest, the most learned scribe of the law of the God of heaven, greeting.

YLT_Original: By me hath been made a decree that every one who is willing, in my kingdom, of the people of Israel and of its priests and Levites, to go to Jerusalem with thee, doth go;
YLT_Paraphrased: I have made a decree that all who want to go to Jerusalem with you, the people of Israel and the priests and Levites, will go;
DRA_Original: It is decreed by me, that all they of the people of Israel, and of the priests and of the Levites in my realm, that are minded to go into Jerusalem, should go with thee.

YLT_Original: because that from the king and his seven counsellors thou art sent, to inquire concerning Judah and concerning Jerusalem, with the law of God that  in thy hand,
YLT_Paraphrased: you will be sent to inquire about Judah and Jerusalem, with the law of God, which you have in your hand.
DRA_Original: For thou art sent from before the king, and his seven counsellors, to visit Judea and Jerusalem according to the law of thy God, which is in thy hand.

YLT_Original: and to carry silver and gold that the king and his counsellors willingly offered to the God of Israel, whose tabernacle  in Jerusalem,
YLT_Paraphrased: the king and his counsellors willingly offered the God of Israel, whose tabernacle was in Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: And to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose tabernacle is in Jerusalem.

YLT_Original: and all the silver and gold that thou findest in all the province of Babylon, with the free-will offerings of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly, for the house of their God that  in Jerusalem,
YLT_Paraphrased: the silver and gold that you find in the whole province of Babylon, the people's offerings, the priests, and the priests willingly, for the house of God, in Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: And all the silver and gold that thou shalt find in all the province of Babylon, and that the people is willing to offer, and that the priests shall offer of their own accord to the house of their God, which is in Jerusalem,

YLT_Original: therefore thou dost speedily buy with this money, bullocks, rams, lambs, and their presents, and their libations, and dost bring them near to the altar of the house of your God that  in Jerusalem,
YLT_Paraphrased: so you buy the money, the bullocks, the lambs, and the gifts, and the drink, and the dost bring them to the altar of the house of God.
DRA_Original: Take freely, and buy diligently with this money, calves, rams, lambs, with the sacrifices and libations of them, and offer them upon the altar of the temple of your God, that is in Jerusalem.

YLT_Original: and that which to thee and to thy brethren is good to do with the rest of the silver and gold, according to the will of your God ye do.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "as for the rest of the silver and gold, according to God's will, you do well."
DRA_Original: And if it seem good to thee, and to thy brethren to do any thing with the rest of the silver and gold, do it according to the will of your God.

YLT_Original: `And the vessels that are given to thee, for the service of the house of thy God, make perfect before the God of Jerusalem;
YLT_Paraphrased: the vessels you give to God, for the sake of God's house, will be perfect before the Lord of Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: The vessels also, that are given thee for the sacrifice of the house of thy God, deliver thou in the sight of God in Jerusalem.

YLT_Original: and the rest of the needful things of the house of thy God, that it falleth to thee to give, thou dost give from the treasure-house of the king.
YLT_Paraphrased: you give it to the king of the king, the treasure of the king, the king of the king, the king of the king, the king of the king.
DRA_Original: And whatsoever more there shall be need of for the house of thy God, how much soever thou shalt have occasion to spend, it shall be given out of the treasury, and the king's exchequer, and by me.

YLT_Original: `And by me -- I Artaxerxes the king -- is made a decree to all treasurers who  beyond the river, that all that Ezra the priest, scribe of the law of the God of heaven, doth ask of you, be done speedily:
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm Artaxerxes the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king
DRA_Original: I Artaxerxes the king have ordered and decreed to all the keepers of the public chest, that are beyond the river, that whatsoever Esdras the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, you give it without delay,

YLT_Original: Unto silver a hundred talents, and unto wheat a hundred cors, and unto wine a hundred baths, and unto oil a hundred baths, and salt without reckoning;
YLT_Paraphrased: a hundred talents, a hundred cors, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a hundred baths, a
DRA_Original: Unto a hundred talents of silver, and unto a hundred cores of wheat, and unto a hundred bates of wine, and unto a hundred bates of oil, and salt without measure.

YLT_Original: all that  by the decree of the God of heaven, let be done diligently for the house of the God of heaven; for why is there wrath against the kingdom of the king and his sons?
YLT_Paraphrased: for why is the king and his sons angry with the king and his sons?
DRA_Original: All that belongeth to the rites of the God of heaven, let it be given diligently in the house of the God of heaven: lest his wrath should be enkindled against the realm of the king, and of his sons.

YLT_Original: `And to you we are making known, that upon any of the priests and Levites, singers, gatekeepers, Nethinim, and servants of the house of God, tribute and custom there is no authority to lift up.
YLT_Paraphrased: we will tell you, that all the priests and Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, the Nethinim, and the servants of God are not allowed to lift up.
DRA_Original: We give you also to understand concerning all the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nathinites, and ministers of the house of this God, that you have no authority to impose toll or tribute, or custom upon them.

YLT_Original: `And thou, Ezra, according to the wisdom of thy God, that  in thy hand, appoint magistrates and judges who may be judges to all the people who are beyond the river, to all knowing the law of thy God, and he who hath not known ye cause to know;
YLT_Paraphrased: Ezra, according to the wisdom of your God, you have appointed magistrates and judges who can judge all the people who are beyond the river.
DRA_Original: And thou Esdras according to the wisdom of thy God, which is in thy hand, appoint judges and magistrates, that may judge all the people, that is beyond the river, that is, for them who know the law of thy God, yea and the ignorant teach ye freely.

YLT_Original: and any who doth not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, speedily is judgment done upon him, whether to death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of riches, and to bonds.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "if he does not do the law of God and the king's law, he will be punished, whether he dies or not, or he will be condemned to death."
DRA_Original: And whosoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king diligently, judgment shall be executed upon him, either unto death, or unto banishment, or to the confiscation of goods, or at least to prison.

YLT_Original: Blessed  Jehovah, God of our fathers, who hath given such a thing as this in the heart of the king, to beautify the house of Jehovah that  in Jerusalem,
YLT_Paraphrased: God bless the king, who gave us this, to beautify the house of God in Jerusalem.
DRA_Original: Blessed be the Lord the God of our fathers, who hath put this in the king's heart, to glorify the house of the Lord, which is in Jerusalem,

YLT_Original: and unto me hath stretched out kindness before the king and his counsellors, and before all the mighty heads of the king: and I have strengthened myself as the hand of Jehovah my God  upon me, and I gather out of Israel heads to go up with me.
YLT_Paraphrased: I have strengthened my hands and my heart, and I have taken out of Israel the heads of the king and his counsellors.
DRA_Original: And hath inclined his mercy toward me before the king and his counsellors, and all the mighty princes of the king: and I being strengthened by the hand of the Lord my God, which was upon me, gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.

YLT_Original: `I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm a real vine, my father's a farmer.
DRA_Original: I am the true vine; and my Father is the husbandman.

YLT_Original: every branch in me not bearing fruit, He doth take it away, and every one bearing fruit, He doth cleanse by pruning it, that it may bear more fruit;
YLT_Paraphrased: he takes it away, and every one who bears fruit, he cleanses him, that he may bear more fruit;
DRA_Original: Every branch in me, that beareth not fruit, he will take away: and every one that beareth fruit, he will purge it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

YLT_Original: already ye are clean, because of the word that I have spoken to you;
YLT_Paraphrased: you're clean, because I told you I'd tell you something.
DRA_Original: Now you are clean by reason of the word, which I have spoken to you.

YLT_Original: remain in me, and I in you, as the branch is not able to bear fruit of itself, if it may not remain in the vine, so neither ye, if ye may not remain in me.
YLT_Paraphrased: if you don't stay in me, I won't be able to bear fruit, so neither you nor I will be able to bear fruit.
DRA_Original: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abide in the vine, so neither can you, unless you abide in me.

YLT_Original: `I am the vine, ye the branches; he who is remaining in me, and I in him, this one doth bear much fruit, because apart from me ye are not able to do anything;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm a vine, you're a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a branch, and I'm a
DRA_Original: I am the vine: you the branches: he that abideth in me, and I in him, the same beareth much fruit: for without me you can do nothing.

YLT_Original: if any one may not remain in me, he was cast forth without as the branch, and was withered, and they gather them, and cast to fire, and they are burned;
YLT_Paraphrased: he was cast out without as a branch, and he was burned, and they took him, and they burned him, and they burned him.
DRA_Original: If any one abide not in me, he shall be cast forth as a branch, and shall wither, and they shall gather him up, and cast him into the fire, and he burneth.

YLT_Original: if ye may remain in me, and my sayings in you may remain, whatever ye may wish ye shall ask, and it shall be done to you.
YLT_Paraphrased: you can stay with me, and my words will remain with you, whatever you want.
DRA_Original: If you abide in me, and my words abide in you, you shall ask whatever you will, and it shall be done unto you.

YLT_Original: `In this was my Father glorified, that ye may bear much fruit, and ye shall become my disciples.
YLT_Paraphrased: you will be my father, and you will be my disciples.
DRA_Original: In this is my Father glorified; that you bring forth very much fruit, and become my disciples.

YLT_Original: According as the Father did love me, I also loved you, remain in my love;
YLT_Paraphrased: I loved you as a father loved me, and I loved you.
DRA_Original: As the Father hath loved me, I also have loved you. Abide in my love.

YLT_Original: if my commandments ye may keep, ye shall remain in my love, according as I the commands of my Father have kept, and do remain in His love;
YLT_Paraphrased: as I have kept my father's commands, and I love you, you will remain in my love, as I have promised you.
DRA_Original: If you keep my commandments, you shall abide in my love; as I also have kept my Father's commandments, and do abide in his love.

YLT_Original: these things I have spoken to you, that my joy in you may remain, and your joy may be full.
YLT_Paraphrased: I've spoken to you about things I've told you, and I'm happy to keep your joy, and yours, full.
DRA_Original: These things I have spoken to you, that my joy may be in you, and your joy may be filled.

YLT_Original: `This is my command, that ye love one another, according as I did love you;
YLT_Paraphrased: I command you to love each other as I loved you.
DRA_Original: This is my commandment, that you love one another, as I have loved you.

YLT_Original: greater love than this hath no one, that any one his life may lay down for his friends;
YLT_Paraphrased: no one, who would have his life for his friends, would have loved more love than this.
DRA_Original: Greater love than this no man hath, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

YLT_Original: ye are my friends, if ye may do whatever I command you;
YLT_Paraphrased: if you do what I'm telling you, my friends are my friends.
DRA_Original: You are my friends, if you do the things that I command you.

YLT_Original: no more do I call you servants, because the servant hath not known what his lord doth, and you I have called friends, because all things that I heard from my Father, I did make known to you.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm not calling you servants, because the servant doesn't know what his master is doing, and I've called friends, because I've told you everything I've heard from my father.
DRA_Original: I will not now call you servants: for the servant knoweth not what his lord doth. But I have called you friends: because all things whatsoever I have heard of my Father, I have made known to you.

YLT_Original: `Ye did not choose out me, but I chose out you, and did appoint you, that ye might go away, and might bear fruit, and your fruit might remain, that whatever ye may ask of the Father in my name, He may give you.
YLT_Paraphrased: you didn't choose me, but I chose you, and I've appointed you, so you can go, and you can keep your fruit, and your fruit will remain, that what you ask of the Father in my name.
DRA_Original: You have not chosen me: but I have chosen you; and have appointed you, that you should go, and should bring forth fruit; and your fruit should remain: that whatsoever you shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

YLT_Original: `These things I command you, that ye love one another;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, you're gonna love each other.
DRA_Original: These things I command you, that you love one another.

YLT_Original: if the world doth hate you, ye know that it hath hated me before you;
YLT_Paraphrased: you know the world hates you, and you know it hates me.
DRA_Original: If the world hate you, know ye, that it hath hated me before you.

YLT_Original: if of the world ye were, the world its own would have been loving, and because of the world ye are not -- but I chose out of the world -- because of this the world hateth you.
YLT_Paraphrased: the world would love you, and the world would love you, because of the world you were, and the world would love you.
DRA_Original: If you had been of the world, the world would love its own: but because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

YLT_Original: `Remember the word that I said to you, A servant is not greater than his lord; if me they did persecute, you also they will persecute; if my word they did keep, yours also they will keep;
YLT_Paraphrased: remember, my lord, the servant is not bigger than his master, if they do it to me.
DRA_Original: Remember my word that I said to you: The servant is not greater than his master. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you: if they have kept my word, they will keep yours also.

YLT_Original: but all these things will they do to you, because of my name, because they have not known Him who sent me;
YLT_Paraphrased: because of my name, they will do everything to me, because they don't know who sent me;
DRA_Original: But all these things they will do to you for my name's sake: because they know not him who sent me.

YLT_Original: if I had not come and spoken to them, they were not having sin; but now pretext they have not for their sin.
YLT_Paraphrased: they didn't have sin, but they didn't have a reason to sin.
DRA_Original: If I had not come, and spoken to them, they would not have sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

YLT_Original: `He who is hating me, doth hate also my Father;
YLT_Paraphrased: who hates me, he hates my father too.
DRA_Original: He that hateth me, hateth my Father also.

YLT_Original: if I did not do among them the works that no other hath done, they were not having sin, and now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father;
YLT_Paraphrased: they didn't have sin, and now they both saw and hated me and my father, and they didn't want to do anything else.
DRA_Original: If I had not done among them the works that no other man hath done, they would not have sin; but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.

YLT_Original: but -- that the word may be fulfilled that was written in their law -- They hated me without a cause.
YLT_Paraphrased: they hated me for reasons that were not to be known.
DRA_Original: But that the word may be fulfilled which is written in their law: They hated me without cause.

YLT_Original: `And when the Comforter may come, whom I will send to you from the Father -- the Spirit of truth, who from the Father doth come forth, he will testify of me;
YLT_Paraphrased: when the Comforter comes, who will come from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who will come out of the Father, he will testify to me.
DRA_Original: But when the Paraclete cometh, whom I will send you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceedeth from the Father, he shall give testimony of me.

YLT_Original: and ye also do testify, because from the beginning ye are with me.
YLT_Paraphrased: you're also testifying to me from the beginning.
DRA_Original: And you shall give testimony, because you are with me from the beginning.

YLT_Original: And after five days came down the chief priest Ananias, with the elders, and a certain orator -- Tertullus, and they made manifest to the governor [the things] against Paul;
YLT_Paraphrased: after five days, the chief priest Ananias, the elders and the orator Tertullus, and they were clear of Paul;
DRA_Original: And after five days the high priest Ananias came down, with some of the ancients, and one Tertullus an orator, who went to the governor against Paul.

YLT_Original: and he having been called, Tertullus began to accuse , saying, `Much peace enjoying through thee, and worthy deeds being done to this nation through thy forethought,
YLT_Paraphrased: "much peace and good deeds have been done to the nation by your forethought," Tertullus said, "and worthy deeds have been done to the nation."
DRA_Original: And Paul being called for, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying: Whereas through thee we live in much peace, and many things are rectified by thy providence,

YLT_Original: always, also, and everywhere we receive it, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness;
YLT_Paraphrased: and everywhere we're receiving it, we're grateful to be so grateful, Felix, with all thanks.
DRA_Original: We accept it always and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thanksgiving.
