YLT_Original: and that I may not be further tedious to thee, I pray thee to hear us concisely in thy gentleness;
YLT_Paraphrased: I beg you to be gentle with us, for we may not be more tedious to you.
DRA_Original: But that I be no further tedious to thee, I desire thee of thy clemency to hear us in few words.

YLT_Original: for having found this man a pestilence, and moving a dissension to all the Jews through the world -- a ringleader also of the sect of the Nazarenes --
YLT_Paraphrased: the ringleader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the leader of the Nazarenes, the
DRA_Original: We have found this to be a pestilent man, and raising seditions among all the Jews throughout the world, and author of the sedition of the sect of the Nazarenes.

YLT_Original: who also the temple did try to profane, whom also we took, and according to our law did wish to judge,
YLT_Paraphrased: we took the temple, which tried to offend us, and we wanted to judge, and we were trying to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we wanted to judge, and we
DRA_Original: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom, we having apprehended, would also have judged according to our law.

YLT_Original: and Lysias the chief captain having come near, with much violence, out of our hands did take away,
YLT_Paraphrased: Lysias, the chief captain, who was near, took off with much violence, and we were taken away.
DRA_Original: But Lysias the tribune coming upon us, with great violence took him away out of our hands;

YLT_Original: having commanded his accusers to come to thee, from whom thou mayest be able, thyself having examined, to know concerning all these things of which we accuse him;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you can examine all the things we accuse him, and you can know everything about them, if you want to know about them yourself."
DRA_Original: Commanding his accusers to come to thee: of whom thou mayest thyself, by examination, have knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.

YLT_Original: and the Jews also agreed, professing these things to be so.
YLT_Paraphrased: they also agreed to it, saying it was so.
DRA_Original: And the Jews also added, and said that these things were so.

YLT_Original: And Paul answered -- the governor having beckoned to him to speak -- `Knowing  for many years thou hast been a judge to this nation, the more cheerfully the things concerning myself I do answer;
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm glad you know I've been a judge for a long time, the more I answer, the more I'm glad you know I've been a judge for a long time," Paul said.
DRA_Original: Then Paul answered, (the governor making a sign to him to speak:) Knowing that for many years thou hast been judge over this nation, I will with good courage answer for myself.

YLT_Original: thou being able to know that it is not more than twelve days to me since I went up to worship in Jerusalem,
YLT_Paraphrased: I've been to Jerusalem for 12 days, and I've been to Jerusalem for 12 days.
DRA_Original: For thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days, since I went up to adore in Jerusalem:

YLT_Original: and neither in the temple did they find me reasoning with any one, or making a dissension of the multitude, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city;
YLT_Paraphrased: they didn't find me reasoning with anyone, or in the temple, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city;
DRA_Original: And neither in the temple did they find me disputing with any man, or causing any concourse of the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:

YLT_Original: nor are they able to prove against me the things concerning which they now accuse me.
YLT_Paraphrased: they can prove to me the things they accuse me of now.
DRA_Original: Neither can they prove unto thee the things whereof they now accuse me.

YLT_Original: `And I confess this to thee, that, according to the way that they call a sect, so serve I the God of the fathers, believing all things that in the law and the prophets have been written,
YLT_Paraphrased: I confess, I'm a member of the sect, so I believe everything in the Bible and the prophet's words.
DRA_Original: But this I confess to thee, that according to the way, which they call a heresy, so do I serve the Father and my God, believing all things which are written in the law and the prophets:

YLT_Original: having hope toward God, which they themselves also wait for,  there is about to be a rising again of the dead, both of righteous and unrighteous;
YLT_Paraphrased: there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of good and bad, and the hope of God, which they themselves await;
DRA_Original: Having hope in God, which these also themselves look for, that there shall be a resurrection of the just and unjust.

YLT_Original: and in this I do exercise myself, to have a conscience void of offence toward God and men always.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm always exercising my conscience, and I'm always thinking of God and men's sins.
DRA_Original: And herein do I endeavour to have always a conscience without offence toward God, and towards men.

YLT_Original: `And after many years I came, about to do kind acts to my nation, and offerings,
YLT_Paraphrased: I've been here for a long time, and I've done a lot of things to my nation, and I've offered them.
DRA_Original: Now after many years, I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings, and vows.

YLT_Original: in which certain Jews from Asia did find me purified in the temple, not with multitude, nor with tumult,
YLT_Paraphrased: in the temple, not with crowds, nor with confusion, but with purity, I found myself purified by the temple.
DRA_Original: In which I was found purified in the temple: neither with multitude, nor with tumult.

YLT_Original: whom it behoveth to be present before thee, and to accuse, if they had anything against me,
YLT_Paraphrased: whoever is present before you, and who accuses me, he must be accused.
DRA_Original: But certain Jews of Asia, who ought to be present before thee, and to accuse, if they had any thing against me:

YLT_Original: or let these same say if they found any unrighteousness in me in my standing before the sanhedrim,
YLT_Paraphrased: if I'm in front of the sanhedrin, I'll tell you the same thing, if I find any of my sins.
DRA_Original: Or let these men themselves say, if they found in me any iniquity, when standing before the council,

YLT_Original: except concerning this one voice, in which I cried, standing among them -- Concerning a rising again of the dead I am judged to-day by you.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm judged by you today, for the voice I cried, standing among them -- Concerning the dead I'm judged today. "
DRA_Original: Except it be for this one voice only that I cried, standing among them, Concerning the resurrection of the dead am I judged this day by you.

YLT_Original: And having heard these things, Felix delayed them -- having known more exactly of the things concerning the way -- saying, `When Lysias the chief captain may come down, I will know fully the things concerning you;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "when Lysias the chief captain is down, I'll know everything about you, Felix," he said, "when Lysias the captain is down, I'll know everything."
DRA_Original: And Felix put them off, having most certain knowledge of this way, saying: When Lysias the tribune shall come down, I will hear you.

YLT_Original: having given also a direction to the centurion to keep Paul, to let  also have liberty, and to forbid none of his own friends to minister or to come near to him.
YLT_Paraphrased: he gave Paul a direction to keep Paul, to let him go, and to forbid any of his friends to come near him.
DRA_Original: And he commanded a centurion to keep him, and that he should be easy, and that he should not prohibit any of his friends to minister unto him.

YLT_Original: And after certain days, Felix having come with Drusilla his wife, being a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith toward Christ,
YLT_Paraphrased: when he came to Drusilla, he was a Jewess, and he was a Jewess to Paul, and he was a Jewess to him.
DRA_Original: And after some days, Felix, coming with Drusilla his wife, who was a Jew, sent for Paul, and heard of him the faith, that is in Christ Jesus.

YLT_Original: and he reasoning concerning righteousness, and temperance, and the judgment that is about to be, Felix, having become afraid, answered, `For the present be going, and having got time, I will call for thee;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'll call you, Felix, for the time being, and I'll call you, for the time being, for the sake of justice, temperance, and the judgment that's about to be," he said.
DRA_Original: And as he treated of justice, and chastity, and of the judgment to come, Felix being terrified, answered: For this time, go thy way: but when I have a convenient time, I will send for thee.

YLT_Original: and at the same time also hoping that money shall be given to him by Paul, that he may release him, therefore, also sending for him the oftener, he was conversing with him;
YLT_Paraphrased: he was also talking to Paul, hoping that Paul would give him money, so that he would release him, so he was talking to him;
DRA_Original: Hoping also withal, that money should be given him by Paul; for which cause also oftentimes sending for him, he spoke with him.

YLT_Original: and two years having been fulfilled, Felix received a successor, Porcius Festus; Felix also willing to lay a favour on the Jews, left Paul bound.
YLT_Paraphrased: Felix was given a successor, Porcius Festus, who was willing to give Paul a favor.
DRA_Original: But when two years were ended, Felix had for successor Portius Festus. And Felix being willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.

YLT_Original: And Job answereth and saith: --
YLT_Paraphrased: he says: -- He's a job, and he's a job, and he's a job.
DRA_Original: Then Job answered, and said:

YLT_Original: What -- thou hast helped the powerless, Saved an arm not strong!
YLT_Paraphrased: you saved the helpless, you saved your arm!
DRA_Original: Whose helper art thou? is it of him that is weak? and dost thou hold up the arm of him that has no strength?

YLT_Original: What -- thou hast given counsel to the unwise, And wise plans in abundance made known.
YLT_Paraphrased: you gave advice to the foolish, and wise plans were made clear.
DRA_Original: To whom hast thou given counsel? perhaps to him that hath no wisdom, and thou hast shewn thy very great prudence.

YLT_Original: With whom hast thou declared words? And whose breath came forth from thee?
YLT_Paraphrased: who spoke to you with words? And who gave you breath?
DRA_Original: Whom hast thou desired to teach? was it not him that made life?

YLT_Original: The Rephaim are formed, Beneath the waters, also their inhabitants.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Beneath the water, the inhabitants of the Rephaim.
DRA_Original: Behold the giants groan under the waters, and they that dwell with them.

YLT_Original: Naked  Sheol over-against Him, And there is no covering to destruction.
YLT_Paraphrased: sheol over him, and there's nothing to destroy.
DRA_Original: Hell is naked before him, and there is no covering for destruction.

YLT_Original: Stretching out the north over desolation, Hanging the earth upon nothing,
YLT_Paraphrased: the north is stretched out over the desert, and nothing is left to hang on.
DRA_Original: He stretched out the north over the empty space, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.

YLT_Original: Binding up the waters in His thick clouds, And the cloud is not rent under them.
YLT_Paraphrased: the clouds are thick, and the clouds are not broken by them.
DRA_Original: He bindeth up the waters in his clouds, so that they break not out and fall down together.

YLT_Original: Taking hold of the face of the throne, Spreading over it His cloud.
YLT_Paraphrased: he spread his cloud over the throne, and spread his cloud over the throne.
DRA_Original: He withholdeth the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud over it.

YLT_Original: A limit He hath placed on the waters, Unto the boundary of light with darkness.
YLT_Paraphrased: limit He's limiting the water, so the light is not in the dark.
DRA_Original: He hath set bounds about the waters, till light and darkness come to an end.

YLT_Original: Pillars of the heavens do tremble, And they wonder because of His rebuke.
YLT_Paraphrased: the heavens tremble, and they wonder at the rebuke.
DRA_Original: The pillars of heaven tremble, and dread at his beck.

YLT_Original: By His power He hath quieted the sea, And by His understanding smitten the proud.
YLT_Paraphrased: he quieted the sea, and he struck the proud.
DRA_Original: By his power the seas are suddenly gathered together, and his wisdom has struck the proud one.

YLT_Original: By His Spirit the heavens He beautified, Formed hath His hand the fleeing serpent.
YLT_Paraphrased: the heavens are beautified, the form of the serpent is formed.
DRA_Original: His spirit hath adorned the heavens, and his obstetric hand brought forth the winding serpent.

YLT_Original: Lo, these  the borders of His way, And how little a matter is heard of Him, And the thunder of His might Who doth understand?
YLT_Paraphrased: how little a matter is heard of Him, and the thunder of his power, who knows?
DRA_Original: Lo, these things are said in part of his ways: and seeing we have heard scarce a little drop of his word, who shall be able to behold the thunder of his greatness?

YLT_Original: `One wounded, bruised, or cut in the member doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah;
YLT_Paraphrased: one wounded, bruised, or cut in the body of the congregation is not allowed to enter the assembly;
DRA_Original: An eunuch, whose testicles are broken or cut away, or yard cut off, shall not enter into the church of the Lord.

YLT_Original: a bastard doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of him doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: a bastard son of a bitch doesn't go to the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of him doesn't go to the assembly.
DRA_Original: A mamzer, that is to say, one born of a prostitute, shall not enter into the church of the Lord, until the tenth generation.

YLT_Original: `An Ammonite and a Moabite doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of them doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah -- to the age;
YLT_Paraphrased: Ammonite and Moabite are not allowed into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of them don't enter the assembly of Jehovah -- to the age;
DRA_Original: The Ammonite and the Moabite, even after the tenth generation shall not enter into the church of the Lord for ever:

YLT_Original: because that they have not come before you with bread and with water in the way, in your coming out from Egypt, and because he hath hired against thee Balaam son of Beor, of Pethor of Aram-Naharaim, to revile thee;
YLT_Paraphrased: because he hired Balaam son of Beor, of Aram-Naharaim, of Pethor of Aram-Naharaim, to come to you, and he hired against you Balaam son of Beor.
DRA_Original: Because they would not meet you with bread and water in the way, when you came out of Egypt: hand because they hired against thee Balaam, the son of Beer, from Mesopotamia in Syria, to curse thee.

YLT_Original: and Jehovah thy God hath not been willing to hearken unto Balaam, and Jehovah thy God doth turn for thee the reviling to a blessing, because Jehovah thy God hath loved thee;
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah your God has not been pleased with Balaam, and Jehovah your God has turned to you a blessing, because Jehovah your God loves you.
DRA_Original: And the Lord thy God would not hear Balaam, and he turned his cursing into thy blessing, because he loved thee.

YLT_Original: thou dost not seek their peace and their good all thy days -- to the age.
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't want peace and good for the whole of your life -- to the age.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt not make peace with them, neither shalt thou seek their prosperity all the days of thy life for ever.

YLT_Original: `Thou dost not abominate an Edomite, for thy brother he ; thou dost not abominate an Egyptian, for a sojourner thou hast been in his land;
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't have to abominate an Edomite, for your brother, you don't have to abominate an Egyptian, for a stranger you've been in Egypt.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt not abhor the Edomite, because he is thy brother: nor the Egyptian, because thou wast a stranger in his land.

YLT_Original: sons who are begotten of them, a third generation of them, doth enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: the third generation of the sons of the fathers, the third generation of the sons of the fathers, the third generation of the sons of the fathers.
DRA_Original: They that are born of them, in the third generation shall enter into the church of the Lord.

YLT_Original: `When a camp goeth out against thine enemies, then thou hast kept from every evil thing.
YLT_Paraphrased: when the camp is against your enemies, you'll keep your enemies out of it.
DRA_Original: When thou goest out to war against thy enemies, thou shalt keep thyself from every evil thing.

YLT_Original: `When there is in thee a man who is not clean, from an accident at night -- then he hath gone out unto the outside of the camp -- he doth not come in unto the midst of the camp --
YLT_Paraphrased: when there's a guy who's not clean, he's not coming to the camp -- he's not going to the camp -- he's not going to the camp --
DRA_Original: If there be among you any man, that is defiled in a dream by night, he shall go forth out of the camp.

YLT_Original: and it hath been, at the turning of the evening, he doth bathe with water, and at the going in of the sun he doth come in unto the midst of the camp.
YLT_Paraphrased: he bathes in the water, and at the rising of the sun he comes to the camp.
DRA_Original: And shall not return, before he be washed with water in the evening: and after sunset he shall return into the camp.

YLT_Original: `And a station thou hast at the outside of the camp, and thou hast gone out thither without,
YLT_Paraphrased: you're at the outside of the camp, and you're gone.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt have a place without the camp, to which thou mayst go for the necessities of nature,

YLT_Original: and a nail thou hast on thy staff, and it hath been, in thy sitting without, that thou hast digged with it, and turned back, and covered thy filth;
YLT_Paraphrased: you have a nail on your staff, and you've done it in your sitting, and you've turned around and covered your butt with it, and you've done it.
DRA_Original: Carrying a paddle at thy girdle. And when thou sittest down, thou shalt dig round about, and with the earth that is dug up thou shalt cover

YLT_Original: for Jehovah thy God is walking up and down in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give thine enemies before thee, and thy camp hath been holy, and He doth not see in thee the nakedness of anything, and hath turned back from after thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah God is walking in the camp, and he's going to deliver you, and he's going to destroy your camp, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in you, and he's not looking in
DRA_Original: That which thou art eased of: (for the Lord thy God walketh in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give up thy enemies to thee:) and let thy camp be holy, and let no uncleanness appear therein, lest he go away from thee.

YLT_Original: `Thou dost not shut up a servant unto his lord, who is delivered unto thee from his lord;
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't shut up a servant to your lord, who's going to be delivered to you by your lord.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt not deliver to his master the servant that is fled to thee.

YLT_Original: with thee he doth dwell, in thy midst, in the place which he chooseth within one of thy gates, where it is pleasing to him; thou dost not oppress him.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's not going to be in your midst, in the place where he chooses to go to, where he likes you.
DRA_Original: He shall dwell with thee ill the place that shall please him, and shall rest, in one of thy cities: give him no trouble.

YLT_Original: `There is not a whore among the daughters of Israel, nor is there a whoremonger among the sons of Israel;
YLT_Paraphrased: there's no whore in Israel, nor is there a whore in Israel.
DRA_Original: There shall be no whore among the daughters of Israel, nor whoremonger among the sons of Israel.

YLT_Original: thou dost not bring a gift of a whore, or a price of a dog, into the house of Jehovah thy God, for any vow; for the abomination of Jehovah thy God  even both of them.
YLT_Paraphrased: for the abomination of Jehovah thy God, both of them, you don't bring a gift of a whore, or a dog, for any promise.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt not offer the hire of a strumpet, nor the price of a dog, in the house of the Lord thy God, whatsoever it be that thou hast vowed: because both these are an abomination to the Lord thy God.

YLT_Original: `Thou dost not lend in usury to thy brother; usury of money, usury of food, usury of anything which is lent on usury.
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't lend usury to your brother, usury of money, usury of food, usury of everything that's given to usury.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt not lend to thy brother money to usury, nor corn, nor any other thing:

YLT_Original: To a stranger thou mayest lend in usury, and to thy brother thou dost not lend in usury, so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in every putting forth of thy hand on the land whither thou goest in to possess it.
YLT_Paraphrased: you can lend usury to strangers, but you don't lend usury to your brother, so that God blesses you in every step of your journey.
DRA_Original: But to the stranger. To thy brother thou shalt lend that which he wanteth, without usury: that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all thy works in the land, which thou shalt go in to possess.

YLT_Original: `When thou vowest a vow to Jehovah thy God, thou dost not delay to complete it; for Jehovah thy God doth certainly require it from thee, and it hath been in thee -- sin.
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't have to wait till you make a promise to God, for God's sake, you have to complete it, for God's sake.
DRA_Original: When thou hast made a vow to the Lord thy God, thou shalt not delay to pay it: because the Lord thy God will require it. And if thou delay, it shall be imputed to thee for a sin.

YLT_Original: `And when thou forbearest to vow, it is not in thee a sin.
YLT_Paraphrased: it's not a sin to promise, but it's not a sin to promise.
DRA_Original: If thou wilt not promise, thou shalt be without sin.

YLT_Original: The produce of thy lips thou dost keep, and hast done , as thou hast vowed to Jehovah thy God; a free-will-offering, which thou hast spoken with thy mouth.
YLT_Paraphrased: you keep your lips, and you have done it, as you promised your God.
DRA_Original: But that which is once gone out of thy lips, thou shalt observe, and shalt do as thou hast promised to the Lord thy God, and hast spoken with thy own will and with thy own mouth.

YLT_Original: `When thou comest in unto the vineyard of thy neighbour, then thou hast eaten grapes, according to thy desire, thy sufficiency; but into thy vessel thou dost not put .
YLT_Paraphrased: when you come to your neighbour's vineyard, you eat grapes, according to your desire, your supply; but you don't put them in your ship.
DRA_Original: Going into thy neighbour's vineyard, thou mayst eat as many grapes as thou pleasest: but must carry none out with thee:

YLT_Original: When thou comest in among the standing-corn of thy neighbour, then thou hast plucked the ears with thy hand, but a sickle thou dost not wave over the standing-corn of thy neighbour.
YLT_Paraphrased: then you're going to grab your ears with your hand, but you don't wave your hand over the standing corn of your neighbour.
DRA_Original: If thou go into thy friend's corn, thou mayst break the ears, and rub them in thy hand: but not reap them with a sickle.

YLT_Original: And it cometh to pass when Jabin king of Hazor heareth, that he sendeth unto Jobab king of Madon, and unto the king of Shimron, and unto the king of Achshaph,
YLT_Paraphrased: when Jabin king of Hazor hears, he will send to the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the
DRA_Original: And when Jabin king of Asor had heard these things, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Semeron, and to the king of Achsaph:

YLT_Original: and unto the kings who  on the north in the hill-country, and in the plain south of Chinneroth, and in the low country, and in the elevations of Dor, on the west,
YLT_Paraphrased: in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the south, in the plains of the south, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south, in the mountains of the south,
DRA_Original: And to the kings of the north, that dwelt in the mountains and in the plains over against the south side of Ceneroth, and in the levels and the countries of Dor by the sea side:

YLT_Original: the Canaanite on the east, and on the west, and the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite in the hill-country, and the Hivite under Hermon, in the land of Mizpeh --
YLT_Paraphrased: the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebus
DRA_Original: To the Chanaanites also on the ease and on the west, and the Amorrhite, and the Hethite, and the Pherezite, and the Jebusite in the mountains: to the Hevite also who dwelt at the foot of Hermon in the land of Maspha.

YLT_Original: and they go out, they and all their camps with them, a people numerous, as the sand which  on the sea-shore for multitude, and horse and charioteer very many;
YLT_Paraphrased: they go out, they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place, and they're all over the place
DRA_Original: And they all came out with their troops, a people exceeding numerous as the sand that is on the sea shore, their horses also and chariots a very great multitude,

YLT_Original: and all these kings are met together, and they come and encamp together at the waters of Merom, to fight with Israel.
YLT_Paraphrased: they meet all the kings, and they come to the water, and they fight with Israel.
DRA_Original: And all these kings assembled together at the waters of Merom, to fight against Israel.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah saith unto Joshua, `Be not afraid of their presence, for to-morrow about this time I am giving all of them wounded before Israel; their horses thou dost hough, and their chariots burn with fire.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "don't worry, for I'll be there tomorrow, and I'll be there with them all, and their horses and their chariots will burn with fire."
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to Josue: Fear them not: for to morrow at this same hour I will deliver all these to be slain in the sight of Israel: thou shalt hamstring their horses, and thou shalt burn their chariots with fire.

YLT_Original: And Joshua cometh, and all the people of war with him, against them by the waters of Merom suddenly, and they fall on them;
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua's coming, and all the people of the war will be against him, and they will fall on him;
DRA_Original: And Josue came, and all the army with him, against them to the waters of Merom on a sudden, and fell upon them.

YLT_Original: and Jehovah giveth them into the hand of Israel, and they smite them and pursue them unto the great Zidon, and unto Misrephoth-Maim, and unto the valley of Mizpeh eastward, and they smite them, till he hath not left to them a remnant;
YLT_Paraphrased: they are taken to the great Zidon, and they are pursued by the great Zidon, and they are pursued by Misrephoth-Maim, and the valley of Mizpeh east.
DRA_Original: And the Lord delivered them into the hands of Israel. And they defeated them, and chased them as far as the great Sidon, and the waters of Maserophot, and the field of Masphe, which is on the east side thereof. He slew them all, so as to leave no remains of them:

YLT_Original: and Joshua doth to them as Jehovah said to him; their horses he hath houghed, and their chariots burnt with fire.
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua doth to them as Jehovah said to him; his horses and his chariots are burned with fire.
DRA_Original: And he did as the Lord had commanded him, he hamstringed their horses and burned their chariots.

YLT_Original: And Joshua turneth back at that time, and captureth Hazor, and its king he hath smitten by the sword; for Hazor formerly  head of all these kingdoms;
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua turned and took Hazor, and the king of Hazor was struck by the sword; for Hazor was once the head of all the kingdoms;
DRA_Original: And presently turning back he took Asor: and slew the king thereof with the sword. Now Asor of old was the head of all these kingdoms.

YLT_Original: and they smite every person who  in it by the mouth of the sword; he hath devoted -- he hath not left any one breathing, and Hazor he hath burnt with fire;
YLT_Paraphrased: he smote every man who was in it with the sword, and he burned with fire; he did not leave anyone alive, and Hazor burned with fire.
DRA_Original: And he cut off all the souls that abode there: he left not in it any remains, but utterly destroyed all, and burned the city itself with fire.

YLT_Original: and all the cities of these kings, and all their kings, hath Joshua captured, and he smiteth them by the mouth of the sword; he devoted them, as Moses, servant of Jehovah, commanded.
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua captured all the cities of the kings, and all the kings of the kingdom, and he smote them with the sword.
DRA_Original: And he took and put to the sword and destroyed all the cities round about, and their kings, as Moses the servant of God had commanded him.

YLT_Original: Only, all the cities which are standing by their hill, Israel hath not burned them, save Hazor only,  hath Joshua burnt;
YLT_Paraphrased: only Hazor, the only one who stood by the hill, was burned, and Joshua burned;
DRA_Original: Except the cities that were on hills and high places, the rest Israel burned: only Asor that was very strong he consumed with fire.

YLT_Original: and all the spoil of these cities, and the cattle, have the sons of Israel spoiled for themselves; only, every human being they have smitten by the mouth of the sword, till their destroying them; they have not left any one breathing.
YLT_Paraphrased: they have destroyed the cities, the cattle, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men, the men
DRA_Original: And the children of Israel divided among themselves all the spoil of these cities and the cattle, killing all the men.

YLT_Original: As Jehovah commanded Moses His servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so hath Joshua done; he hath not turned aside a thing of all that Jehovah commanded Moses.
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah commanded Moses, and Moses did, and Joshua did not. He did not turn away from what Jehovah commanded Moses.
DRA_Original: As the Lord had commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Josue, and he accomplished all: he left not one thing undone of all the commandments which the Lord had commanded Moses.

YLT_Original: And Joshua taketh all this land: the hill-country, and all the south, and all the land of Goshen, and the low country, and the plain, even the hill-country of Israel and its low lands,
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua took all the land, the hills, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains, the plains
DRA_Original: So Josue took all the country of the hills, and of the south, and the land of Gosen, and the plains and the west country, and the mountain of Israel, and the plains thereof:

YLT_Original: from the mount of Halak, which is going up  Seir, and unto Baal-Gad, in the valley of Lebanon, under mount Hermon; and all their kings he hath captured, and he smiteth them, and putteth them to death.
YLT_Paraphrased: he took the king of Halak, and he was taken to Baal-Gad, in the valley of Lebanon, by the king of Hermon.
DRA_Original: And part of the mountain that goeth up to Seir as far as Baalgad, by the plain of Libanus under mount Hermon: all their kings he took, smote and slew.

YLT_Original: Many days hath Joshua made with all these kings war;
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua has been fighting all these kings for days;
DRA_Original: Josue made war a long time against these kings.

YLT_Original: there hath not been a city which made peace with the sons of Israel save the Hivite, inhabitants of Gibeon; the whole they have taken in battle;
YLT_Paraphrased: the city of Jerusalem, which has not been conquered by the sons of Israel, but the Gibeonites, the inhabitants of the city;
DRA_Original: There was hot a city that delivered itself to the children of Israel, except the Hevite, who dwelt in Gabaon: for he took all by fight.

YLT_Original: for from Jehovah it hath been to strengthen their heart, to meet in battle with Israel, in order to devote them, so that they have no grace, but in order to destroy them, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
YLT_Paraphrased: to strengthen their heart, to meet with Israel, to fight them, so that they would not be able to be forgiven, as God commanded Moses.
DRA_Original: For it was the sentence of the Lord, that their hearts should be hardened, and they should fight against Israel, and fall, and should not deserve any clemency, and should be destroyed as the Lord had commanded Moses.

YLT_Original: And Joshua cometh at that time, and cutteth off the Anakim from the hill-country, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, even from all the hill-country of Judah, and from all the hill-country of Israel; with their cities hath Joshua devoted them.
YLT_Paraphrased: from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the hill, from the
DRA_Original: At that time Josue came and cut off the Enacims from the mountains, from Hebron, and Dabir, and Anab, and from all the mountain of Juda and Israel, and destroyed their cities.

YLT_Original: There hath not been left Anakim in the land of the sons of Israel; only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, were they left.
YLT_Paraphrased: they were not left in the land of the sons of Israel, only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod.
DRA_Original: He left not any of the stock of the Enacims, in the land of the children of Israel: except the cities of Gaza, and Geth, and Azotus, in which alone they were left.

YLT_Original: And Joshua taketh the whole of the land, according to all that Jehovah hath spoken unto Moses, and Joshua giveth it for an inheritance to Israel according to their divisions, by their tribes; and the land hath rest from war.
YLT_Paraphrased: Joshua will take the whole country, according to the words of Moses and Joshua, and Joshua will give it to Israel according to the division of the tribes.
DRA_Original: So Josue took all the land, as the Lord spoke to Moses, and delivered it in possession to the children of Israel, according to their divisions and tribes. And the land rested from wars.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm telling you, Moses, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you,
DRA_Original: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

YLT_Original: `When any person doth sin, and hath committed a trespass against Jehovah, and hath lied to his fellow concerning a deposit, or concerning fellowship, or concerning violent robbery, or hath oppressed his fellow;
YLT_Paraphrased: anyone who sins, and he has committed a sin against God, and he has lied to his fellow about a deposit, or about a friend, or about a robbery, or about a violent robbery, or has oppressed his friend.
DRA_Original: Whosoever shall sin, and despising the Lord, shall deny to his neighbour the thing delivered to his keeping, which was committed to his trust; or shall by force extort any thing, or commit oppression;

YLT_Original: or hath found a lost thing, and hath lied concerning it, and hath sworn to a falsehood, concerning one of all  which man doth, sinning in them:
YLT_Paraphrased: he found a lost thing, and lied about it, and swore to a lie, about all the things that man does, sinning in them:
DRA_Original: Or shall find a thing lost, and denying it, shall also swear falsely, or shall do any other of the many things, wherein men are wont to sin:

YLT_Original: `Then it hath been, when he sinneth, and hath been guilty, that he hath returned the plunder which he hath taken violently away, or the thing which he hath got by oppression, or the deposit which hath been deposited with him, or the lost thing which he hath found;
YLT_Paraphrased: he returned the plunder he took violently, or the thing he took from him, or the deposit he had taken from him, or the thing he had taken from him, or the thing he had taken from him.
DRA_Original: Being convicted of the offence, he shall restore

YLT_Original: or all that concerning which he sweareth falsely, he hath even repaid it in its principal, and its fifth he is adding to it; to him whose it  he giveth it in the day of his guilt-offering.
YLT_Paraphrased: he has even paid him in the principal, and the fifth he adds to him, who gave him in the day of his confession.
DRA_Original: All that he would have gotten by fraud, in the principal, and the fifth part besides to the owner, whom he wronged.

YLT_Original: `And his guilt-offering he bringeth in to Jehovah, a ram, a perfect one, out of the flock, at thy estimation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priest,
YLT_Paraphrased: he brings a ram, a perfect ram, from the flock, at your estimation, for a sacrifice, to the priest, and he brings it to the priest.
DRA_Original: Moreover for his sin he shall offer a ram without blemish out of the flock, and shall give it to the priest, according to the estimation and measure of the offence:

YLT_Original: and the priest hath made atonement for him before Jehovah, and it hath been forgiven him, concerning one thing of all that he doth, by being guilty therein.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest has forgiven him, and he has forgiven him for what he has done, for one thing. "
DRA_Original: And he shall pray for him before the Lord, and he shall have forgiveness for every thing in doing of which he hath sinned.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm telling you, Moses, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you,
DRA_Original: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

YLT_Original: `Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This  a law of the burnt-offering (it  the burnt-offering, because of the burning on the altar all the night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar is burning on it,)
YLT_Paraphrased: the law of the burnt-out offering (it's the burnt-out offering, because the fire burns the altar all night, and the fire burns the altar.
DRA_Original: Command Aaron and his sons: This is the law of a holocaust: It shall be burnt upon the altar, all night until morning: the fire shall be of the same altar.

YLT_Original: that the priest hath put on his long robe of fine linen, and his fine linen trousers he doth put on his flesh, and hath lifted up the ashes which the fire consumeth with the burnt-offering on the altar, and hath put them near the altar;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest's robe is fine linen, and his fine linen trousers are on his body, and he's lifted the ashes from the altar.
DRA_Original: The priest shall be vested with the tunick and the linen breeches, and he shall take up the ashes of that which the devouring fire hath burnt, and putting them beside the altar,

YLT_Original: and he hath stripped off his garments, and hath put on other garments, and hath brought out the ashes unto the outside of the camp, unto a clean place.
YLT_Paraphrased: he stripped off his clothes, and put on another, and took the ashes to the outside of the camp, to a clean place.
DRA_Original: Shall put off his former vestments, and being clothed with others, shall carry them forth without the camp, and shall cause them to be consumed to dust in a very clean place,

YLT_Original: `And the fire on the altar is burning on it, it is not quenched, and the priest hath burned on it wood morning by morning, and hath arranged on it the burnt-offering, and hath made perfume on it  the fat of the peace-offerings;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest burns the altar, and the priest burns the altar, and the priest burns the altar, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire on him, and he's got a fire
DRA_Original: And the fire on the altar shall always burn, and the priest shall feed it, putting wood on it every day in the morning, and laying on the holocaust, shall burn thereupon the fat of the peace offerings.

YLT_Original: fire is continually burning on the altar, it is not quenched.
YLT_Paraphrased: the altar is burning constantly, and it's not extinguished.
DRA_Original: This is the perpetual fire which shall never go out on the altar.

YLT_Original: `And this  a law of the present: sons of Aaron have brought it near before Jehovah unto the front of the altar,
YLT_Paraphrased: and this is the law of the present: The sons of Aaron have been near the altar before the altar.
DRA_Original: This is the law of the sacrifice and libations, which the children of Aaron shall offer before the Lord, and before the altar.

YLT_Original: and  hath lifted up of it with his hand from the flour of the present, and from its oil, and all the frankincense which  on the present, and hath made perfume on the altar, sweet fragrance -- its memorial to Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: the hand of the flour, the oil, the oil, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume, the perfume
DRA_Original: The priest shall take a handful of the flour that is tempered with oil, and all the frankincense that is put upon the flour: and he shall burn it on the altar for a memorial of most sweet odour to the Lord:

YLT_Original: `And the remnant of it do Aaron and his sons eat;  unleavened things it is eaten, in the holy place, in the court of the tent of meeting they do eat it.
YLT_Paraphrased: Aaron and his sons eat it in the holy place, in the tent of the meeting, they eat it.
DRA_Original: And the part of the flour that is left, Aaron and his sons shall eat, without leaven: and he shall eat it in the holy place of the court of the tabernacle.

YLT_Original: It is not baken  any thing fermented, their portion I have given it, out of My fire-offerings; it  most holy, like the sin-offering, and like the guilt-offering.
YLT_Paraphrased: it's not a baked thing, it's a gift, like the sin-offering, like the guilt-offering, like the offering.
DRA_Original: And therefore it shall not be leavened, because part thereof is offered for the burnt sacrifice of the Lord. It shall be most holy, as that which is offered for sin and for trespass.

YLT_Original: Every male among the sons of Aaron doth eat it -- a statute age-during to your generations, out of the fire-offerings of Jehovah: all that cometh against them is holy.'
YLT_Paraphrased: all the sons of Aaron are eating it - a time of the fire, from the fire of the Lord: 'All that is against them is holy.'
DRA_Original: The males only of the race of Aaron shall eat it. It shall be an ordinance everlasting in your generations concerning the sacrifices of the Lord: Every one that toucheth them shall be sanctified.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm telling you, Moses, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you,
DRA_Original: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

YLT_Original: `This  an offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they bring near to Jehovah in the day of his being anointed; a tenth of the ephah of flour  a continual present, half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening;
YLT_Paraphrased: it's a gift from Aaron and his sons, which they bring to the day of the Lord, a tenth of the ephah of flour, half of it in the morning, and half in the afternoon.
DRA_Original: This is the oblation of Aaron, and of his sons, which they must offer to the Lord, in the day of their anointing: They shall offer the tenth part of an ephi of flour for a perpetual sacrifice, half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening:

YLT_Original: on a girdel with oil it is made -- fried thou dost bring it in; baked pieces of the present thou dost bring near, a sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: the girdle with oil is made - the oil is baked - the fragrance of the oil is pleasant to the God.
DRA_Original: It shall be tempered with oil, and shall be fried in a fryingpan.

YLT_Original: `And the priest who is anointed in his stead, from among his sons, doth make it, -- a statute age-during of Jehovah: it is completely perfumed;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest who is anointed by his sons, he makes it, - a statute of the age of God: It's completely perfumed;
DRA_Original: And the priest that rightfully succeedeth his father, shall offer it hot, for a most sweet odour to the Lord, and it shall be wholly burnt on the altar.

YLT_Original: and every present of a priest is a whole burnt-offering; it is not eaten.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest's whole body is burned, not eaten. "
DRA_Original: For every sacrifice of the priest shall be consumed with fire, neither shall any man eat thereof.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm telling you, Moses, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you,
DRA_Original: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

YLT_Original: `Speak unto Aaron and unto his sons, saying, This  a law of the sin-offering: in the place where the burnt-offering is slaughtered is the sin-offering slaughtered before Jehovah; it  most holy.
YLT_Paraphrased: the place where the burnt-out offering is killed is the place where the sin is most holy, and the place where the sacrifice is most holy is the place where the sacrifice is sacrificed.
DRA_Original: Say to Aaron and his sons: This is the law of the victim for sin: in the place where the holocaust is offered, it shall be immolated before the Lord. It is holy of holies.

YLT_Original: `The priest who is making atonement with it doth eat it, in the holy place it is eaten, in the court of the tent of meeting;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest who makes the sacrifice is eating it in the holy place, in the tent of the meeting;
DRA_Original: The priest that offereth it, shall eat it in a holy place, in the court of the tabernacle.

YLT_Original: all that cometh against its flesh is holy, and when  of its blood is sprinkled on the garment, that on which it is sprinkled thou dost wash in the holy place;
YLT_Paraphrased: when the blood is sprinkled on the garment, the holy place is washed with holy water;
DRA_Original: Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof, shall be sanctified. If a garment be sprinkled with the blood thereof, it shall be washed in a holy place.

YLT_Original: and an earthen vessel in which it is boiled is broken, and if in a brass vessel it is boiled, then it is scoured and rinsed with water.
YLT_Paraphrased: it is broken and washed with water, and if it is a brass vessel, it is washed with water.
DRA_Original: And the earthen vessel, wherein it was sodden, shall be broken, but if the vessel be of brass, it shall be scoured, and washed with water.

YLT_Original: `Every male among the priests doth eat it -- it  most holy;
YLT_Paraphrased: every priest eats it, it's the most holy thing in the world;
DRA_Original: Every male of the priestly race shall eat of the flesh thereof, because it is holy of holies.

YLT_Original: and no sin-offering,  of whose blood is brought in unto the tent of meeting to make atonement in the sanctuary is eaten; with fire it is burnt.
YLT_Paraphrased: it is not a sin to eat the blood of the offering, which is brought to the altar to make atonement in the sanctuary.
DRA_Original: For the victim that is slain for sin, the blood of which is carried into the tabernacle of the testimony to make atonement in the sanctuary, shall not be eaten, but shall be burnt with fire.

YLT_Original: And the famine  severe in the land;
YLT_Paraphrased: the famine is severe in the country;
DRA_Original: In the mean time the famine was heavy upon all the land.

YLT_Original: and it cometh to pass, when they have finished eating the corn which they brought from Egypt, that their father saith unto them, `Turn back, buy for us a little food.'
YLT_Paraphrased: when they eat the corn they brought from Egypt, their father will tell them, "Turn back, buy us a little food."
DRA_Original: And when they had eaten up all the corn, which they had brought out of Egypt, Jacob said to his sons: Go again and buy us a little food.

YLT_Original: And Judah speaketh unto him, saying, `The man protesting protested to us, saying, Ye do not see my face without your brother  with you;
YLT_Paraphrased: "he said, 'I don't see my face without my brother, 'he said.
DRA_Original: Juda answered: The man declared unto us with the attestation of an oath, saying: You shall not see my face, unless you bring your youngest brother with you.

YLT_Original: if thou art sending our brother with us, we go down, and buy for thee food,
YLT_Paraphrased: we'll go down with our brother, and we'll buy you something, and we'll go.
DRA_Original: If therefore thou wilt send him with us, we will set out together, and will buy necessaries for thee.

YLT_Original: and if thou art not sending -- we do not go down, for the man said unto us, Ye do not see my face without your brother  with you.'
YLT_Paraphrased: if you don't send -- we don't go down, 'cause the man said, 'You don't see my face with your brother.'
DRA_Original: But if thou wilt not, we will not go: for the man, as we have often said, declared unto us, saying: You shall not see my face without your youngest brother.

YLT_Original: And Israel saith, `Why did ye evil to me, by declaring to the man that ye had yet a brother?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "why did you do it to me, when you told me you had a brother?" Israel asked.
DRA_Original: Israel said to them: You have done this for my misery in that you told him you had also another brother.

YLT_Original: and they say, `The man asked diligently concerning us, and concerning our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye a brother? and we declare to him according to the tenor of these things; do we certainly know that he will say, Bring down your brother?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "he asked us, and our kindred, and our friends, and our relatives, and our relatives, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and our friends, and
DRA_Original: But they answered: The man asked us in order concerning our kindred: if our father lived: if we had a brother: and we answered him regularly, according to what he demanded: could we know that he would say: Bring hither your brother with you?

YLT_Original: And Judah saith unto Israel his father, `Send the youth with me, and we arise, and go, and live, and do not die, both we, and thou, and our infants.
YLT_Paraphrased: "send the young man with me, and we'll go, and we'll go, and we'll live, and we won't die, and we'll be happy.
DRA_Original: And Juda said to his father: Send the boy with me, that we may set forward, and may live: lest both we and our children perish.

YLT_Original: I -- I am surety  him, from my hand thou dost require him; if I have not brought him in unto thee, and set him before thee -- then I have sinned against thee all the days;
YLT_Paraphrased: if I hadn't taken him to you, and I'd put him in front of you, I'd be guilty of sinning against you all the time;
DRA_Original: I take the boy upon me, require him at my hand: unless I bring him again, and restore him to thee, I will be guilty of sin against thee for ever.

YLT_Original: for if we had not lingered, surely now we had returned these two times.'
YLT_Paraphrased: if we hadn't been there, we'd have returned them again.'
DRA_Original: If delay had not been made, we had been here again the second time.

YLT_Original: And Israel their father saith unto them, `If so, now, this do: take of the praised thing of the land in your vessels, and take down to the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spices and myrrh, nuts and almonds;
YLT_Paraphrased: "if so, then, take the praise of the land, and take it to the ship, and take a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the spice, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey, a little bit of the honey
DRA_Original: Then Israel said to them: If it must needs be so, do what you will: take of the best fruits of the land in your vessels, and carry down presents to the man, a little balm, and honey, and storax, myrrh, turpentine, and almonds.

YLT_Original: and double money take in your hand, even the money which is brought back in the mouth of your bags, ye take back in your hand, it may be it  an oversight.
YLT_Paraphrased: you can take money out of your pockets, even money that comes out of your pockets, you can take it back in your hand.
DRA_Original: And take with you double money, and carry back what you found in your sacks, lest perhaps it was done by mistake.

YLT_Original: `And take your brother, and rise, turn back unto the man;
YLT_Paraphrased: turn your brother and turn back to the man.
DRA_Original: And take also your brother, and go to the man.

YLT_Original: and God Almighty give to you mercies before the man, so that he hath sent to you your other brother and Benjamin; and I, when I am bereaved -- I am bereaved.'
YLT_Paraphrased: God Almighty will give you mercy before the man, so that he will send you to your brother Benjamin.
DRA_Original: And may my almighty God make him favourable to you; and send back with you your brother, whom he keepeth, and this Benjamin: and as for me I shall be desolate without children.

YLT_Original: And the men take this present, double money also they have taken in their hand, and Benjamin; and they rise, and go down to Egypt, and stand before Joseph;
YLT_Paraphrased: they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took
DRA_Original: So the men took the presents, and double money, and Benjamin: and went down into Egypt, and stood before Joseph.

YLT_Original: and Joseph seeth Benjamin with them, and saith to him who  over his house, `Bring the men into the house, and slaughter an animal, and make ready, for with me do the men eat at noon.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "bring the men to the house, and they'll eat with me, and they'll be ready for lunch," Joseph said to Benjamin.
DRA_Original: And when he had seen them, and Benjamin with them, he commanded the steward of his house, saying: Bring in the men into the house, and kill victims, and prepare a feast: because they shall eat with me at noon.

YLT_Original: And the man doth as Joseph hath said, and the man bringeth in the men into the house of Joseph,
YLT_Paraphrased: the man who's going to Joseph's house, he's like Joseph said, and he's bringing in the men.
DRA_Original: He did as he was commanded, and brought the men into the house.

YLT_Original: and the men are afraid because they have been brought into the house of Joseph, and they say, `For the matter of the money which was put back in our bags at the commencement are we brought in -- to roll himself upon us, and to throw himself on us, and to take us for servants -- our asses also.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "for the money we took from the bag at the beginning, we're afraid of him, and he says, 'For the money we took from the bag, we're afraid of him.
DRA_Original: And they being much afraid, said there one to another: Because of the money, which we carried back the first time in our sacks, we are brought in: that he may bring upon us a false accusation, and by violence make slaves of us and our asses.

YLT_Original: And they come nigh unto the man who  over the house of Joseph, and speak unto him at the opening of the house,
YLT_Paraphrased: they're coming to the man who's talking to Joseph at the opening of the house, and they're close to him.
DRA_Original: Wherefore going up to the steward of the house, at the door,

YLT_Original: and say, `O, my lord, we really come down at the commencement to buy food;
YLT_Paraphrased: "oh, my lord, we're really going to buy food at the beginning," he said.
DRA_Original: They said: Sir, we desire thee to hear us: We came down once before to buy food:

YLT_Original: and it cometh to pass, when we have come in unto the lodging-place, and open our bags, that lo, each one's money  in the mouth of his bag, our money in its weight, and we bring it back in our hand;
YLT_Paraphrased: when we come to the lodge, open the bag, and we take our money, we have a lot of money in the bag, and we bring it back to the bag.
DRA_Original: And when we had bought, and come to the inn, we opened our sacks, and found our money in the mouths of the sacks: which we have now brought again in the same weight.

YLT_Original: and other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food; we have not known who put our money in our bags.'
YLT_Paraphrased: we have not known who gave us money to buy food; we don't know who gave us the money. "
DRA_Original: And we have brought other money besides, to buy what we want: we cannot tell who put it in our bags.

YLT_Original: And he saith, `Peace to you, fear not: your God and the God of your father hath given to you hidden treasure in your bags, your money came unto me;' and he bringeth out Simeon unto them.
YLT_Paraphrased: "peace, be not afraid, my God and your father's treasure is hidden in your bags, your money's in my hands," he said.
DRA_Original: But he answered: Peace be with you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father hath given you treasure in your sacks. For the money, which you gave me, I have for good. And he brought Simeon out to them.

YLT_Original: And the man bringeth in the men into Joseph's house, and giveth water, and they wash their feet; and he giveth provender for their asses,
YLT_Paraphrased: he brings the men to Joseph's house and gives them water and cleans them up; and he gives them a drink.
DRA_Original: And having brought them into the house, he fetched water, and they washed their feet, and he gave provender to their asses.

YLT_Original: and they prepare the present until the coming of Joseph at noon, for they have heard that there they do eat bread.
YLT_Paraphrased: they prepare the bread for Joseph's arrival at noon, and they have heard that they eat bread.
DRA_Original: But they made ready the presents, against Joseph came at noon: for they had heard that they should eat bread there.

YLT_Original: And Joseph cometh into the house, and they bring to him the present which  in their hand, into the house, and bow themselves to him, to the earth;
YLT_Paraphrased: they come to the house, and they bring the present to the house, and they bow to him, to the ground.
DRA_Original: Then Joseph came into his house, and they offered him the presents holding them in their hands, and they bowed down with their face to the ground.

YLT_Original: and he asketh of them of peace, and saith, `Is your father well? the aged man of whom ye have spoken, is he yet alive?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "is your father alive?" He asked, and said, "Is he alive?" He asked, and he said, "He's alive?"
DRA_Original: But he, courteously saluting them again, asked them, saying: Is the old man your father in health, of whom you told me? Is he yet living?

YLT_Original: and they say, `Thy servant our father  well, he is yet alive;' and they bow, and do obeisance.
YLT_Paraphrased: "your servant is alive, and he's still alive," they say, "your father is alive." They bow, and they bow.
DRA_Original: And they answered: Thy servant our father is in health, he is yet living. And bowing themselves they made obeisance to him.

YLT_Original: And he lifteth up his eyes, and seeth Benjamin his brother, his mother's son, and saith, `Is this your young brother, of whom ye have spoken unto me?' and he saith, `God favour thee, my son.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "God bless you, my young brother, my son of your mother's, and he says, "Are you talking to me about your young brother?"
DRA_Original: And Joseph lifting up his eyes, saw Benjamin his brother, by the same mother, and said: Is this your young brother, of whom you told me? And he said: God be gracious to thee, my son.

YLT_Original: And Joseph hasteth, for his bowels have been moved for his brother, and he seeketh to weep, and entereth the inner chamber, and weepeth there;
YLT_Paraphrased: he sought his brother, and he was crying, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to cry, and he wanted to
DRA_Original: And he made haste because his heart was moved upon his brother, and tears gushed out: and going into his chamber he wept.

YLT_Original: and he washeth his face, and goeth out, and refraineth himself, and saith, `Place bread.'
YLT_Paraphrased: he said, "Place the bread," and he went away, and he said, "No, no, no, no."
DRA_Original: And when he had washed his face, coming out again, he refrained himself, and said: Set bread on the table.

YLT_Original: And they place for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians who are eating with him by themselves: for the Egyptians are unable to eat bread with the Hebrews, for it  an abomination to the Egyptians.
YLT_Paraphrased: they're eating with him, and the Egyptians who eat with him, and the Egyptians who eat with them, and the Egyptians who eat with them.
DRA_Original: And when it was set on, for Joseph apart, and for his brethren apart, for the Egyptians also that ate with him, apart, (for it is unlawful for the Egyptians to eat with the Hebrews, and they think such a feast profane:):

YLT_Original: And they sit before him, the first-born according to his birthright, and the young one according to his youth, and the men wonder one at another;
YLT_Paraphrased: they sit down, the first born, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young man, the young
DRA_Original: They sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his age. And they wondered very much:

YLT_Original: and he lifteth up gifts from before him unto them, and the gift of Benjamin is five hands more than the gifts of all of them; and they drink, yea, they drink abundantly with him.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's got five hands, and he's got a lot of gifts before him, and he's got a lot of them, and he drinks, yes, he drinks.
DRA_Original: Taking the messes which they received of him: and the greater mess came to Benjamin, so that it exceeded by five parts. And they drank, and were merry with him.

YLT_Original: And to the messenger of the assembly in Sardis write: These things saith he who is having the Seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars: I have known thy works, and that thou hast the name that thou dost live, and thou art dead;
YLT_Paraphrased: I know your name, and that you have the name of the Seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars:
DRA_Original: And to the angel of the church of Sardis, write: These things saith he, that hath the seven spirits of God, and the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou hast the name of being alive: and thou art dead.

YLT_Original: become watching, and strengthen the rest of the things that are about to die, for I have not found thy works fulfilled before God.
YLT_Paraphrased: I don't know what you're doing, but I'm not sure what you're doing, but I'm not sure what you're doing, but I don't know what you're doing.
DRA_Original: Be watchful and strengthen the things that remain, which are ready to die. For I find not thy works full before my God.

YLT_Original: `Remember, then, how thou hast received, and heard, and be keeping, and reform: if, then, thou mayest not watch, I will come upon thee as a thief, and thou mayest not know what hour I will come upon thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: remember, if you don't watch, I'll come to you as a thief, and you won't know what hour I'll come.
DRA_Original: Have in mind therefore in what manner thou hast received and heard: and observe, and do penance. If then thou shalt not watch, I will come to thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know at what hour I will come to thee.

YLT_Original: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis who did not defile their garments, and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy.
YLT_Paraphrased: you have a couple of names in Sardis who don't defile their clothes, and they'll walk with me in white.
DRA_Original: But thou hast a few names in Sardis, which have not defiled their garments: and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy.

YLT_Original: He who is overcoming -- this one -- shall be arrayed in white garments, and I will not blot out his name from the scroll of the life, and I will confess his name before my Father, and before His messengers.
YLT_Paraphrased: I will not blot out the name of the scroll, and I will confess to my father, before the messenger, before the messenger.
DRA_Original: He that shall overcome, shall thus be clothed in white garments, and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, and I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

YLT_Original: He who is having an ear -- let him hear what the Spirit saith to the assemblies.
YLT_Paraphrased: who's listening to what the Spirit tells the assembly, let him hear what the Spirit says.
DRA_Original: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.

YLT_Original: `And to the messenger of the assembly in Philadelphia write: These things saith he who is holy, he who is true, he who is having the key of David, he who is opening and no one doth shut, and he shutteth and no one doth open!
YLT_Paraphrased: he writes: He who is holy, he who is true, he who has the key to David, he who opens and no one shuts, and he's opening and no one will shut him down.
DRA_Original: And to the angel of the church of Philadelphia, write: These things saith the Holy One and the true one, he that hath the key of David; he that openeth, and no man shutteth; shutteth, and no man openeth:

YLT_Original: I have known thy works; lo, I have set before thee a door -- opened, and no one is able to shut it, because thou hast a little power, and didst keep my word, and didst not deny my name;
YLT_Paraphrased: I know your work, and I've told you, you have a little power, and you didn't deny my name, and you didn't deny my name.
DRA_Original: I know thy works. Behold, I have given before thee a door opened, which no man can shut: because thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.

YLT_Original: lo, I make of the synagogue of the Adversary those saying themselves to be Jews, and are not, but do lie; lo, I will make them that they may come and bow before thy feet, and may know that I loved thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I love you.
DRA_Original: Behold, I will bring of the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie. Behold, I will make them to come and adore before thy feet. And they shall know that I have loved thee.

YLT_Original: `Because thou didst keep the word of my endurance, I also will keep thee from the hour of the trial that is about to come upon all the world, to try those dwelling upon the earth.
YLT_Paraphrased: I will also keep you from the hour of the trial that will be on the world, so that you will not be able to try to live on earth.
DRA_Original: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I will also keep thee from the hour of the temptation, which shall come upon the whole world to try them that dwell upon the earth.

YLT_Original: Lo, I come quickly, be holding fast that which thou hast, that no one may receive thy crown.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm coming quickly, I'll hold fast to what you gave me, and no one will take your crown.
DRA_Original: Behold, I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.

YLT_Original: He who is overcoming -- I will make him a pillar in the sanctuary of my God, and without he may not go any more, and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, that doth come down out of the heaven from my God -- also my new name.
YLT_Paraphrased: I will overcome him, and without him, I will write him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, and I will write it on him.
DRA_Original: He that shall overcome, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God; and he shall go out no more; and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God, and my new name.

YLT_Original: He who is having an ear -- let him hear what the Spirit saith to the assemblies.
YLT_Paraphrased: who's listening to what the Spirit tells the assembly, let him hear what the Spirit says.
DRA_Original: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.

YLT_Original: `And to the messenger of the assembly of the Laodiceans write: These things saith the Amen, the witness -- the faithful and true -- the chief of the creation of God;
YLT_Paraphrased: the messenger of the assembly of Laodiceans writes: This is the word of the Lord, the witness - the faithful and true - the chief of creation.
DRA_Original: And to the angel of the church of Laodicea, write: These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, who is the beginning of the creation of God:

YLT_Original: I have known thy works, that neither cold art thou nor hot; I would thou wert cold or hot.
YLT_Paraphrased: I know your work, and I don't want you to be cold or hot.
DRA_Original: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold, nor hot. I would thou wert cold, or hot.

YLT_Original: So -- because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I am about to vomit thee out of my mouth;
YLT_Paraphrased: because you're not cold or hot, I'm gonna throw you out of my mouth;
DRA_Original: But because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold, not hot, I will begin to vomit thee out of my mouth.

YLT_Original: because thou sayest -- I am rich, and have grown rich, and have need of nothing, and hast not known that thou art the wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked,
YLT_Paraphrased: you say I'm rich, and I've grown rich, and I've been rich, and I've never known that you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor, and you're poor,
DRA_Original: Because thou sayest: I am rich, and made wealthy, and have need of nothing: and knowest not, that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked.

YLT_Original: I counsel thee to buy from me gold fired by fire, that thou mayest be rich, and white garments that thou mayest be arrayed, and the shame of thy nakedness may not be manifest, and with eye-salve anoint thine eyes, that thou mayest see.
YLT_Paraphrased: buy me gold fire, that you can be rich, and white clothes that you can wear, and the shame of your nakedness will not be known, and with eye-salve anoint you.
DRA_Original: I counsel thee to buy of me gold fire tried, that thou mayest be made rich; and mayest be clothed in white garments, and that the shame of thy nakedness may not appear; and anoint thy eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

YLT_Original: `As many as I love, I do convict and chasten; be zealous, then, and reform;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm guilty, I'm
DRA_Original: Such as I love, I rebuke and chastise. Be zealous therefore, and do penance.

YLT_Original: lo, I have stood at the door, and I knock; if any one may hear my voice, and may open the door, I will come in unto him, and will sup with him, and he with me.
YLT_Paraphrased: if anyone hears my voice, and he opens the door, I'll come in and I'll have a good time with him, and he'll be with me.
DRA_Original: Behold, I stand at the gate, and knock. If any man shall hear my voice, and open to me the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.

YLT_Original: He who is overcoming -- I will give to him to sit with me in my throne, as I also did overcome and did sit down with my Father in His throne.
YLT_Paraphrased: I will sit down with my father in the throne, as I have done with my father in the throne.
DRA_Original: To him that shall overcome, I will give to sit with me in my throne: as I also have overcome, and am set down with my Father in his throne.

YLT_Original: He who is having an ear -- let him hear what the Spirit saith to the assemblies.'
YLT_Paraphrased: who's listening to what the Spirit tells the assembly.
DRA_Original: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.

YLT_Original: And having risen thence, he doth come to the coasts of Judea, through the other side of the Jordan, and again do multitudes come together unto him, and, as he had been accustomed, again he was teaching them.
YLT_Paraphrased: he came to the coast of Judea, and then he came to the Jordan, and he was again teaching them.
DRA_Original: And rising up from thence, he cometh into the coasts of Judea beyond the Jordan: and the multitudes flock to him again. And as he was accustomed, he taught them again.

YLT_Original: And the Pharisees, having come near, questioned him, if it is lawful for a husband to put away a wife, tempting him,
YLT_Paraphrased: if a husband is to leave his wife, he must be tempted by the Pharisees, who came near.
DRA_Original: And the Pharisees coming to him asked him: Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.

YLT_Original: and he answering said to them, `What did Moses command you?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "what did Moses command you?" He asked, and they answered, "What did Moses say?"
DRA_Original: But he answering, saith to them: What did Moses command you?
