YLT_Original: and they said, `Moses suffered to write a bill of divorce, and to put away.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "Moses wrote a divorce bill, and he was arrested," they said.
DRA_Original: Who said: Moses permitted to write a bill of divorce, and to put her away.

YLT_Original: And Jesus answering said to them, `For the stiffness of your heart he wrote you this command,
YLT_Paraphrased: "he wrote you this command for your heart," Jesus answered.
DRA_Original: To whom Jesus answering, said: Because of the hardness of your heart he wrote you that precept.

YLT_Original: but from the beginning of the creation, a male and a female God did make them;
YLT_Paraphrased: they were made by a male and a woman from the beginning;
DRA_Original: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.

YLT_Original: on this account shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave unto his wife,
YLT_Paraphrased: a man will leave his father and mother and will be with his wife.
DRA_Original: For this cause a man shall leave his father and mother; and shall cleave to his wife.

YLT_Original: and they shall be -- the two -- for one flesh; so that they are no more two, but one flesh;
YLT_Paraphrased: they're both -- the two -- for one body; so they're not two, but one body;
DRA_Original: And they two shall be in one flesh. Therefore now they are not two, but one flesh.

YLT_Original: what therefore God did join together, let not man put asunder.'
YLT_Paraphrased: so God joined together, let it not be broken. "
DRA_Original: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

YLT_Original: And in the house again his disciples of the same thing questioned him,
YLT_Paraphrased: they asked him again, and he answered them again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again, and again,
DRA_Original: And in the house again his disciples asked him concerning the same thing.

YLT_Original: and he saith to them, `Whoever may put away his wife, and may marry another, doth commit adultery against her;
YLT_Paraphrased: "whoever leaves his wife, and marries another, he's guilty of adultery;
DRA_Original: And he saith to them: Whosoever shall put away his wife and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

YLT_Original: and if a woman may put away her husband, and is married to another, she committeth adultery.'
YLT_Paraphrased: if a woman is married, she will be guilty of adultery. "
DRA_Original: And if the wife shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

YLT_Original: And they were bringing to him children, that he might touch them, and the disciples were rebuking those bringing them,
YLT_Paraphrased: they brought him children, so he might touch them, and the disciples rebelled against them.
DRA_Original: And they brought to him young children, that he might touch them. And the disciples rebuked them that brought them.

YLT_Original: and Jesus having seen, was much displeased, and he said to them, `Suffer the children to come unto me, and forbid them not, for of such is the reign of God;
YLT_Paraphrased: "for God's sake, I beg you, don't let the children come to me, and don't let them go, for God's sake," he said.
DRA_Original: Whom when Jesus saw, he was much displeased, and saith to them: Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not; for of such is the kingdom of God.

YLT_Original: verily I say to you, whoever may not receive the reign of God, as a child -- he may not enter into it;'
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, whoever doesn't get God's rule as a child -- he can't be in it. "
DRA_Original: Amen I say to you, whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, shall not enter into it.

YLT_Original: and having taken them in his arms, having put  hands upon them, he was blessing them.
YLT_Paraphrased: he took them in his arms, put his hands on them, and blessed them.
DRA_Original: And embracing them, and laying his hands upon them, he blessed them.

YLT_Original: And as he is going forth into the way, one having run and having kneeled to him, was questioning him, `Good teacher, what may I do, that life age-during I may inherit?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "good teacher, what can I do, that I may inherit?" He asked, as he walked away.
DRA_Original: And when he was gone forth into the way, a certain man running up and kneeling before him, asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may receive life everlasting?

YLT_Original: And Jesus said to him, `Why me dost thou call good? no one  good except One -- God;
YLT_Paraphrased: "why do you call me good?" Said Jesus, "Who's good?" He asked.
DRA_Original: And Jesus said to him, Why callest thou me good? None is good but one, that is God.

YLT_Original: the commands thou hast known: Thou mayest not commit adultery, Thou mayest do no murder, Thou mayest not steal, Thou mayest not bear false witness, Thou mayest not defraud, Honour thy father and mother.'
YLT_Paraphrased: you know, you can't commit adultery, you can't murder, you can't steal, you can't cheat, you can't lie, you can't cheat, you can't cheat, you can't cheat. "
DRA_Original: Thou knowest the commandments: Do not commit adultery, do not kill, do not steal, bear not false witness, do no fraud, honour thy father and mother.

YLT_Original: And he answering said to him, `Teacher, all these did I keep from my youth.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "teacher, I've been keeping it from my youth," he said.
DRA_Original: But he answering, said to him: Master, all these things I have observed from my youth.

YLT_Original: And Jesus having looked upon him, did love him, and said to him, `One thing thou dost lack; go away, whatever thou hast -- sell, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come, be following me, having taken up the cross.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you have a thing you don't have, go away, whatever you have, sell, and give to the poor, and you'll have a treasure in heaven," Jesus said.
DRA_Original: And Jesus looking on him, loved him, and said to him: One thing is wanting unto thee: go, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.

YLT_Original: And he -- gloomy at the word -- went away sorrowing, for he was having many possessions.
YLT_Paraphrased: he -- sad, for he had many possessions - left the word, and he was sad.
DRA_Original: Who being struck sad at that saying, went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.

YLT_Original: And Jesus having looked round, saith to his disciples, `How hardly shall they who have riches enter into the reign of God!'
YLT_Paraphrased: "how little they who have wealth will be able to enter the kingdom of God!" Said Jesus, looking round.
DRA_Original: And Jesus looking round about, saith to his disciples: How hardly shall they that have riches, enter into the kingdom of God!

YLT_Original: And the disciples were astonished at his words, and Jesus again answering saith to them, `Children, how hard is it to those trusting on the riches to enter into the reign of God!
YLT_Paraphrased: "how hard it is for those who trust in God's riches to enter the kingdom!" Said Jesus, and the disciples were amazed.
DRA_Original: And the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus again answering, saith to them: Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches, to enter into the kingdom of God?

YLT_Original: It is easier for a camel through the eye of the needle to enter, than for a rich man to enter into the reign of God.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the camel's eye is easier to enter than the rich man's eye. "
DRA_Original: It is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

YLT_Original: And they were astonished beyond measure, saying unto themselves, `And who is able to be saved?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "who can save us?" They asked themselves, amazed.
DRA_Original: Who wondered the more, saying among themselves: Who then can be saved?

YLT_Original: And Jesus, having looked upon them, saith, `With men it is impossible, but not with God; for all things are possible with God.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "it's impossible, but not with God," Jesus said.
DRA_Original: And Jesus looking on them, saith: With men it is impossible; but not with God: for all things are possible with God.

YLT_Original: And Peter began to say to him, `Lo, we left all, and we followed thee.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "all right, we're leaving, and we're following you," Peter said.
DRA_Original: And Peter began to say unto him: Behold, we have left all things, and have followed thee.

YLT_Original: And Jesus answering said, `Verily I say to you, there is no one who left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or fields, for my sake, and for the good news',
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm telling you, there's no one who's leaving the house, or brothers, sisters, or fathers, or mothers, or wives, or children, or fields, for my sake.
DRA_Original: Jesus answering, said: Amen I say to you, there is no man who hath left house or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, for my sake and for the gospel,

YLT_Original: who may not receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brothers, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and fields, with persecutions, and in the age that is coming, life age-during;
YLT_Paraphrased: in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields, and in the age of the coming, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life, life
DRA_Original: Who shall not receive an hundred times as much, now in this time; houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions: and in the world to come life everlasting.

YLT_Original: and many first shall be last, and the last first.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "first, the first, then the last, and the last first."
DRA_Original: But many that are first, shall be last: and the last, first.

YLT_Original: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going before them, and they were amazed, and following they were afraid. And having again taken the twelve, he began to tell them the things about to happen to him,
YLT_Paraphrased: and then he began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him, and they were amazed, and they were afraid. And then he began to tell them the things he had to do, and they were amazed. And then he began to tell them, and they were amazed. And then he began to tell them, and they were amazed. And then he began to tell them, and they were amazed. And then he began to tell them, and they were amazed.
DRA_Original: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem: and Jesus went before them, and they were astonished; and following were afraid. And taking again the twelve, he began to tell them the things that should befall him.

YLT_Original: `Lo, we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man shall be delivered to the chief priests, and to the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the nations,
YLT_Paraphrased: we're going to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be taken to the highest priests, and the scribes will condemn him to death, and they'll be condemned to the world.
DRA_Original: Saying: Behold we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of man shall be betrayed to the chief priests, and to the scribes and ancients, and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles.

YLT_Original: and they shall mock him, and scourge him, and spit on him, and kill him, and the third day he shall rise again.'
YLT_Paraphrased: he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be mocked, he will be
DRA_Original: And they shall mock him, and spit on him, and scourge him, and kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.

YLT_Original: And there come near to him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying, `Teacher, we wish that whatever we may ask for ourselves, thou mayest do for us;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "teacher, we'd like to ask you to do what we want, but you can do it for us," said the sons of Zebedee.
DRA_Original: And James and John the sons of Zebedee, come to him, saying: Master, we desire that whatsoever we shall ask, thou wouldst do it for us:

YLT_Original: and he said to them, `What do ye wish me to do for you?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "what do you want me to do for you?" He asked them.
DRA_Original: But he said to them: What would you that I should do for you?

YLT_Original: and they said to him, `Grant to us that, one on thy right hand and one on thy left, we may sit in thy glory;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "we can sit in your glory, Grant, one on your right hand and one on your left," they said.
DRA_Original: And they said: Grant to us, that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.

YLT_Original: and Jesus said to them, `Ye have not known what ye ask; are ye able to drink of the cup that I drink of, and with the baptism that I am baptized with -- to be baptized?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you don't know what you're asking, do you?" Said Jesus.
DRA_Original: And Jesus said to them: You know not what you ask. Can you drink of the chalice that I drink of: or be baptized with the baptism wherewith I am baptized?

YLT_Original: And they said to him, `We are able;' and Jesus said to them, `Of the cup indeed that I drink of, ye shall drink, and with the baptism that I am baptized with, ye shall be baptized;
YLT_Paraphrased: "you can drink, and you'll be baptized with the baptism I'm baptized with," Jesus said.
DRA_Original: But they said to him: We can. And Jesus saith to them: You shall indeed drink of the chalice that I drink of: and with the baptism wherewith I am baptized, you shall be baptized.

YLT_Original: but to sit on my right and on my left, is not mine to give, but -- to those for whom it hath been prepared.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I can't give it to anyone, but to those who have been prepared. "
DRA_Original: But to sit on my right hand, or on my left, is not mine to give to you, but to them for whom it is prepared.

YLT_Original: And the ten having heard, began to be much displeased at James and John,
YLT_Paraphrased: they were much annoyed by James and John, and they began to be very angry.
DRA_Original: And the ten hearing it, began to be much displeased at James and John.

YLT_Original: but Jesus having called them near, saith to them, `Ye have known that they who are considered to rule the nations do exercise lordship over them, and their great ones do exercise authority upon them;
YLT_Paraphrased: "you know who the rulers are, and they have power over them, and their great ones are in charge of them; they are the ones who rule the nations, and they have power over them;
DRA_Original: But Jesus calling them, saith to them: You know that they who seem to rule over the Gentiles, lord it over them: and their princes have power over them.

YLT_Original: but not so shall it be among you; but whoever may will to become great among you, he shall be your minister,
YLT_Paraphrased: but whoever will be great among you, he will be your minister.
DRA_Original: But it is not so among you: but whosoever will be greater, shall be your minister.

YLT_Original: and whoever of you may will to become first, he shall be servant of all;
YLT_Paraphrased: whoever will be the first will be the servant of all;
DRA_Original: And whosoever will be first among you, shall be the servant of all.

YLT_Original: for even the Son of Man came not to be ministered to, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.'
YLT_Paraphrased: even the Son of Man, who came to be ministered to, but to give his life a ransom.
DRA_Original: For the Son of man also is not come to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a redemption for many.

YLT_Original: And they come to Jericho, and as he is going forth from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, a son of Timaeus -- Bartimaeus the blind -- was sitting beside the way begging,
YLT_Paraphrased: he sat down beside the way, and as he walked away from Jericho, a son of Timaeus - Bartimaeus the blind - sat down beside him.
DRA_Original: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho, with his disciples, and a very great multitude, Bartimeus the blind man, the son of Timeus, sat by the way side begging.

YLT_Original: and having heard that it is Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and to say, `The Son of David -- Jesus! deal kindly with me;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "son of David - Jesus!" He cried, and began to cry, "The son of David - Jesus!"
DRA_Original: Who when he had heard, that it was Jesus of Nazareth, began to cry out, and to say: Jesus son of David, have mercy on me.

YLT_Original: and many were rebuking him, that he might keep silent, but the more abundantly he cried out, `Son of David, deal kindly with me.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "son of David, I beg you," he cried, "please don't be so harsh with me."
DRA_Original: And many rebuked him, that he might hold his peace; but he cried a great deal the more: Son of David, have mercy on me.

YLT_Original: And Jesus having stood, he commanded him to be called, and they call the blind man, saying to him, `Take courage, rise, he doth call thee;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "come, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear
DRA_Original: And Jesus, standing still, commanded him to be called. And they call the blind man, saying to him: Be of better comfort: arise, he calleth thee.

YLT_Original: and he, having cast away his garment, having risen, did come unto Jesus.
YLT_Paraphrased: he came to Jesus, and he took off his robe, and he rose.
DRA_Original: Who casting off his garment leaped up, and came to him.

YLT_Original: And answering, Jesus saith to him, `What wilt thou I may do to thee?' and the blind man said to him, `Rabboni, that I may see again;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "what do you want me to do with you?" Said the blind man, and Jesus answered, "What do you want me to do with you?"
DRA_Original: And Jesus answering, said to him: What wilt thou that I should do to thee? And the blind man said to him: Rabboni, that I may see.

YLT_Original: and Jesus said to him, `Go, thy faith hath saved thee:' and immediately he saw again, and was following Jesus in the way.
YLT_Paraphrased: "go, your faith saved you," Jesus said, and immediately he followed Jesus.
DRA_Original: And Jesus saith to him: Go thy way, thy faith hath made thee whole. And immediately he saw, and followed him in the way.

YLT_Original: My soul hath been weary of my life, I leave off my talking to myself, I speak in the bitterness of my soul.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm tired of my life, I'm tired of my soul, I'm tired of my soul.
DRA_Original: My soul is weary of my life, I will let go my speech against myself, I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

YLT_Original: I say unto God, `Do not condemn me, Let me know why Thou dost strive  me.
YLT_Paraphrased: "don't be afraid, I'll tell you why you're trying to do it.
DRA_Original: I will say to God: Do not condemn me: tell me why thou judgest me so.

YLT_Original: Is it good for Thee that Thou dost oppress? That Thou despisest the labour of Thy hands, And on the counsel of the wicked hast shone?
YLT_Paraphrased: that Thou would have oppressed Thy hands, and the evil counsel of the devil?
DRA_Original: Doth it seem good to thee that thou shouldst calumniate me, and oppress me, the work of thy own hands, and help the counsel of the wicked?

YLT_Original: Eyes of flesh hast Thou? As man seeth -- seest Thou?
YLT_Paraphrased: as a man sees -- he sees you?
DRA_Original: Hast thou eyes of flesh: or, shalt thou see as man seeth?

YLT_Original: As the days of man  Thy days? Thy years as the days of a man?
YLT_Paraphrased: the days of a man? The years of a man?
DRA_Original: Are thy days as the days of man, and are thy years as the times of men:

YLT_Original: That Thou inquirest for mine iniquity, And for my sin seekest?
YLT_Paraphrased: you're asking me about my sin, and I'm looking for my sin?
DRA_Original: That thou shouldst inquire after my iniquity, and search after my sin?

YLT_Original: For Thou knowest that I am not wicked, And there is no deliverer from Thy hand.
YLT_Paraphrased: you know I'm not evil, and I'm not going to be a savior.
DRA_Original: And shouldst know that I have done no wicked thing, whereas there is no man that can deliver out of thy hand.

YLT_Original: Thy hands have taken pains about me, And they make me together round about, And Thou swallowest me up!
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm in pain, and my hands are hurting me, and you're hurting me!
DRA_Original: Thy hands have made me, and fashioned me wholly round about, and dost thou thus cast me down headlong on a sudden?

YLT_Original: Remember, I pray Thee, That as clay Thou hast made me, And unto dust Thou dost bring me back.
YLT_Paraphrased: I beg you, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please,
DRA_Original: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay, and thou wilt bring me into dust again.

YLT_Original: Dost Thou not as milk pour me out? And as cheese curdle me?
YLT_Paraphrased: and as a cheese curdle, do you want me to go?
DRA_Original: Hast thou not milked me as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

YLT_Original: Skin and flesh Thou dost put on me, And with bones and sinews dost fence me.
YLT_Paraphrased: you're gonna put me on you, and you're gonna fence me with bones and sinews.
DRA_Original: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh: thou hast put me together with bones and sinews:

YLT_Original: Life and kindness Thou hast done with me. And Thy inspection hath preserved my spirit.
YLT_Paraphrased: you've done me a favor and I've preserved my spirit.
DRA_Original: Thou hast granted me life and mercy, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

YLT_Original: And these Thou hast laid up in Thy heart, I have known that this  with Thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: I knew it with you in your heart.
DRA_Original: Although thou conceal these things in thy heart, yet I know that thou rememberest all things.

YLT_Original: If I sinned, then Thou hast observed me, And from mine iniquity dost not acquit me,
YLT_Paraphrased: if I sin, you don't forgive me, but you're not gonna forgive me, so I'm sorry.
DRA_Original: If I have sinned and thou hast spared me for an hour: why dost thou not suffer me to be clean from my iniquity?

YLT_Original: If I have done wickedly -- wo to me, And righteously -- I lift not up my head, Full of shame -- then see my affliction,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm doing bad -- I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed -- then I'm ashamed --
DRA_Original: And if I be wicked, woe unto me: and if just, I shall not lift up my head, being filled with affliction and misery.

YLT_Original: And it riseth -- as a lion Thou huntest me. And Thou turnest back -- Thou shewest Thyself wonderful in me.
YLT_Paraphrased: you're going to hunt me like a lion, and you're going to turn around and you're gonna look great.
DRA_Original: And for pride thou wilt take me as a lioness, and returning thou tormentest me wonderfully.

YLT_Original: Thou renewest Thy witnesses against me, And dost multiply Thine anger with me, Changes and warfare  with me.
YLT_Paraphrased: you're renewing my witnesses, and you're multiplying my anger.
DRA_Original: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and multipliest thy wrath upon me, and pains war against me.

YLT_Original: And why from the womb Hast Thou brought me forth? I expire, and the eye doth not see me.
YLT_Paraphrased: why did you bring me here? I'm dying, and the eye doesn't see me.
DRA_Original: Why didst thou bring me forth out of the womb: O that I had been consumed that eye might not see me!

YLT_Original: As I had not been, I am, From the belly to the grave I am brought,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm brought to the grave, from the belly to the grave.
DRA_Original: I should have been as if I had not been, carried from the womb to the grave.

YLT_Original: Are not my days few? Cease then, and put from me, And I brighten up a little,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm not going to be a little, and I'll be a little happy, and I'll be happy.
DRA_Original: Shall not the fewness of my days be ended shortly? suffer me, therefore, that I may lament my sorrow a little:

YLT_Original: Before I go, and return not, Unto a land of darkness and death-shade,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'll go, and I'll return, not to the dark and death.
DRA_Original: Before I go, and return no more, to a land that is dark and covered with the mist of death:

YLT_Original: A land of obscurity as thick darkness, Death-shade -- and no order, And the shining  as thick darkness.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark, the dark,
DRA_Original: A land of misery and darkness, where the shadow of death, and no order, but everlasting horror dwelleth.

YLT_Original: A Psalm. -- A song of the dedication of the house of David. I exalt Thee, O Jehovah, For Thou hast drawn me up, and hast not let mine enemies rejoice over me.
YLT_Paraphrased: Psalm. -- A song of David's dedication to God. I'm glad you didn't let my enemies celebrate me.
DRA_Original: Unto the end, a psalm for David, in an ecstasy.

YLT_Original: Jehovah my God, I have cried to Thee, And Thou dost heal me.
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my God, I'm crying to you, and you're gonna save me.
DRA_Original: In thee, O Lord, have I hoped, let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy justice.

YLT_Original: Jehovah, Thou hast brought up from Sheol my soul, Thou hast kept me alive, From going down  the pit.
YLT_Paraphrased: you brought me to Sheol, you saved my soul, you've kept me alive.
DRA_Original: Bow down thy ear to me: make haste to deliver me. Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a house of refuge, to save me.

YLT_Original: Sing praise to Jehovah, ye His saints, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness,
YLT_Paraphrased: thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God, thank God,
DRA_Original: For thou art my strength and my refuge; and for thy name's sake thou wilt lead me, and nourish me.

YLT_Original: For -- a moment  in His anger, Life  in His good-will, At even remaineth weeping, and at morn singing.
YLT_Paraphrased: for a moment, Life's anger, his good will, and at dawn he will weep.
DRA_Original: Thou wilt bring me out of this snare, which they have hidden for me: for thou art my protector.

YLT_Original: And I -- I have said in mine ease, `I am not moved -- to the age.
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm not moving - I'm not moving - I'm not moving - I'm not moving.
DRA_Original: Into thy hands I commend my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth.

YLT_Original: O Jehovah, in Thy good pleasure, Thou hast caused strength to remain for my mountain,' Thou hast hidden Thy face -- I have been troubled.
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my God, you've done it to my mountain, you hid your face, I was worried.
DRA_Original: Thou hast hated them that regard vanities, to no purpose. But I have hoped in the Lord:

YLT_Original: Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, And unto Jehovah I make supplication.
YLT_Paraphrased: to the Lord, I beg you, and I beg you to pray to God.
DRA_Original: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy. For thou hast regarded my humility, thou hast saved my soul out of distresses.

YLT_Original: `What gain  in my blood? In my going down unto corruption? Doth dust thank Thee? doth it declare Thy truth?
YLT_Paraphrased: what's the price of my blood? What's the price of my soul?
DRA_Original: And thou hast not shut me up in the hands of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a spacious place.

YLT_Original: Hear, O Jehovah, and favour me, O Jehovah, be a helper to me.'
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my God, and I'm going to help you, O God.
DRA_Original: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am afflicted: my eye is troubled with wrath, my soul, and my belly:

YLT_Original: Thou hast turned my mourning to dancing for me, Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, And girdest me  joy.
YLT_Paraphrased: you've turned my mourning into a dance, and you've released my robe.
DRA_Original: For my life is wasted with grief: and my years in sighs. My strength is weakened through poverty and my bones are disturbed.

YLT_Original: So that honour doth praise Thee, and is not silent, O Jehovah, my God, to the age I thank Thee!
YLT_Paraphrased: it's a shame, my God, that honor is not silent, O God!
DRA_Original: I am become a reproach among all my enemies, and very much to my neighbours; and a fear to my acquaintance. They that saw me without fled from me.

YLT_Original: `There is not to the priests the Levites -- all the tribe of Levi -- a portion and inheritance with Israel; fire-offerings of Jehovah, even His inheritance, they eat,
YLT_Paraphrased: the priests are not the Levites - all the Levites of the tribe of Levi - a part and inheritance of Israel; fire-worshipers of God, even their inheritance.
DRA_Original: The priests and Levites, and all that are of the same tribe, shall have no part nor inheritance with the rest of Israel, because they shall eat the sacrifices of the Lord, and his oblations,

YLT_Original: and he hath no inheritance in the midst of his brethren; Jehovah Himself  his inheritance, as He hath spoken to him.
YLT_Paraphrased: he has no inheritance in the midst of his brothers, as he has told him.
DRA_Original: And they shall receive nothing else. of the possession of their brethren: for the Lord himself is their inheritance, as he hath said to them.

YLT_Original: `And this is the priest's right from the people, from those sacrificing a sacrifice, whether ox or sheep, he hath even given to the priest the leg, and the two cheeks, and the stomach;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest has given the priest a leg, and the two cheeks, and the stomach, and the stomach; and he gave the priest the leg.
DRA_Original: This shall be the priest's due from the people, and from them that offer victims: whether they sacrifice an ox, or a sheep, they shall give to the priest the shoulder and the breast:

YLT_Original: the first of thy corn, of thy new wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy flock, thou dost give to him;
YLT_Paraphrased: you give him the first of your corn, the new wine, and the oil of your flock.
DRA_Original: The firstfruits also of corn, of wine, and of oil, and a part of the wool from the shearing of their sheep.

YLT_Original: for on him hath Jehovah thy God fixed, out of all thy tribes, to stand to serve in the name of Jehovah, He and his sons continually.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's got a God in his name, and his sons will serve him in the name of God.
DRA_Original: For the Lord thy God hath chosen him of all thy tribes, to stand and to minister to the name of the Lord, him and his sons for ever.

YLT_Original: `And when the Levite cometh from one of thy cities out of all Israel, where he hath sojourned, and hath come with all the desire of his soul unto the place which Jehovah doth choose,
YLT_Paraphrased: when the Levite comes from one of your cities, where he's been, and he's come to the place where God chooses, and he's got all his soul in the place where God chooses,
DRA_Original: If a Levite go out of any one of the cities throughout all Israel, in which he dwelleth, and have a longing mind to come to the place which the Lord shall choose,

YLT_Original: then he hath ministered in the name of Jehovah his God, like all his brethren, the Levites, who are standing there before Jehovah,
YLT_Paraphrased: like all his brothers, the Levites, who stand before God, he has ministered to him in the name of God.
DRA_Original: He shall minister in the name of the Lord his God, as all his brethren the Levites do, that shall stand at that time before the Lord.

YLT_Original: portion as portion they do eat, apart from his sold things, with the fathers.
YLT_Paraphrased: with the father, he eats the food, but he doesn't eat anything else.
DRA_Original: He shall receive the same portion of food that the rest do: besides that which is due to him in his own city, by succession from his fathers.

YLT_Original: `When thou art coming in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, thou dost not learn to do according to the abominations of those nations:
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't learn to do what the abominations of those nations are in the land you're in.
DRA_Original: When thou art come into the land which the Lord thy God shall give thee, beware lest thou have a mind to imitate the abominations of those nations.

YLT_Original: there is not found in thee one causing his son and his daughter to pass over into fire, a user of divinations, an observer of clouds, and an enchanter, and a sorcerer,
YLT_Paraphrased: a user of divinations, an observer of clouds, and a wizard, and a sorcerer, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard, and a wizard
DRA_Original: Neither let there be found among you any one that shall expiate his son or daughter, making them to pass through the fire: or that consulteth soothsayers, or observeth dreams and omens, neither let there be any wizard,

YLT_Original: and a charmer, and one asking at a familiar spirit, and a wizard, and one seeking unto the dead.
YLT_Paraphrased: a charmer, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a wizard, a
DRA_Original: Nor charmer, nor any one that consulteth pythonic spirits, or fortune tellers, or that seeketh the truth from the dead.

YLT_Original: `For the abomination of Jehovah  every one doing these, and because of these abominations is Jehovah thy God dispossessing them from thy presence.
YLT_Paraphrased: for the abomination of Jehovah, every one who does it, and for the abomination of Jehovah, he will be God's wrath.
DRA_Original: For the Lord abhorreth all these things, and for these abominations he will destroy them at thy coming.

YLT_Original: Perfect thou art with Jehovah thy God,
YLT_Paraphrased: you're a God of God, you're a God of God, you're a God of God.
DRA_Original: Thou shalt be perfect, and without spot before the Lord thy God.

YLT_Original: for these nations whom thou art possessing, unto observers of clouds, and unto diviners, do hearken; and thou -- not so hath Jehovah thy God suffered thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: hearken, and he - not so did God suffer you, for the clouds and the diviners, and the observers of the clouds.
DRA_Original: These nations, whose land thou shalt possess, hearken to soothsayers and diviners: but thou art otherwise instructed by the Lord thy God.

YLT_Original: `A prophet out of thy midst, out of thy brethren, like to me, doth Jehovah thy God raise up to thee -- unto him ye hearken;
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah your God will raise you up like me, like me, like your brothers, like me.
DRA_Original: The Lord thy God will raise up to thee a PROPHET of thy nation and of thy brethren like unto me: him thou shalt hear:

YLT_Original: according to all that thou didst ask from Jehovah thy God, in Horeb, in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not add to hear the voice of Jehovah my God, and this great fire let me not see any more, and I die not;
YLT_Paraphrased: when you asked for the God of your God, in Horeb, in the day of the assembly, you said, "Let me not be seen by God's voice."
DRA_Original: As thou desiredst of the Lord thy God in Horeb, when the assembly was gathered together, and saidst: Let me not hear any more the voice of the Lord my God, neither let me see any more this exceeding great fire, lest I die.

YLT_Original: and Jehovah saith unto me, They have done well that they have spoken;
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah said to me, They've done well to speak;
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to me: They have spoken all things well.

YLT_Original: a prophet I raise up to them, out of the midst of their brethren, like to thee; and I have given my words in his mouth, and he hath spoken unto them all that which I command him;
YLT_Paraphrased: I have spoken to them all I commanded them, as you did to me, and he spoke to them as I commanded him; and I have spoken to them as I commanded him.
DRA_Original: I will raise them up a prophet out of the midst of their brethren like to thee: and I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them all that I shall command him.

YLT_Original: and it hath been -- the man who doth not hearken unto My words which he doth speak in My name, I require  of him.
YLT_Paraphrased: I demand him -- the man who doesn't listen to my words he doesn't hear in my name, I'm asking him.
DRA_Original: And he that will not hear his words, which he shall speak in my name, I will be the revenger.

YLT_Original: `Only, the prophet who presumeth to speak a word in My name -- that which I have not commanded him to speak -- and who speaketh in the name of other gods -- even that prophet hath died.
YLT_Paraphrased: only, the prophet who speaks in my name -- that which I have not commanded him to say -- and who speaks in the name of another god -- he's dead.
DRA_Original: But the prophet, who being corrupted with pride, shall speak in my name things that I did not command him to say, or in the name of strange gods, shall be slain.

YLT_Original: `And when thou sayest in thy heart, How do we know the word which Jehovah hath not spoken? --
YLT_Paraphrased: when you say, How do we know the word that Jehovah hasn't spoken? --
DRA_Original: And if in silent thought thou answer: How shall I know the word that the Lord hath not spoken?

YLT_Original: that which the prophet speaketh in the name of Jehovah, and the thing is not, and cometh not -- it  the word which Jehovah hath not spoken; in presumption hath the prophet spoken it; -- thou art not afraid of him.
YLT_Paraphrased: the thing is not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's not, and it's
DRA_Original: Thou shalt have this sign: Whatsoever that same prophet foretelleth in the name of the Lord, and it cometh not to pass: that thing the Lord hath not spoken, but the prophet hath forged it by the pride of his mind: and therefore thou shalt not fear him.

YLT_Original: And the man knew Eve his wife, and she conceiveth and beareth Cain, and saith, `I have gotten a man by Jehovah;'
YLT_Paraphrased: he knew Eve's wife, and she was pregnant with Cain, and he said, "I've got a guy from God."
DRA_Original: And Adam knew Eve his wife: who conceived and brought forth Cain, saying: I have gotten a man through God.

YLT_Original: and she addeth to bear his brother, even Abel. And Abel is feeding a flock, and Cain hath been servant of the ground.
YLT_Paraphrased: Abel is a brother, even Abel, and he's a servant of the ground.
DRA_Original: And again she brought forth his brother Abel. And Abel was a shepherd, and Cain a husbandman.

YLT_Original: And it cometh to pass at the end of days that Cain bringeth from the fruit of the ground a present to Jehovah;
YLT_Paraphrased: in the end, when the fruit of the ground is brought to the altar of God, it will be the end of the world;
DRA_Original: And it came to pass after many days, that Cain offered, of the fruits of the earth, gifts to the Lord.

YLT_Original: and Abel, he hath brought, he also, from the female firstlings of his flock, even from their fat ones; and Jehovah looketh unto Abel and unto his present,
YLT_Paraphrased: Abel, he brought his fat, from the women's flock, and Jehovah looked at Abel and his wife, and he looked at the fat.
DRA_Original: Abel also offered of the firstlings of his flock, and of their fat: and the Lord had respect to Abel, and to his offerings.

YLT_Original: and unto Cain and unto his present He hath not looked; and it is very displeasing to Cain, and his countenance is fallen.
YLT_Paraphrased: Cain and his face is turned away, and he is very displeased with him.
DRA_Original: But to Cain and his offerings he had no respect: and Cain was exceedingly angry, and his countenance fell.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah saith unto Cain, `Why hast thou displeasure? and why hath thy countenance fallen?
YLT_Paraphrased: "why are you angry with me?" And he said to Cain, "Why are you angry with me?"
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to him: Why art thou angry? and why is thy countenance fallen?

YLT_Original: Is there not, if thou dost well, acceptance? and if thou dost not well, at the opening a sin-offering is crouching, and unto thee its desire, and thou rulest over it.'
YLT_Paraphrased: if you do well, you'll be able to accept, and if you don't, you'll be able to accept.
DRA_Original: If thou do well, shalt thou not receive? but if ill, shall not sin forthwith be present at the door? but the lust thereof shall be under thee, and thou shalt have dominion over it.

YLT_Original: And Cain saith unto Abel his brother, [`Let us go into the field;'] and it cometh to pass in their being in the field, that Cain riseth up against Abel his brother, and slayeth him.
YLT_Paraphrased: "let us go to the field," said Cain to Abel's brother, "and it will be over with them." And it will be over with them, and Cain will be killed by Abel's brother.
DRA_Original: And Cain said to Abel his brother: Let us go forth abroad. And when they were in the field, Cain rose up against his brother Abel, and slew him.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah saith unto Cain, `Where  Abel thy brother?' and he saith, `I have not known; my brother's keeper -- I?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "where Abel's brother is?" He asked, and he said, "I don't know, my brother's keeper."
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to Cain: Where is thy brother Abel? And he answered, I know not: am I my brother's keeper?

YLT_Original: And He saith, `What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood is crying unto Me from the ground;
YLT_Paraphrased: "what have you done with your brother's blood? He's crying out from the ground," He said.
DRA_Original: And he said to him: What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth to me from the earth.

YLT_Original: and now, cursed  thou from the ground, which hath opened her mouth to receive the blood of thy brother from thy hand;
YLT_Paraphrased: from the ground, which opened her mouth to take blood from your brother's hand, cursed you.
DRA_Original: Now, therefore, cursed shalt thou be upon the earth, which hath opened her mouth and received the blood of thy brother at thy hand.

YLT_Original: when thou tillest the ground, it doth not add to give its strength to thee -- a wanderer, even a trembling one, thou art in the earth.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you don't add strength to the ground, even a trembling one, until you've got the ground. "
DRA_Original: When thou shalt till it, it shall not yield to thee its fruit: a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be upon the earth.

YLT_Original: And Cain saith unto Jehovah, `Greater is my punishment than to be borne;
YLT_Paraphrased: "greater punishment than I can bear," said Cain.
DRA_Original: And Cain said to the Lord: My iniquity is greater than that I may deserve pardon.

YLT_Original: lo, Thou hast driven me to-day from off the face of the ground, and from Thy face I am hid; and I have been a wanderer, even a trembling one, in the earth, and it hath been -- every one finding me doth slay me.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I was on the ground, and I was trembling, and I was on the ground, and I was trembling, and I was on the ground, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was trembling, and I was
DRA_Original: Behold thou dost cast me out this day from the face of the earth, and I shall be hidden from thy face, and I shall be a vagabond and a fugitive on the earth: every one, therefore, that findeth me, shall kill me.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah saith to him, `Therefore -- of any slayer of Cain sevenfold it is required;' and Jehovah setteth to Cain a token that none finding him doth slay him.
YLT_Paraphrased: "so -- if any of the killers of Cain are sevenfold, it's necessary to kill him; "and Jehovah will give him a token that none of them will find him.
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to him: No, it shall not be so: but whosoever shall kill Cain, shall be punished sevenfold. And the Lord set a mark upon Cain, that whosoever found him should not kill him.

YLT_Original: And Cain goeth out from before Jehovah, and dwelleth in the land, moving about east of Eden;
YLT_Paraphrased: Cain is going to the east, and he's going to the east, and he's going to the east.
DRA_Original: And Cain went out from the face of the Lord, and dwelt as a fugitive on the earth, at the east side of Eden.

YLT_Original: and Cain knoweth his wife, and she conceiveth, and beareth Enoch; and he is building a city, and he calleth the name of the city, according to the name of his son -- Enoch.
YLT_Paraphrased: Cain knew his wife, and she was pregnant, and she gave birth to Enoch, and he called the city, Enoch.
DRA_Original: And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived, and brought forth Henoch: and he built a city, and called the name thereof by the name of his son Henoch.

YLT_Original: And born to Enoch is Irad; and Irad hath begotten Mehujael; and Mehujael hath begotten Methusael; and Methusael hath begotten Lamech.
YLT_Paraphrased: Ira, Enoch, Irad, Mehujael, and Mehujael, Methusael, and Methusael, Lamech.
DRA_Original: And Henoch begot Irad, and Irad begot Maviael, and Maviael begot Mathusael, and Mathusael begot Lamech:

YLT_Original: And Lamech taketh to himself two wives, the name of the one Adah, and the name of the second Zillah.
YLT_Paraphrased: Lamech's wife, the name of the one Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
DRA_Original: Who took two wives: the name of the one was Ada, and the name of the other Sella.

YLT_Original: And Adah beareth Jabal, he hath been father of those inhabiting tents and purchased possessions;
YLT_Paraphrased: Adah's father, he's a father of the tents and the purchase of property;
DRA_Original: And Ada brought forth Jabel: who was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of herdsmen.

YLT_Original: and the name of his brother  Jubal, he hath been father of every one handling harp and organ.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's got all his brothers and sisters, his father's name Jubal, he's got everything.
DRA_Original: And his brother's name was Jubal; he was the father of them that play upon the harp and the organs.

YLT_Original: And Zillah she also bare Tubal-Cain, an instructor of every artificer in brass and iron; and a sister of Tubal-Cain  Naamah.
YLT_Paraphrased: she also had a sister of Naamah, a teacher of all brass and iron.
DRA_Original: Sella also brought forth Tubalcain, who was a hammerer and artificer in every work of brass and iron. And the sister of Tubalcain was Noema.

YLT_Original: And Lamech saith to his wives: -- `Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; Wives of Lamech, give ear  my saying: For a man I have slain for my wound, Even a young man for my hurt;
YLT_Paraphrased: "Adah and Zillah, hear me, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife, my wife,
DRA_Original: And Lamech said to his wives Ada and Sella: Hear my voice, ye wives of Lamech, hearken to my speech: for I have slain a man to the wounding of myself, and a stripling to my own bruising.

YLT_Original: For sevenfold is required for Cain, And for Lamech seventy and sevenfold.'
YLT_Paraphrased: Cain, Lamech, and seventy-seven times. "
DRA_Original: Sevenfold vengeance shall be taken for Cain: but for Lamech seventy times sevenfold.

YLT_Original: And Adam again knoweth his wife, and she beareth a son, and calleth his name Seth, `for God hath appointed for me another seed instead of Abel:' for Cain had slain him.
YLT_Paraphrased: Adam's wife, who is named Seth, is the same as Abel's wife, and she bears a son.
DRA_Original: Adam also knew his wife again: and she brought forth a son, and called his name Seth, saying: God hath given me another seed, for Abel whom Cain slew.

YLT_Original: And to Seth, to him also a son hath been born, and he calleth his name Enos; then a beginning was made of preaching in the name of Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: Seth, the son of Enos, was born to him, and he called himself Enos.
DRA_Original: But to Seth also was born a son, whom he called Enos; this man began to call upon the name of the Lord.

YLT_Original: And I make known to you, brethren, the good news that I proclaimed to you, which also ye did receive, in which also ye have stood,
YLT_Paraphrased: brothers, I'm telling you the good news that I've told you, which you've also received, and you've stood by.
DRA_Original: Now I make known unto you, brethren, the gospel which I preached to you, which also you have received, and wherein you stand;

YLT_Original: through which also ye are being saved, in what words I proclaimed good news to you, if ye hold fast, except ye did believe in vain,
YLT_Paraphrased: if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you don't believe in vain, if you
DRA_Original: By which also you are saved, if you hold fast after what manner I preached unto you, unless you have believed in vain.

YLT_Original: for I delivered to you first, what also I did receive, that Christ died for our sins, according to the Writings,
YLT_Paraphrased: I've been given the first, what I've done to you, the death of Christ, according to the Bible,
DRA_Original: For I delivered unto you first of all, which I also received: how that Christ died for our sins, according to the scriptures:

YLT_Original: and that he was buried, and that he hath risen on the third day, according to the Writings,
YLT_Paraphrased: according to the Writings, he was buried, and he was taken up on the third day.
DRA_Original: And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day, according to the scriptures:

YLT_Original: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve,
YLT_Paraphrased: then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the twelve, then to the 12.
DRA_Original: And that he was seen by Cephas; and after that by the eleven.

YLT_Original: afterwards he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain till now, and certain also did fall asleep;
YLT_Paraphrased: then he appeared to be over five hundred men, and the rest of them fell asleep;
DRA_Original: Then he was seen by more than five hundred brethren at once: of whom many remain until this present, and some are fallen asleep.

YLT_Original: afterwards he appeared to James, then to all the apostles.
YLT_Paraphrased: then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles.
DRA_Original: After that, he was seen by James, then by all the apostles.

YLT_Original: And last of all -- as to the untimely birth -- he appeared also to me,
YLT_Paraphrased: he looked at me with a look of surprise, as if he had just been born.
DRA_Original: And last of all, he was seen also by me, as by one born out of due time.

YLT_Original: for I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I did persecute the assembly of God,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm the least of the apostles, who don't deserve to be called an apostle, because I've done something wrong to the assembly of God.
DRA_Original: For I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

YLT_Original: and by the grace of God I am what I am, and His grace that  towards me came not in vain, but more abundantly than they all did I labour, yet not I, but the grace of God that  with me;
YLT_Paraphrased: I've done what I've done, and God's grace that I'm what I'm like, and I didn't even have to work, but God's grace that I'm what I'm like, and I'm not like them, but God's grace that I'm what I'm like.
DRA_Original: But by the grace of God, I am what I am; and his grace in me hath not been void, but I have laboured more abundantly than all they: yet not I, but the grace of God with me.

YLT_Original: whether, then, I or they, so we preach, and so ye did believe.
YLT_Paraphrased: then I'm telling you, and you believed it, so you did.
DRA_Original: For whether I, or they, so we preach, and so you have believed.

YLT_Original: And if Christ is preached, that out of the dead he hath risen, how say certain among you, that there is no rising again of dead persons?
YLT_Paraphrased: how do you know that there's no resurrection of the dead?
DRA_Original: Now if Christ be preached, that he arose again from the dead, how do some among you say, that there is no resurrection of the dead?

YLT_Original: and if there be no rising again of dead persons, neither hath Christ risen;
YLT_Paraphrased: if there's no more dead, neither will Christ rise.
DRA_Original: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then Christ is not risen again.

YLT_Original: and if Christ hath not risen, then void  our preaching, and void also your faith,
YLT_Paraphrased: if God doesn't come, then we won't preach, and we won't believe you.
DRA_Original: And if Christ be not risen again, then is our preaching vain, and your faith is also vain.

YLT_Original: and we also are found false witnesses of God, because we did testify of God that He raised up the Christ, whom He did not raise if then dead persons do not rise;
YLT_Paraphrased: we also have false witnesses to God, because we have testified to God that he raised the Lord, who he did not raise if he had died.
DRA_Original: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God: because we have given testimony against God, that he hath raised up Christ; whom he hath not raised up, if the dead rise not again.

YLT_Original: for if dead persons do not rise, neither hath Christ risen,
YLT_Paraphrased: if the dead don't rise, neither will Christ be born.
DRA_Original: For if the dead rise not again, neither is Christ risen again.

YLT_Original: and if Christ hath not risen, vain is your faith, ye are yet in your sins;
YLT_Paraphrased: if the Lord doesn't come, your faith is useless, you're still in the sin.
DRA_Original: And if Christ be not risen again, your faith is vain, for you are yet in your sins.

YLT_Original: then, also, those having fallen asleep in Christ did perish;
YLT_Paraphrased: and the ones who fell asleep in the Lord's death, they died.
DRA_Original: Then they also that are fallen asleep in Christ, are perished.

YLT_Original: if in this life we have hope in Christ only, of all men we are most to be pitied.
YLT_Paraphrased: we are most pitied in this life, for we hope for the salvation of all men.
DRA_Original: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.

YLT_Original: And now, Christ hath risen out of the dead -- the first-fruits of those sleeping he became,
YLT_Paraphrased: the first fruits of the dead were the first to rise, the first to wake up.
DRA_Original: But now Christ is risen from the dead, the firstfruits of them that sleep:

YLT_Original: for since through man  the death, also through man  a rising again of the dead,
YLT_Paraphrased: since the death of the dead, the dead have risen again, and the dead have risen again.
DRA_Original: For by a man came death, and by a man the resurrection of the dead.

YLT_Original: for even as in Adam all die, so also in the Christ all shall be made alive,
YLT_Paraphrased: as in Adam, so in the Christ, all die.
DRA_Original: And as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all shall be made alive.

YLT_Original: and each in his proper order, a first-fruit Christ, afterwards those who are the Christ's, in his presence,
YLT_Paraphrased: in the presence of Christ, the first fruit of the fruit of the tree, then the Christ himself, in the presence of God.
DRA_Original: But every one in his own order: the firstfruits Christ, then they that are of Christ, who have believed in his coming.

YLT_Original: then -- the end, when he may deliver up the reign to God, even the Father, when he may have made useless all rule, and all authority and power --
YLT_Paraphrased: when he's done with the throne, even the Father, when he's not able to do anything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything, and everything,
DRA_Original: Afterwards the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God and the Father, when he shall have brought to nought all principality, and power, and virtue.

YLT_Original: for it behoveth him to reign till he may have put all the enemies under his feet --
YLT_Paraphrased: he must be ruled until he can destroy all enemies --
DRA_Original: For he must reign, until he hath put all his enemies under his feet.

YLT_Original: the last enemy is done away -- death;
YLT_Paraphrased: death to the last enemy -- death;
DRA_Original: And the enemy death shall be destroyed last: For he hath put all things under his feet. And whereas he saith,

YLT_Original: for all things He did put under his feet, and, when one may say that all things have been subjected, [it is] evident that He is excepted who did subject the all things to him,
YLT_Paraphrased: it is clear that He is not excluded from the things He has done to him, and, when one can say that everything has been taken, it is clear that He is not excluded.
DRA_Original: All things are put under him; undoubtedly, he is excepted, who put all things under him.

YLT_Original: and when the all things may be subjected to him, then the Son also himself shall be subject to Him, who did subject to him the all things, that God may be the all in all.
YLT_Paraphrased: when everything is subject to him, then the Son himself is subject to him, who has taken everything, that God may be all in all.
DRA_Original: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then the Son also himself shall be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.

YLT_Original: Seeing what shall they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? why also are they baptized for the dead?
YLT_Paraphrased: why are they baptized for the dead?
DRA_Original: Otherwise what shall they do that are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not again at all? why are they then baptized for them?

YLT_Original: why also do we stand in peril every hour?
YLT_Paraphrased: and every hour of the hour is dangerous?
DRA_Original: Why also are we in danger every hour?

YLT_Original: Every day do I die, by the glorying of you that I have in Christ Jesus our Lord:
YLT_Paraphrased: by the glory of God, I'm dying every day, by your grace.
DRA_Original: I die daily, I protest by your glory, brethren, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

YLT_Original: if after the manner of a man with wild beasts I fought in Ephesus, what the advantage to me if the dead do not rise? let us eat and drink, for to-morrow we die!
YLT_Paraphrased: what if the dead don't rise tomorrow? Let's eat and drink, for tomorrow we'll be dead!
DRA_Original: If (according to man) I fought with beasts at Ephesus, what doth it profit me, if the dead rise not again? Let us eat and drink, for to morrow we shall die.

YLT_Original: Be not led astray; evil communications corrupt good manners;
YLT_Paraphrased: bad communications corrupt good manners; bad manners corrupt good manners;
DRA_Original: Be not seduced: Evil communications corrupt good manners.

YLT_Original: awake up, as is right, and sin not; for certain have an ignorance of God; for shame to you I say .
YLT_Paraphrased: as I say, it's not a sin, but a sin, for shame to you.
DRA_Original: Awake, ye just, and sin not. For some have not the knowledge of God, I speak it to your shame.

YLT_Original: But some one will say, `How do the dead rise?
YLT_Paraphrased: "how does the dead rise?" Someone will say.
DRA_Original: But some man will say: How do the dead rise again? or with what manner of body shall they come?

YLT_Original: unwise! thou -- what thou dost sow is not quickened except it may die;
YLT_Paraphrased: you -- what you're doing is not quick, but it's not quick to die.
DRA_Original: Senseless man, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die first.

YLT_Original: and that which thou dost sow, not the body that shall be dost thou sow, but bare grain, it may be of wheat, or of some one of the others,
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't have to worry about the body, but the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the grain, or the
DRA_Original: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be; but bare grain, as of wheat, or of some of the rest.

YLT_Original: and God doth give to it a body according as He willed, and to each of the seeds its proper body.
YLT_Paraphrased: God gives each seed a body according to what He wants.
DRA_Original: But God giveth it a body as he will: and to every seed its proper body.

YLT_Original: All flesh  not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another of fishes, and another of birds;
YLT_Paraphrased: the flesh of men, the same as the beasts, the same as the birds, the same as the fish, the same as the birds, the same as the birds.
DRA_Original: All flesh is not the same flesh: but one is the flesh of men, another of beasts, another of birds, another of fishes.

YLT_Original: and [there are] heavenly bodies, and earthly bodies; but one  the glory of the heavenly, and another that of the earthly;
YLT_Paraphrased: [there's] a heavenly body, a heavenly body, a mortal body; but one of the heavenly, the other of the earthly;
DRA_Original: And there are bodies celestial, and bodies terrestrial: but, one is the glory of the celestial, and another of the terrestrial.

YLT_Original: one glory of sun, and another glory of moon, and another glory of stars, for star from star doth differ in glory.
YLT_Paraphrased: the sun, the moon, the moon, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars, the stars,
DRA_Original: One is the glory of the sun, another the glory of the moon, and another the glory of the stars. For star differeth from star in glory.

YLT_Original: So also  the rising again of the dead: it is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption;
YLT_Paraphrased: the rising of the dead: It's a corruption, it's a corruption, it's a corruption.
DRA_Original: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it shall rise in incorruption.

YLT_Original: it is sown in dishonour, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;
YLT_Paraphrased: it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it is a shame, it's a shame, it's a shame, it's a shame, it's a shame, it's a shame
DRA_Original: It is sown in dishonour, it shall rise in glory. It is sown in weakness, it shall rise in power.

YLT_Original: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body; there is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body;
YLT_Paraphrased: it's a natural body, and it's a spiritual body; it's a natural body, and it's a spiritual body.
DRA_Original: It is sown a natural body, it shall rise a spiritual body. If there be a natural body, there is also a spiritual body, as it is written:

YLT_Original: so also it hath been written, `The first man Adam became a living creature,' the last Adam  for a life-giving spirit,
YLT_Paraphrased: "Adam became a living creature," the last Adam was a living spirit, "Adam's life was a life-giving spirit."
DRA_Original: The first man Adam was made into a living soul; the last Adam into a quickening spirit.

YLT_Original: but that which is spiritual  not first, but that which  natural, afterwards that which  spiritual.
YLT_Paraphrased: the spiritual is not first, but the natural, then the spiritual.
DRA_Original: Yet that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; afterwards that which is spiritual.

YLT_Original: The first man  out of the earth, earthy; the second man  the Lord out of heaven;
YLT_Paraphrased: the first man on Earth, the second man from heaven;
DRA_Original: The first man was of the earth, earthly: the second man, from heaven, heavenly.

YLT_Original: as  the earthy, such  also the earthy; and as  the heavenly, such  also the heavenly;
YLT_Paraphrased: the earth, the heavenly, the heavenly; and as the heavenly, the heavenly;
DRA_Original: Such as is the earthly, such also are the earthly: and such as is the heavenly, such also are they that are heavenly.

YLT_Original: and, according as we did bear the image of the earthy, we shall bear also the image of the heavenly.
YLT_Paraphrased: as we look at the earth, we will also look at the sky.
DRA_Original: Therefore as we have borne the image of the earthly, let us bear also the image of the heavenly.

YLT_Original: And this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood the reign of God is not able to inherit, nor doth the corruption inherit the incorruption;
YLT_Paraphrased: brothers, the blood and flesh of God cannot be inherited, nor can the corruption inherit the incorruption;
DRA_Original: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot possess the kingdom of God: neither shall corruption possess incorruption.

YLT_Original: lo, I tell you a secret; we indeed shall not all sleep, and we all shall be changed;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm telling you a secret, we're not going to sleep, and we'll change.
DRA_Original: Behold, I tell you a mystery. We shall all indeed rise again: but we shall not all be changed.

YLT_Original: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, in the last trumpet, for it shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we -- we shall be changed:
YLT_Paraphrased: in the last trumpet, when the dead are raised, we will be changed, and we will be changed:
DRA_Original: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall rise again incorruptible: and we shall be changed.

YLT_Original: for it behoveth this corruptible to put on incorruption, and this mortal to put on immortality;
YLT_Paraphrased: it is a mortal to put on immortality, and a mortal to put on immortality;
DRA_Original: For this corruptible must put on incorruption; and this mortal must put on immortality.

YLT_Original: and when this corruptible may have put on incorruption, and this mortal may have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the word that hath been written, `The Death was swallowed up -- to victory;
YLT_Paraphrased: when the corruptible may be taken away, and the mortal may be reborn, then the word of the word is fulfilled, "The death was swallowed up - to victory."
DRA_Original: And when this mortal hath put on immortality, then shall come to pass the saying that is written: Death is swallowed up in victory.

YLT_Original: where, O Death, thy sting? where, O Hades, thy victory?'
YLT_Paraphrased: where, O Hades, your victory?'
DRA_Original: O death, where is thy victory? O death, where is thy sting?

YLT_Original: and the sting of the death  the sin, and the power of the sin the law;
YLT_Paraphrased: the death of the sin, the power of the sin, the law;
DRA_Original: Now the sting of death is sin: and the power of sin is the law.

YLT_Original: and to God -- thanks, to Him who is giving us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ;
YLT_Paraphrased: thanks to God, who gave us the victory over God's will;
DRA_Original: But thanks be to God, who hath given us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

YLT_Original: so that, my brethren beloved, become ye stedfast, unmovable, abounding in the work of the Lord at all times, knowing that your labour is not vain in the Lord.
YLT_Paraphrased: brothers, my brothers, you will be firm, immovable, unyielding, and always working for God's sake, knowing that your work is not futile.
DRA_Original: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye steadfast and unmoveable; always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

YLT_Original: A Psalm of David, in his being in the wilderness of Judah. O God, Thou  my God, earnestly do I seek Thee, Thirsted for Thee hath my soul, Longed for Thee hath my flesh, In a land dry and weary, without waters.
YLT_Paraphrased: for the sake of God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm looking for God, I'm
DRA_Original: Unto the end, a psalm for David.

YLT_Original: So in the sanctuary I have seen Thee, To behold Thy strength and Thine honour.
YLT_Paraphrased: I've seen the strength and honor of Thy strength and honor in the sanctuary.
DRA_Original: Hear, O God, my prayer, when I make supplication to thee: deliver my soul from the fear of the enemy.

YLT_Original: Because better  Thy kindness than life, My lips do praise Thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm glad you're not alive, but I'm glad you're not alive, My lips are full of praise.
DRA_Original: Thou hast protected me from the assembly of the malignant; from the multitude of the workers of iniquity.

YLT_Original: So I bless Thee in my life, in Thy name I lift up my hands.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm in your name, I'm lifting my hands in your name.
DRA_Original: For they have whetted their tongues like a sword; they have bent their bow a bitter thing,

YLT_Original: As  milk and fatness is my soul satisfied, And  singing lips doth my mouth praise.
YLT_Paraphrased: my soul is satisfied with milk and fatness, and my mouth is singing.
DRA_Original: To shoot in secret the undefiled.

YLT_Original: If I have remembered Thee on my couch, In the watches -- I meditate on Thee.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm meditating on Thee in the watch -- I'm thinking of Thee.
DRA_Original: They will shoot at him on a sudden, and will not fear: they are resolute in wickedness. They have talked of hiding snares; they have said: Who shall see them?

YLT_Original: For Thou hast been a help to me, And in the shadow of Thy wings I sing.
YLT_Paraphrased: I sing in the shadow of your wings, Thou have helped me.
DRA_Original: They have searched after iniquities: they have failed in their search. Man shall come to a deep heart:

YLT_Original: Cleaved hath my soul after Thee, On me hath Thy right hand taken hold.
YLT_Paraphrased: I have your hand on my soul, and your hand is on my soul.
DRA_Original: And God shall be exalted. The arrows of children are their wounds:

YLT_Original: And they who for desolation seek my soul, Go in to the lower parts of the earth.
YLT_Paraphrased: they seek my soul in the depths of the earth.
DRA_Original: And their tongues against them are made weak. All that saw them were troubled;

YLT_Original: They cause him to run on the edge of the sword, A portion for foxes they are.
YLT_Paraphrased: he runs into the sword, and a part of the fox is in the sword.
DRA_Original: And every man was afraid. And they declared the works of God: and understood his doings.

YLT_Original: And the king doth rejoice in God, Boast himself doth every one swearing by Him, But stopped is the mouth of those speaking lies!
YLT_Paraphrased: the king is happy with God, but he's all saying lies to him, but he stops his mouth!
DRA_Original: The just shall rejoice in the Lord, and shall hope in him: and all the upright in heart shall be praised.

YLT_Original: My little children, these things I write to you, that ye may not sin: and if any one may sin, an advocate we have with the Father, Jesus Christ, a righteous one,
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm writing you, so you don't sin, and if anyone sins, it's a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man, a good man,
DRA_Original: My little children, these things I write to you, that you may not sin. But if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the just:

YLT_Original: and he -- he is a propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for the whole world,
YLT_Paraphrased: he's a propitiation for our sins, not just for ourselves, but for the whole world.
DRA_Original: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for those of the whole world.

YLT_Original: and in this we know that we have known him, if his commands we may keep;
YLT_Paraphrased: we know if we can keep his orders, if we can;
DRA_Original: And by this we know that we have known him, if we keep his commandments.

YLT_Original: he who is saying, `I have known him,' and his command is not keeping, a liar he is, and in him the truth is not;
YLT_Paraphrased: he's a liar, and he's telling the truth, but he's lying to himself, and he's telling the truth.
DRA_Original: He who saith that he knoweth him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

YLT_Original: and whoever may keep his word, truly in him the love of God hath been perfected; in this we know that in him we are.
YLT_Paraphrased: we know that in him we have perfected love, in this we know that he loves God.
DRA_Original: But he that keepeth his word, in him in very deed the charity of God is perfected; and by this we know that we are in him.

YLT_Original: He who is saying in him he doth remain, ought according as he walked also himself so to walk.
YLT_Paraphrased: he says he'll stay, as he's walking, so he can walk himself.
DRA_Original: He that saith he abideth in him, ought himself also to walk, even as he walked.

YLT_Original: Brethren, a new command I write not to you, but an old command, that ye had from the beginning -- the old command is the word that ye heard from the beginning;
YLT_Paraphrased: brothers, I'm writing a new command, not from the beginning, but from the beginning, the old command, that you've heard from the beginning.
DRA_Original: Dearly beloved, I write not a new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you have heard.

YLT_Original: again, a new command I write to you, which thing is true in him and in you, because the darkness doth pass away, and the true light doth now shine;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm writing you a new command, which is true for you and me, because the darkness is fading, and the light is shining;
DRA_Original: Again a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true both in him and in you; because the darkness is passed, and the true light now shineth.

YLT_Original: he who is saying, in the light he is, and his brother is hating, in the darkness he is till now;
YLT_Paraphrased: he says, in the light he's in, and his brother hates him, in the dark he's been in;
DRA_Original: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.

YLT_Original: he who is loving his brother, in the light he doth remain, and a stumbling-block in him there is not;
YLT_Paraphrased: he loves his brother, and he's not going to be a stumbling block to him, and he's not going to be a stumbling block to him.
DRA_Original: He that loveth his brother, abideth in the light, and there is no scandal in him.

YLT_Original: and he who is hating his brother, in the darkness he is, and in the darkness he doth walk, and he hath not known whither he doth go, because the darkness did blind his eyes.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's not in the dark, and he's not in the dark, but he's not in the dark, but he's not in the dark, but he's not in the dark, but he's not in the dark.
DRA_Original: But he that hateth his brother, is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth; because the darkness hath blinded his eyes.

YLT_Original: I write to you, little children, because the sins have been forgiven you through his name;
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm writing you, little kids, because the sins have been forgiven by his name.
