DRA_Original: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.

YLT_Original: I write to you, fathers, because ye have known him who  from the beginning; I write to you, young men, because ye have overcome the evil. I write to you, little youths, because ye have known the Father:
YLT_Paraphrased: I write to you, young men, because you know the father, and I write to you, young men, because you've overcome the evil.
DRA_Original: I write unto you, fathers, because you have known him, who is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because you have overcome the wicked one.

YLT_Original: I did write to you, fathers, because ye have known him who  from the beginning; I did write to you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God in you doth remain, and ye have overcome the evil.
YLT_Paraphrased: I wrote you, my father, because you've known him from the beginning, and I've written to you, young men, because you're strong, and the word of God is still in you.
DRA_Original: I write unto you, babes, because you have known the Father. I write unto you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and you have overcome the wicked one.

YLT_Original: Love not ye the world, nor the things in the world; if any one doth love the world, the love of the Father is not in him,
YLT_Paraphrased: if anyone loves the world, he doesn't love the world, but the Father.
DRA_Original: Love not the world, nor the things which are in the world. If any man love the world, the charity of the Father is not in him.

YLT_Original: because all that  in the world -- the desire of the flesh, and the desire of the eyes, and the ostentation of the life -- is not of the Father, but of the world,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Father, the world, the desire of the flesh, the desire of the eyes, the ostentation of life -- is not of the Father, but of the world.
DRA_Original: For all that is in the world, is the concupiscence of the flesh, and the concupiscence of the eyes, and the pride of life, which is not of the Father, but is of the world.

YLT_Original: and the world doth pass away, and the desire of it, and he who is doing the will of God, he doth remain -- to the age.
YLT_Paraphrased: the world is dying, and the desire of the soul, and the one who does it, he stays.
DRA_Original: And the world passeth away, and the concupiscence thereof: but he that doth the will of God, abideth for ever.

YLT_Original: Little youths, it is the last hour; and even as ye heard that the antichrist doth come, even now antichrists have become many -- whence we know that it is the last hour;
YLT_Paraphrased: it's the last hour, and even as you've heard the antichrist is coming, they're growing -- so we know it's the last hour.
DRA_Original: Little children, it is the last hour; and as you have heard that Antichrist cometh, even now there are become many Antichrists: whereby we know that it is the last hour.

YLT_Original: out of us they went forth, but they were not of us, for if they had been of us, they would have remained with us; but -- that they might be manifested that they are not all of us.
YLT_Paraphrased: they came, but they weren't of us, for if they were of us, they would have stayed with us.
DRA_Original: They went out from us, but they were not of us. For if they had been of us, they would no doubt have remained with us; but that they may be manifest, that they are not all of us.

YLT_Original: And ye have an anointing from the Holy One, and have known all things;
YLT_Paraphrased: you have the Holy One's blessing, and you know everything;
DRA_Original: But you have the unction from the Holy One, and know all things.

YLT_Original: I did not write to you because ye have not known the truth, but because ye have known it, and because no lie is of the truth.
YLT_Paraphrased: you didn't write to me because you didn't know the truth, but because you knew it, and because no lie is true.
DRA_Original: I have not written to you as to them that know not the truth, but as to them that know it: and that no lie is of the truth.

YLT_Original: Who is the liar, except he who is denying that Jesus is the Christ? this one is the antichrist who is denying the Father and the Son;
YLT_Paraphrased: the liar, except he who denies the truth of the Lord Jesus Christ?
DRA_Original: Who is a liar, but he who denieth that Jesus is the Christ? This is Antichrist, who denieth the Father, and the Son.

YLT_Original: every one who is denying the Son, neither hath he the Father, [he who is confessing the Son hath the Father also.]
YLT_Paraphrased: no one denies the Son, no one denies the Father.
DRA_Original: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father. He that confesseth the Son, hath the Father also.

YLT_Original: Ye, then, that which ye heard from the beginning, in you let it remain; if in you may remain that which from the beginning ye did hear, ye also in the Son and in the Father shall remain,
YLT_Paraphrased: if you can, then it will remain with you, if you can, then it's what you've heard from the beginning, so you'll stay with the Father and the Son.
DRA_Original: As for you, let that which you have heard from the beginning, abide in you. If that abide in you, which you have heard from the beginning, you also shall abide in the Son, and in the Father.

YLT_Original: and this is the promise that He did promise us -- the life the age-during.
YLT_Paraphrased: this is the promise he promised us -- the life he promised us.
DRA_Original: And this is the promise which he hath promised us, life everlasting.

YLT_Original: These things I did write to you concerning those leading you astray;
YLT_Paraphrased: I've written you about things you've done to me;
DRA_Original: These things have I written to you, concerning them that seduce you.

YLT_Original: and you, the anointing that ye did receive from him, in you it doth remain, and ye have no need that any one may teach you, but as the same anointing doth teach you concerning all, and is true, and is not a lie, and even as was taught you, ye shall remain in him.
YLT_Paraphrased: you, the anointing that you've received from him, in you, it's still there, and you don't have to teach anyone else, but as the same anointing doth teach you, and it's true.
DRA_Original: And as for you, let the unction, which you have received from him, abide in you. And you have no need that any man teach you; but as his unction teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie. And as it hath taught you, abide in him.

YLT_Original: And now, little children, remain in him, that when he may be manifested, we may have boldness, and may not be ashamed before him, in his presence;
YLT_Paraphrased: when he's in his presence, little kids remain, so we can be brave, and we don't have to be ashamed of him.
DRA_Original: And now, little children, abide in him, that when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be confounded by him at his coming.

YLT_Original: if ye know that he is righteous, know ye that every one doing the righteousness, of him hath been begotten.
YLT_Paraphrased: knowing that he is righteous, know that everyone who does the right, he has been born.
DRA_Original: If you know, that he is just, know ye, that every one also, who doth justice, is born of him.

YLT_Original: And these  the last words of David: -- `The affirmation of David son of Jesse -- And the affirmation of the man raised up -- Concerning the Anointed of the God of Jacob, And the Sweetness of the Songs of Israel:
YLT_Paraphrased: "the affirmation of David's son of Jesse - And the affirmation of the man who raised himself - Concerning the Anointed of God's name - And the sweetness of the songs of Israel:
DRA_Original: Now these are David's last words. David the son of Isai said: The man to whom it was appointed concerning the Christ of the God of Jacob, the excellent psalmist of Israel said:

YLT_Original: The Spirit of Jehovah hath spoken by me, And His word  on my tongue.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Spirit of God spoke to me, and I spoke in my tongue.
DRA_Original: The spirit of the Lord hath spoken by me and his word by my tongue.

YLT_Original: He said -- the God of Israel -- to me, He spake -- the Rock of Israel: He who is ruling over man  righteous, He is ruling in the fear of God.
YLT_Paraphrased: he spoke to me - the God of Israel - the one who rules the world - the one who's afraid of God.
DRA_Original: The God of Israel said to me, the strong one of Israel spoke, the ruler of men, the just ruler in the fear of God.

YLT_Original: And as the light of morning he riseth, A morning sun -- no clouds! By the shining, by the rain, Tender grass of the earth!
YLT_Paraphrased: the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun rises, the sun
DRA_Original: As the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, shineth in the morning without clouds, and as the grass springeth out of the earth by rain.

YLT_Original: For -- not so  my house with God; For -- a covenant age-during He made with me, Arranged in all things, and kept; For -- all my salvation, and all desire, For -- He hath not caused  to spring up.
YLT_Paraphrased: for -- all my salvation, and all desire, for -- He didn't cause me to fall, but He gave me everything, and everything I wanted.
DRA_Original: Neither is my house so great with God, that he should make with me an eternal covenant, firm in all things and assured. For he is all my salvation, and all my will: neither is there ought thereof that springeth not up.

YLT_Original: As to the worthless -- As a thorn driven away  all of them, For -- not by hand are they taken;
YLT_Paraphrased: to the worthless -- As a thorn that drives them away, For -- not by hand.
DRA_Original: But transgressors shall all of them be plucked up as thorns: which are not taken away with hands.

YLT_Original: And the man who cometh against them Is filled with iron and the staff of a spear, And with fire they are utterly burnt In the cessation.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the man who comes to them is filled with iron and the spear, and the fire is completely extinguished. "
DRA_Original: And if a man will touch them, he must be armed with iron and with the staff of a lance: but they shall be set on fire and burnt to nothing.

YLT_Original: These  the names of the mighty ones whom David hath: sitting in the seat  the Tachmonite, head of the captains -- he  Adino, who hardened himself against eight hundred -- wounded at one time.
YLT_Paraphrased: Adino, who was wounded in the head of the Tachmonite, was wounded by eight hundred times.
DRA_Original: These are the names of the valiant men of David. Jesbaham sitting in the chair was the wisest chief among the three, he was like the most tender little worm of the wood, who killed eight hundred men at one onset.

YLT_Original: And after him  Eleazar son of Dodo, son of Ahohi, of the three mighty men with David; in their exposing themselves among the Philistines -- they have been gathered there to battle, and the men of Israel go up --
YLT_Paraphrased: they were gathered in the battle with the three great men of Ahohi, Ahohi's son, and the men of Israel, and the men of Israel were on the ground.
DRA_Original: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three valiant men that were with David when they defied the Philistines, and they were there gathered together to battle.

YLT_Original: he hath arisen, and smiteth among the Philistines till that his hand hath been weary, and his hand cleaveth unto the sword, and Jehovah worketh a great salvation on that day, and the people turn back after him only to strip off.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's risen, and he's smiting the Philistines until he's tired, and he's holding the sword with his hand, and the people will be saved by God, and the people will be saved by him.
DRA_Original: And when the men of Israel were gone away, he stood and smote the Philistines till his hand was weary, and grew stiff with the sword: and the Lord wrought a great victory that day: and the people that were fled away, returned to take spoils of them that were slain.

YLT_Original: And after him  Shammah son of Agee the Hararite, and the Philistines are gathered into a company, and there is there a portion of the field full of lentiles, and the people hath fled from the presence of the Philistines,
YLT_Paraphrased: Shammah's son of Agee, the Hararite, and the Philistians are gathered together, and there's a lot of them, and the people fled from the presence of Shammah.
DRA_Original: And after him was Semma the son of Age of Arari. And the Philistines were gathered together in a troop: for there was a field full of lentils. And when the people were fled from the face of the Philistines,

YLT_Original: and he stationeth himself in the midst of the portion, and delivereth it, and smiteth the Philistines, and Jehovah worketh a great salvation.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's going to the part, and he's going to the place, and he's gonna be there, and he's gonna destroy the Philistines, and the Lord will save him.
DRA_Original: He stood in the midst of the field, and defended it, and defeated the Philistines: and the Lord gave a great victory.

YLT_Original: And three of the thirty heads go down and come unto the harvest, unto David, unto the cave of Adullam, and the company of the Philistines are encamping in the valley of Rephaim,
YLT_Paraphrased: the thirty heads are down and they go to the harvest, to David, to the cave of Adullam, and the Philistines are in the valley of Rephaim.
DRA_Original: Moreover also before this the three who were princes among the thirty, went down and came to David in the harvest time into the cave of Odollam: and the camp of the Philistines was in the valley of the giants.

YLT_Original: and David  then in a fortress, and the station of the Philistines  then in Beth-Lehem,
YLT_Paraphrased: then in the fortress, the Philistines were in Beth-Lehem, and the Philistines were in Beth-Lehem.
DRA_Original: And David was then in a hold. and there was a garrison of the Philistines then in Bethlehem.

YLT_Original: and David longeth and saith, `Who doth give me a drink of the water of the well of Beth-Lehem, which  by the gate?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "who's gonna give me a drink of the water from Beth-Lehem?" Said David longeth.
DRA_Original: And David longed, and said: O that some man would get me a drink of the water out of the cistern, that is in Bethlehem, by the gate.

YLT_Original: And the three mighty ones cleave through the camp of the Philistines, and draw water out of the well of Beth-Lehem, which  by the gate, and take  up, and bring in unto David; and he was not willing to drink it, and poureth it out to Jehovah,
YLT_Paraphrased: the three mighty ones, the Philistians, the Beth-Lehemians, and the gate, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and the water, and
DRA_Original: And the three valiant men broke through the camp of the Philistines, and drew water out of the cistern of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and brought it to David: but he would not drink, but offered it to the Lord,

YLT_Original: and saith, `Far be it from me, O Jehovah, to do this; is it the blood of the men who are going with their lives?' and he was not willing to drink it; these  did the three mighty ones.
YLT_Paraphrased: "oh, for God's sake, I don't want to do it, O Jehovah, I'm not going to drink it, is it blood of the men who are going to live?" He said, not willing to drink it.
DRA_Original: Saying: The Lord be merciful to me, that I may not do this: shall I drink the blood of these men that went, and the peril of their lives? therefore he would not drink. These things did these three mighty men.

YLT_Original: And Abishai brother of Joab, son of Zeruiah, he  head of three, and he is lifting up his spear against three hundred -- wounded, and he hath a name among three.
YLT_Paraphrased: Abishai's brother Joab, son of Zeruiah, is the head of three, and he's got a name among three.
DRA_Original: Abisai also the brother of Joab, the son of Sarvia, was chief among three: and he lifted up his spear against three hundred whom he slew, and he was renowned among the three,

YLT_Original: Of the three is he not the honoured? and he becometh their head; and unto the  three he hath not come.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's not the honored one, and he's not the one who came to the three.
DRA_Original: And the noblest of three, and was their chief, but to the three first he attained not.

YLT_Original: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada (son of a man of valour, great in deeds from Kabzeel), he hath smitten two lion-like men of Moab, and he hath gone down and smitten the lion in the midst of the pit in a day of snow.
YLT_Paraphrased: he struck two lion-like men of Moab, and he fell and struck the lion.
DRA_Original: And Banaias the son of Joiada a most valiant man, of great deeds, of Cabseel: he slew the two lions of Moab, and he went down, and slew a lion in the midst of a pit, in the time of snow.

YLT_Original: And he hath smitten the Egyptian man, a man of appearance, and in the hand of the Egyptian  a spear, and he goeth down unto him with a rod, and taketh violently away the spear out of the hand of the Egyptian, and slayeth him with his own spear.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Egyptian man, a man of appearance, and he's holding a spear in his hand, and he's going to hit him with a spear, and he's going to fall to him with a spear.
DRA_Original: He also slew an Egyptian, a man worthy to be a sight, having a spear in his hand: but he went down to him with a rod, and forced the spear out of the hand of the Egyptian, and slew him with his own spear.

YLT_Original: These  hath Benaiah son of Jehoiada done, and hath a name among three mighty.
YLT_Paraphrased: Benaiah son of Jehoiada has done it, and he's got a name in three great.
DRA_Original: These things did Banaias the son of Joiada.

YLT_Original: Of the thirty he is honoured, and unto the three he came not; and David setteth him over his guard.
YLT_Paraphrased: he was honored by thirty, and he didn't come to the three.
DRA_Original: And he was renowned among the three valiant men, who were the most honourable among the thirty: but he attained riot to the first three: and David made him of his privy council.

YLT_Original: Asahel brother of Joab  of the thirty; Elhanan son of Dodo of Beth-Lehem.
YLT_Paraphrased: Joab's brother Elhanan, son of Dodo, Beth-Lehem's son.
DRA_Original: Asael the brother of Joab was one of the thirty, Elehanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem.

YLT_Original: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Harodite, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika,
DRA_Original: Semma of Harodi, Elica of Harodi,

YLT_Original: Helez the Paltite, Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
YLT_Paraphrased: Ira son of Ikesh the Tekoite, Ira son of Ikesh the Tekoite.
DRA_Original: Heles of Phalti, Hira the son of Acces of Thecua,

YLT_Original: Abiezer the Annethothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Annethothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethothite, the Annethoth
DRA_Original: Abiezer of Anathoth, Mobonnai of Husati,

YLT_Original: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Ahohite, the Netophathite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ah
DRA_Original: Selmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

YLT_Original: Heleb son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai son of Ribai from Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin,
YLT_Paraphrased: the son of Baanah, the son of Ribai, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin, the son of Benjamin,
DRA_Original: Heled the son of Baana, also a Netophathite, Ithai the son of Ribai of Gabaath of the children of Benjamin,

YLT_Original: Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash,
YLT_Paraphrased: Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash
DRA_Original: Banaia the Pharathonite, Heddai of the torrent Gaas,

YLT_Original: Abi-Albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
YLT_Paraphrased: Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite
DRA_Original: Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth of Beromi,

YLT_Original: Eliahba the Shaalbonite,  the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
YLT_Paraphrased: the sons of Jashan, Jonathan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jashan, the sons of Jash
DRA_Original: Eliaba of Salaboni. The sons of Jassen, Jonathan,

YLT_Original: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam son of Sharar the Hararite,
YLT_Paraphrased: Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite, Ahiam the Hararite,
DRA_Original: Semma of Orori, Aliam the son of Sarar the Arorite,

YLT_Original: Eliphelet son of Ahasbai, son of the Maachathite, Eliam son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
YLT_Paraphrased: Eliam son of Ahithophel, Gilite son of Ahithophel, Eliam son of Ahithophel, Eliam son of Ahithophel, Eliam son of Ahithophel.
DRA_Original: Eliphelet the son of Aasbai the son of Machati, Eliam the son of Achitophel the Gelonite,

YLT_Original: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Ar
DRA_Original: Hesrai of Carmel, Pharai of Arbi,

YLT_Original: Igal son of Nathan from Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
YLT_Paraphrased: Gazan, the son of Nathan, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the
DRA_Original: Igaal the son of Nathan of Soba, Bonni of Gadi,

YLT_Original: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, bearer of the weapons of Joab son of Zeruiah,
YLT_Paraphrased: the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, the weapons of Joab's son of Zeruiah.
DRA_Original: Selec of Ammoni, Naharai the Berothite, armourbearer of Joab the son of Sarvia,

YLT_Original: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
YLT_Paraphrased: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite, Ira the Ithrite
DRA_Original: Ira the Jethrite, Gareb also a Jethrite;

YLT_Original: Uriah the Hittite; in all thirty and seven.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Hittite, in all thirty-seven.
DRA_Original: Urias the Hethite, thirty and seven in all.

YLT_Original: In the going out of Israel from Egypt, The house of Jacob from a strange people,
YLT_Paraphrased: from Egypt to Israel, the house of Jacob's people.
DRA_Original: I have loved, because the Lord will hear the voice of my prayer.

YLT_Original: Judah became His sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Holy Land became his refuge, Israel his territory.
DRA_Original: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me: and in my days I will call upon him.

YLT_Original: The sea hath seen, and fleeth, The Jordan turneth backward.
YLT_Paraphrased: the sea is turning, and the Jordan is turning.
DRA_Original: The sorrows of death have encompassed me: and the perils of hell have found me. I met with trouble and sorrow:

YLT_Original: The mountains have skipped as rams, Heights as sons of a flock.
YLT_Paraphrased: the mountains were skipped, the hills were the sons of the flock.
DRA_Original: And I called upon the name of the Lord. O Lord, deliver my soul.

YLT_Original: What -- to thee, O sea, that thou fleest? O Jordan, thou turnest back!
YLT_Paraphrased: O Jordan, you're turning back! O Jordan, you're turning back!
DRA_Original: The Lord is merciful and just, and our God sheweth mercy.

YLT_Original: O mountains, ye skip as rams! O heights, as sons of a flock!
YLT_Paraphrased: you're going to go down, as the ram! O mountains, as the flock!
DRA_Original: The Lord is the keeper of little ones: I was little and he delivered me.

YLT_Original: From before the Lord be afraid, O earth, From before the God of Jacob,
YLT_Paraphrased: from the Lord's side, O Earth, from the God of Jacob.
DRA_Original: Turn, O my soul, into thy rest: for the Lord hath been bountiful to thee.

YLT_Original: He is turning the rock to a pool of waters, The flint to a fountain of waters!
YLT_Paraphrased: he turns the rock into a pool of water, the stone into a pool of water!
DRA_Original: For he hath delivered my soul from death: my eyes from tears, my feet from falling.

YLT_Original: Wherefore from the Mighty One Times have not been hidden, And those knowing Him have not seen His days.
YLT_Paraphrased: therefore, the Mighty One Times have not been hidden, and those who know him have not seen his days.
DRA_Original: Times are not hid from the Almighty: but they that know him, know not his days.

YLT_Original: The borders they reach, A drove they have taken violently away, Yea, they do evil.
YLT_Paraphrased: they're going to go, they're going to go, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're going, they're
DRA_Original: Some have removed landmarks, have taken away flocks by force, and fed them.

YLT_Original: The ass of the fatherless they lead away, They take in pledge the ox of the widow,
YLT_Paraphrased: the fatherless will take the ox of the widow, and they will take the ox.
DRA_Original: They have driven away the ass of the fatherless, and have taken away the widow's ox for a pledge.

YLT_Original: They turn aside the needy from the way, Together have hid the poor of the earth.
YLT_Paraphrased: together, they hid the poor of the earth in the way.
DRA_Original: They have overturned the way of the poor, and have oppressed together the meek of the earth.

YLT_Original: Lo, wild asses in a wilderness, They have gone out about their work, Seeking early for prey, A mixture for himself -- food for young ones.
YLT_Paraphrased: wild asses in the wild, they seek prey, they eat, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they're hungry, they
DRA_Original: Others like wild asses in the desert go forth to their work: by watching for a prey they get bread for their children.

YLT_Original: In a field his provender they reap, And the vineyard of the wicked they glean.
YLT_Paraphrased: they reap the field, the vineyard of the evil, and the vineyard of the good.
DRA_Original: They reap the field that is not their own, and gather the vintage of his vineyard whom by violence they have oppressed.

YLT_Original: The naked they cause to lodge Without clothing. And there is no covering in the cold.
YLT_Paraphrased: the nakedness is causing them to be naked, and they don't cover themselves.
DRA_Original: They send men away naked, taking away their clothes who have no covering in the cold:

YLT_Original: From the inundation of hills they are wet, And without a refuge -- have embraced a rock.
YLT_Paraphrased: they were wet, and they were without a refuge - they were on the rocks.
DRA_Original: Who are wet, with the showers of the mountains, and having no covering embrace the stones.

YLT_Original: They take violently away From the breast the orphan, And on the poor they lay a pledge.
YLT_Paraphrased: the orphan, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor, the poor,
DRA_Original: They have violently robbed the fatherless, and stripped the poor common people.

YLT_Original: Naked, they have gone without clothing, And hungry -- have taken away a sheaf.
YLT_Paraphrased: they were naked, they were hungry, they took off the clothes, and they ate.
DRA_Original: From the naked and them that go without clothing, and from the hungry they have taken away the ears of corn.

YLT_Original: Between their walls they make oil, Wine-presses they have trodden, and thirst.
YLT_Paraphrased: they have oil, wine, and water in the walls.
DRA_Original: They have taken their rest at noon among the stores of them, who after having trodden the winepresses suffer thirst.

YLT_Original: Because of enmity men do groan, And the soul of pierced ones doth cry, And God doth not give praise.
YLT_Paraphrased: men groan, and the soul of the pierced man is crying, and God doesn't praise.
DRA_Original: Out of the cities they have made men to groan, and the soul of the wounded hath cried out, and God doth not suffer it to pass unrevenged.

YLT_Original: They have been among rebellious ones of light, They have not discerned His ways, Nor abode in His paths.
YLT_Paraphrased: they were among the rebels, they didn't know the ways, nor did they abide in the path.
DRA_Original: They have been rebellious to the light, they have not known his ways, neither have they returned by his paths.

YLT_Original: At the light doth the murderer rise, He doth slay the poor and needy, And in the night he is as a thief.
YLT_Paraphrased: the killer rises, he kills the poor and needy, and in the night he's a thief.
DRA_Original: The murderer riseth at the very break of day, he killeth the needy, and the poor man: but in the night he will be as a thief.

YLT_Original: And the eye of an adulterer Hath observed the twilight, Saying, `No eye doth behold me.' And he putteth the face in secret.
YLT_Paraphrased: "no eye," Hath said, "does not see me." And he hid his face in the dark.
DRA_Original: The eye of the adulterer observeth darkness, saying: No eye shall see me: and he will cover his face.

YLT_Original: He hath dug in the darkness -- houses; By day they shut themselves up, They have not known light.
YLT_Paraphrased: they hid in the dark -- houses; they didn't know the light.
DRA_Original: He diggeth through houses in the dark, as in the day they had appointed for themselves, and they have not known the light.

YLT_Original: When together, morning  to them death shade, When he discerneth the terrors of death shade.
YLT_Paraphrased: when he sees the horror of death, he sees the morning light.
DRA_Original: If the morning suddenly appear, it is to them the shadow of death: and they walk in darkness as if it were in light.

YLT_Original: Light he  on the face of the waters, Vilified is their portion in the earth, He turneth not the way of vineyards.
YLT_Paraphrased: Vilified is the part of the land, He's not going to the vineyard.
DRA_Original: He is light upon the face of the water: cursed be his portion on the earth, let him not walk by the way of the vineyards.

YLT_Original: Drought -- also heat -- consume snow-waters, Sheol [those who] have sinned.
YLT_Paraphrased: heat -- also water -- consumes the snow, Sheol [those who] have sinned.
DRA_Original: Let him pass from the snow waters to excessive heat, and his sin even to hell.

YLT_Original: Forget him doth the womb, Sweeten  him doth the worm, No more is he remembered, And broken as a tree is wickedness.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's forgotten, he's
DRA_Original: Let mercy forget him: may worms be his sweetness: let him be remembered no more, but be broken in pieces as an unfruitful tree.

YLT_Original: Treating evil the barren  beareth not, And  the widow he doth no good,
YLT_Paraphrased: the evil is not treated, the barren is not good, the widow is not good.
DRA_Original: For he hath fed the barren that beareth not, and to the widow he hath done no good.

YLT_Original: And hath drawn the mighty by his power, He riseth, and none believeth in life.
YLT_Paraphrased: he draws the mighty power, and none believe he's alive.
DRA_Original: He hath pulled down the strong by his might: and when he standeth up, he shall not trust to his life.

YLT_Original: He giveth to him confidence, and he is supported, And his eyes  on their ways.
YLT_Paraphrased: he gives him confidence, and he's looking at him with his eyes.
DRA_Original: God hath given him place for penance, and he abuseth it unto pride: but his eyes are upon his ways.

YLT_Original: High they were  a little, and they are not, And they have been brought low. As all  they are shut up, And as the head of an ear of corn cut off.
YLT_Paraphrased: they were a little, and they weren't, and they were cut off by the ears of corn.
DRA_Original: They are lifted up for a little while and shall not stand, and shall be brought down as all things, and shall be taken away, and as the tops of the ears of corn they shall be broken.

YLT_Original: And if not now, who doth prove me a liar, And doth make of nothing my word?
YLT_Paraphrased: if not now, who's gonna prove me a liar, and who's gonna make me nothing?
DRA_Original: And if it be not so, who can convince me that I have lied, and set my words before God?

YLT_Original: By David. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah, And all my inward parts -- His Holy Name.
YLT_Paraphrased: God, my soul, and all my inner parts - the name of God.
DRA_Original: For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: O Lord my God, thou art exceedingly great. Thou hast put on praise and beauty:

YLT_Original: Bless, O my soul, Jehovah, And forget not all His benefits,
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my soul, God, and don't forget the benefits, O God.
DRA_Original: And art clothed with light as with a garment. Who stretchest out the heaven like a pavilion:

YLT_Original: Who is forgiving all thine iniquities, Who is healing all thy diseases,
YLT_Paraphrased: who will forgive all your sins, who will cure all your diseases.
DRA_Original: Who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water. Who makest the clouds thy chariot: who walkest upon the wings of the winds.

YLT_Original: Who is redeeming from destruction thy life, Who is crowning thee -- kindness and mercies,
YLT_Paraphrased: who will save your life, who will be your mercy and kindness.
DRA_Original: Who makest thy angels spirits: and thy ministers a burning fire.

YLT_Original: Who is satisfying with good thy desire, Renew itself as an eagle doth thy youth.
YLT_Paraphrased: your desire is good, Renew is an eagle that will be your youth.
DRA_Original: Who hast founded the earth upon its own bases: it shall not be moved for ever and ever.

YLT_Original: Jehovah is doing righteousness and judgments For all the oppressed.
YLT_Paraphrased: Ezekiel is a righteous man and a judge for all the oppressed.
DRA_Original: The deep like a garment is its clothing: above the mountains shall the waters stand.

YLT_Original: He maketh known His ways to Moses, To the sons of Israel His acts.
YLT_Paraphrased: he knows the ways of Moses, the sons of Israel, and his deeds.
DRA_Original: At thy rebuke they shall flee: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear.

YLT_Original: Merciful and gracious  Jehovah, Slow to anger, and abundant in mercy.
YLT_Paraphrased: kind and compassionate, slow to anger, and generous in mercy.
DRA_Original: The mountains ascend, and the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them.

YLT_Original: Not for ever doth He strive, Nor to the age doth He watch.
YLT_Paraphrased: he never tries, nor does he ever look, he's never trying to be.
DRA_Original: Thou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over; neither shall they return to cover the earth.

YLT_Original: Not according to our sins hath He done to us, Nor according to our iniquities Hath He conferred benefits upon us.
YLT_Paraphrased: he did us, not to our sins, nor to our sins, but to our sins.
DRA_Original: Thou sendest forth springs in the vales: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass.

YLT_Original: For, as the height of the heavens  above the earth, His kindness hath been mighty over those fearing Him.
YLT_Paraphrased: he was generous to those who feared him, as the sky above the earth is high.
DRA_Original: All the beasts of the field shall drink: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst.

YLT_Original: As the distance of east from west He hath put far from us our transgressions.
YLT_Paraphrased: the distance from the east to the west has left us far from our sins.
DRA_Original: Over them the birds of the air shall dwell: from the midst of the rocks they shall give forth their voices.

YLT_Original: As a father hath mercy on sons, Jehovah hath mercy on those fearing Him.
YLT_Paraphrased: fathers have mercy on their sons, and the sons of the fear of God.
DRA_Original: Thou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works:

YLT_Original: For He hath known our frame, Remembering that we  dust.
YLT_Paraphrased: remember, he knows our frame, he remembers we're dust.
DRA_Original: Bringing forth grass for cattle, and herb for the service of men. That thou mayst bring bread out of the earth:

YLT_Original: Mortal man! as grass  his days, As a flower of the field so he flourisheth;
YLT_Paraphrased: the grass is his days, as a flower in the field, so he flourishes;
DRA_Original: And that wine may cheer the heart of man. That he may make the face cheerful with oil: and that bread may strengthen man's heart.

YLT_Original: For a wind hath passed over it, and it is not, And its place doth not discern it any more.
YLT_Paraphrased: the wind passed over him, and he didn't, and he didn't know where he was.
DRA_Original: The trees of the field shall be filled, and the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted:

YLT_Original: And the kindness of Jehovah  from age even unto age on those fearing Him, And His righteousness to sons' sons,
YLT_Paraphrased: the kindness of God's kindness to the sons of men, and the righteousness of the sons of men,
DRA_Original: There the sparrows shall make their nests. The highest of them is the house of the heron.

YLT_Original: To those keeping His covenant, And to those remembering His precepts to do them.
YLT_Paraphrased: to those who keep the promise, and to those who remember the commandments.
DRA_Original: The high hills are a refuge for the harts, the rock for the irchins.

YLT_Original: Jehovah in the heavens Hath established His throne, And His kingdom over all hath ruled.
YLT_Paraphrased: he has established his throne in the sky, and his kingdom is over all.
DRA_Original: He hath made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

YLT_Original: Bless Jehovah, ye His messengers, Mighty in power -- doing His word, To hearken to the voice of His Word.
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my God, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty powerful, you're mighty
DRA_Original: Thou hast appointed darkness, and it is night: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about:

YLT_Original: Bless Jehovah, all ye His hosts, His ministers -- doing His pleasure.
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my God, all his hosts, his ministers -- they're doing his pleasure.
DRA_Original: The young lions roaring after their prey, and seeking their meat from God.

YLT_Original: Bless Jehovah, all ye His works, In all places of His dominion. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah!
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul, my soul,
DRA_Original: The sun ariseth, and they are gathered together: and they shall lie down in their dens.

YLT_Original: And Bezaleel, and Aholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whom Jehovah hath given wisdom and understanding to know to do every work of the service of the sanctuary, have done according to all that Jehovah commanded.
YLT_Paraphrased: they have done everything that God commanded them, and they have done it with wisdom and understanding, and all the wise men who have known the service of the shrine.
DRA_Original: Beseleel, therefore, and Ooliab, and every wise man, to whom the Lord gave wisdom and understanding, to know how to work artificially, made the things that are necessary for the uses of the sanctuary, and which the Lord commanded.

YLT_Original: And Moses calleth unto Bezaleel, and unto Aholiab, and unto every wise-hearted man in whose heart Jehovah hath given wisdom, every one whom his heart lifted up, to come near unto the work to do it.
YLT_Paraphrased: to all who have a heart, to all who have a heart, to all who have a heart, to all who have a heart, to all who have a heart, to come closer to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work, to the work,
DRA_Original: And when Moses had called them, and every skillful man, to whom the Lord had given wisdom, and such as of their own accord had offered themselves to the making of the work,

YLT_Original: And they take from before Moses all the heave-offering which the sons of Israel have brought in for the work of the service of the sanctuary to do it; and still they have brought in unto him a willing-offering morning by morning.
YLT_Paraphrased: they have brought in the offering of the sons of Israel, which they brought to the service of the sanctuary, and they have taken them all the heaves they had brought to the service of the sanctuary.
DRA_Original: He delivered all the offerings of the children of Israel unto them. And while they were earnest about the work, the people daily in the morning offered their vows.

YLT_Original: And all the wise men, who are doing all the work of the sanctuary, come each from his work which they are doing,
YLT_Paraphrased: all the wise men who work in the sanctuary, they all go to work, and they're all doing it.
DRA_Original: Whereupon the workmen being constrained to come,

YLT_Original: and speak unto Moses, saying, `The people are multiplying to bring in more than sufficient for the service of the work which Jehovah commanded to make.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "the people are multiplying, and they bring more than enough to the service of the work that God has commanded to be done."
DRA_Original: Said to Moses: The people offereth more than is necessary.

YLT_Original: And Moses commandeth, and they cause a voice to pass over through the camp, saying, `Let not man or woman make any more work for the heave-offering of the sanctuary;' and the people are restrained from bringing,
YLT_Paraphrased: "let no man or woman work for the heave-offering of the sanctuary;" and the people are held back from the work, and Moses commands them.
DRA_Original: Moses therefore commanded proclamation to be made by the crier's voice: Let neither man nor woman offer any more for the work of the sanctuary. And so they ceased from offering gifts,

YLT_Original: and the work hath been sufficient for them, for all the work, to do it, and to leave.
YLT_Paraphrased: the work was enough for them, for all the work, and they could leave.
DRA_Original: Because the things that were offered did suffice, and were too much.

YLT_Original: And all the wise-hearted ones among the doers of the work make the tabernacle; ten curtains of twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet,  cherubs, work of a designer, he hath made them.
YLT_Paraphrased: the wise ones who work in the field, and the ones who make the tabernacle, they make the tabernacle; ten curtains of blue, purple, purple, and scarlet, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple, and purple
DRA_Original: And all the men that were wise of heart, to accomplish the work of the tabernacle, made ten curtains of twisted fine linen, and violet, and purple, and scarlet twice dyed, with varied work, and the art of embroidering:

YLT_Original: The length of the one curtain  eight and twenty by the cubit, and the breadth of the one curtain four by the cubit; one measure  to all the curtains.
YLT_Paraphrased: the length of the curtain is eight and twenty feet, the width of the curtain four feet.
DRA_Original: The length of one curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth four: all the curtains were of the same size.

YLT_Original: And he joineth the five curtains one unto another, and the  five curtains he hath joined one unto another;
YLT_Paraphrased: he joins the curtain with the other five, and the five he's joined to the other.
DRA_Original: And he joined five curtains, one to another, and the other five he coupled one to another.

YLT_Original: and he maketh loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain, at the end, in the joining; so he hath made in the edge of the outmost curtain, in the joining of the second;
YLT_Paraphrased: he made a blue edge on the edge of the curtain, at the end, in the joining; so he made a blue edge in the edge of the curtain;
DRA_Original: He made also loops of violet in the edge of the curtain on both sides, and in the edge of the other curtain in like manner,

YLT_Original: fifty loops he hath made in the one curtain, and fifty loops hath he made in the end of the curtain which  in the joining of the second; the loops are taking hold one on another.
YLT_Paraphrased: he made fifty loops in the curtain, and fifty in the end of the curtain that joined the second.
DRA_Original: That the loops might meet on against another, and might be joined each with the other.

YLT_Original: And he maketh fifty hooks of gold, and joineth the curtains one unto another by the hooks, and the tabernacle is one.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's got a gold hook, and he's going to join the curtain with another hook.
DRA_Original: Whereupon also he cast fifty rings of gold, that might catch the loops of the curtains, and they might be made one tabernacle.

YLT_Original: And he maketh curtains of goats'  for a tent over the tabernacle; eleven curtains he hath made them;
YLT_Paraphrased: he made eleven curtains for the tent, and he made them with goats' hair.
DRA_Original: He made also eleven curtains of goats' hair, to cover the roof of the tabernacle:

YLT_Original: the length of the one curtain  thirty by the cubit, and the breadth of the one curtain  four cubits; one measure  to the eleven curtains;
YLT_Paraphrased: the length of the curtain is thirty feet, the width of the curtain is four cubits; one measure is eleven.
DRA_Original: One curtain was thirty cubits long and four cubits broad: all the curtains were of one measure.

YLT_Original: and he joineth the five curtains apart, and the six curtains apart.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's going to join the five curtains and the six curtains.
DRA_Original: Five of which he joined apart, and the other six apart.

YLT_Original: And he maketh fifty loops on the outer edge of the curtain, in the joining; and fifty loops he hath made on the edge of the curtain which is joining the second;
YLT_Paraphrased: he makes fifty loops on the outer edge of the curtain, and fifty on the edge of the curtain that joins the second;
DRA_Original: And he made fifty loops in the edge of one curtain, and fifty in the edge of another curtain, that they might be joined one to another.

YLT_Original: and he maketh fifty hooks of brass to join the tent -- to be one;
YLT_Paraphrased: he's got a hundred hooks of brass in the tent -- to join him;
DRA_Original: And fifty buckles of brass wherewith the roof might be knit together, that of all the curtains there might be made one covering.

YLT_Original: and he maketh a covering for the tent of rams' skins made red, and a covering of badgers' skins above.
YLT_Paraphrased: he covers the tent with red and badger-red skin, and he covers the tent with a red and badger-red skin.
DRA_Original: He made also a cover for the tabernacle of rams' skins dyed red: and another cover over that of violet skins.

YLT_Original: And he maketh the boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up;
YLT_Paraphrased: he's going to the tabernacle of the shittish wood, and he's going to stand up;
DRA_Original: He made also the boards of the tabernacle of setim wood standing.

YLT_Original: ten cubits  the length of the  board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of the  board;
YLT_Paraphrased: the length of the board, the width of the board, and the width of the board;
DRA_Original: The length of one board was ten cubits: and the breadth was one cubit and a half.

YLT_Original: two handles  to the one board, joined one unto another; so he hath made for all the boards of the tabernacle.
YLT_Paraphrased: he made all the boards of the tabernacle, so he had all the boards of the tabernacle.
DRA_Original: There were two mortises throughout every board, that one might be joined to the other. And in this manner he made for all the boards of the tabernacle.

YLT_Original: And he maketh the boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward;
YLT_Paraphrased: he's building a tabernacle on the south side of the south; twenty boards on the south side;
DRA_Original: Of which twenty were at the south side southward,

YLT_Original: and forty sockets of silver he hath made under the twenty boards, two sockets under the one board for its two handles, and two sockets under the other board for its two handles.
YLT_Paraphrased: he made two sockets under the twenty-two boards, two sockets under the first board, and two sockets under the other board.
DRA_Original: With forty sockets of silver, two sockets were put under one board on the two sides of the corners, where the mortises of the sides end in the corners.

YLT_Original: And for the second side of the tabernacle, for the north side, he hath made twenty boards,
YLT_Paraphrased: twenty boards were made for the north side of the tabernacle.
DRA_Original: At that side also of the tabernacle, that looketh toward the north, he made twenty boards.

YLT_Original: and their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under the other board;
YLT_Paraphrased: two silver sockets under the table, two silver sockets under the table, two silver sockets under the table;
DRA_Original: With forty sockets of silver, two sockets for every board.

YLT_Original: and for the sides of the tabernacle, westward, hath he made six boards;
YLT_Paraphrased: six boards were made for the sides of the tabernacle; westward.
DRA_Original: But against the west, to wit, at that side of the tabernacle, which looketh to the sea, he made six boards,

YLT_Original: and two boards hath he made for the corners of the tabernacle, in the two sides;
YLT_Paraphrased: in the two sides, he made two boards, which were in the corners of the tabernacle;
DRA_Original: And two others at each corner of the tabernacle behind:

YLT_Original: and they have been twins below, and together they are twins at its head, at the one ring; so he hath done to both of them at the two corners;
YLT_Paraphrased: he did it to both of them at the two corners, and he did it with his twin at the head.
DRA_Original: Which were also joined from beneath unto the top, and went together into one joint. Thus he did on both sides at the corners:

YLT_Original: and there have been eight boards; and their sockets of silver  sixteen sockets, two sockets under the one board.
YLT_Paraphrased: there were eight boards, and the silver sockets were sixteen.
DRA_Original: So there were in all eight boards and they had sixteen sockets of silver, to wit, two sockets under every board.

YLT_Original: And he maketh bars of shittim wood, five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
YLT_Paraphrased: he's making a bar of shittish wood, five for the board of the altar.
DRA_Original: He made also bars of setim wood, five to hold together the boards of one side of the tabernacle,

YLT_Original: and five bars for the boards of the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle, for the sides westward;
YLT_Paraphrased: five bars for the second side of the tabernacle, five bars for the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the second side of the tabernacle;
DRA_Original: And five others to join together the boards of the other side: and besides these, five other bars at the west side of the tabernacle towards the sea.

YLT_Original: and he maketh the middle bar to enter into the midst of the boards from end to end;
YLT_Paraphrased: he's going to the middle bar, and he's going to the end of the board;
DRA_Original: He made also another bar, that might come by the midst of the boards from corner to corner.

YLT_Original: and the boards he hath overlaid with gold, and their rings he hath made of gold, places for bars, and he overlayeth the bars with gold.
YLT_Paraphrased: he has gold bars, gold rings, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars, gold bars,
DRA_Original: And the board works themselves he overlaid with gold, casting for them sockets of silver. And their rings he made of gold, through which the bars might be drawn: and he covered the bars themselves with plates of gold.

YLT_Original: And he maketh the vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of a designer he hath made it,  cherubs;
YLT_Paraphrased: he's a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a designer he made, a
DRA_Original: He made also a veil of violet, and purple, scarlet, and fine twisted linen, varied and distinguished with embroidery:

YLT_Original: and he maketh for it four pillars of shittim , and overlayeth them with gold; their pegs  of gold; and he casteth for them four sockets of silver.
YLT_Paraphrased: he makes four pillars of shitties, and he's got gold on them; and he's got four silver sockets.
DRA_Original: And four pillars of setim wood, which with their heads be overlaid with gold, casting for them sockets of silver.

YLT_Original: And he maketh a covering for the opening of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of an embroiderer,
YLT_Paraphrased: he's working on the opening of the tent, purple, purple, and scarlet, and woven with linen.
DRA_Original: He made also a hanging in the entry of the tabernacle of violet, purple, scarlet, and fine twisted linen, with the work of an embroiderer.

YLT_Original: also its five pillars, and their pegs; and he overlaid their tops and their fillets  gold, and their five sockets  brass.
YLT_Paraphrased: he had gold, brass, and brass, and gold, brass, and brass, and gold, brass, and gold, brass, and gold.
DRA_Original: And five pillars with their heads, which he covered with gold, and their sockets he cast of brass.

YLT_Original: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, come hath Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his force unto Jerusalem, and they lay siege against it;
YLT_Paraphrased: in the tenth month of the king of Judah, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his troops came to Jerusalem, and they were besieged.
DRA_Original: In the ninth year of Sedecias king of Juda, in the tenth month, came Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon, and all his army to Jerusalem, and they besieged it.

YLT_Original: in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, in the ninth of the month, hath the city been broken up;
YLT_Paraphrased: the city was broken up in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, in the ninth month.
DRA_Original: And in the eleventh year of Sedecias, in the fourth month, the fifth day of the month, the city was opened.

YLT_Original: and come in do all the heads of the king of Babylon, and they sit at the middle gate, Nergal-Sharezer, Samgar-Nebo, Sarsechim, chief of the eunuchs, Nergal-Sharezer, chief of the Mages, and all the rest of the heads of the king of Babylon.
YLT_Paraphrased: the king of Babylon, Nergal-Sharezer, Sarsechim, the chief of the eunuchs, Nergal, sat in the middle gate.
DRA_Original: And all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate: Neregel, Sereser, Semegarnabu, Sarsachim, Rabsares, Neregel, Serezer, Rebmag, and all the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.

YLT_Original: And it cometh to pass, when Zedekiah king of Judah, and all the men of war, have seen them, that they flee and go forth by night from the city, the way of the king's garden, through the gate between the two walls, and he goeth forth the way of the plain.
YLT_Paraphrased: when the king of Judah, and all the warriors, see them, they will be gone, and they will go out of the city, through the gate between the king's garden and the gate to the king's garden.
DRA_Original: And when Sedecias the king of Juda and all the men of war saw them, they fled: and they went forth in the night out of the city by the way of the king's garden, and by the gate that was between the two walls, and they went; out to the way of the desert.

YLT_Original: And the forces of the Chaldeans pursue after them, and overtake Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho, and they take him, and bring him up unto Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, to Riblah, in the land of Hamath, and he speaketh with him -- judgments.
YLT_Paraphrased: to the plains of Jericho, and to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, they will follow the Chaldeans, and they will overtake them, and they will be taken, and they will be taken to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
DRA_Original: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after them: and they took Sedecias in the plain of the desert of Jericho, and when they had taken him, they brought him to Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon to Reblatha, which is in the land of Emath: and he gave judgment upon him.

YLT_Original: And the king of Babylon slaughtereth the sons of Zedekiah, in Riblah, before his eyes, yea, all the freemen of Judah hath the king of Babylon slaughtered.
YLT_Paraphrased: the king of Babylon, before his eyes, killed the sons of Zedekiah, the sons of Zadekiah.
DRA_Original: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Sedecias, in Reblatha, before his eyes: and the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Juda.

YLT_Original: And the eyes of Zedekiah he hath blinded, and he bindeth him with brazen fetters, to bring him in to Babylon.
YLT_Paraphrased: Zedekiah blinded him with his eyes, and he bound him with a strong rope to Babylon.
DRA_Original: He also put out the eyes of Sedecias: and bound him with fetters, to be carried to Babylon.

YLT_Original: And the house of the king, and the house of the people, have the Chaldeans burnt with fire, and the walls of Jerusalem they have broken down.
YLT_Paraphrased: the king's house and the people's house were burned, and the walls of Jerusalem were broken.
DRA_Original: And the Chaldeans burnt the king's house, and the houses of the people with fire, and they threw down the wall of Jerusalem.

YLT_Original: And the remnant of the people who are left in the city, and those falling who have fallen to him, and the remnant of the people who are left, hath Nebuzar-Adan, chief of the executioners, removed  Babylon.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Babylonians Nebuzar-Adan, chief of the executioners, removed Babylon from the city.
DRA_Original: And Nabuzardan the general of the army carried away captive to Babylon the remnant of the people that remained in the city, and the fugitives that had gone over to him, and the rest of the people that remained.

YLT_Original: And of the poor people, who have nothing, hath Nebuzar-Adan, chief of the executioners, left in the land of Judah, and he giveth to them vineyards and fields on the same day.
YLT_Paraphrased: Nebuzar-Adan, the chief of the executioners, left the country of Judah and gave them vineyards and fields on the same day.
DRA_Original: But Nabuzardan the general left some of the poor people that had nothing at all, in the land of Juda, and he gave them vineyards, and cisterns at that time.

YLT_Original: And Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon giveth a charge concerning Jeremiah, by the hand of Nebuzar-Adan, chief of the executioners, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, who is the chief of the executioners, said to Jeremiah, Nebuzar-Adan, the chief of the executioners, saying:
DRA_Original: Now Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon had given charge to Nabuzardan the general concerning Jeremias, saying:

YLT_Original: `Take him, and place thine eyes upon him, and do no evil thing to him, but as he speaketh unto thee, so do with him.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "take him, and look at him, and don't do anything bad to him, but as he says to you, so do it."
DRA_Original: Take him, and set thy eyes upon him, and do him no harm: but as he hath a mind, so do with him.

YLT_Original: And Nebuzar-Adan, chief of the executioners sendeth, and Nebushazban, chief of the eunuchs, and Nergal-Sharezer, chief of the Mages, and all the chiefs of the king of Babylon;
YLT_Paraphrased: Nebuzar-Adan, the chief of the executioners, Nebushazban, the chief of the eunuchs, Nergal-Sharezer, the chief of the magicians, and all the king's men.
DRA_Original: Therefore Nabuzardan the general sent, and Nabusezban, and Rabsares, and Neregel, and Sereser, and Rebmag, and all the nobles of the king of Babylon,

YLT_Original: yea, they send and take Jeremiah out of the court of the prison, and give him unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, to carry him home, and he dwelleth in the midst of the people.
YLT_Paraphrased: he was taken out of the prison by Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, and he took him to Gedaliah's house.
DRA_Original: Sent, and took Jeremias out of the court of the prison, and committed him to Codolias the son of Ahicam the son of Saphan, that he might go home, and dwell among the people.

YLT_Original: And unto Jeremiah hath a word of Jehovah been -- in his being detained in the court of the prison -- saying:
YLT_Paraphrased: there was a word of God in the court of the prison -- that he was detained in jail -- saying:
DRA_Original: But the word of the Lord came to Jeremias, when he was yet shut up in the court of the prison, saying: Go, and tell Abdemelech the Ethiopian, saying:

YLT_Original: `Go, and thou hast spoken to Ebed-Melech the Cushite, saying: Thus said Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel: Lo, I am bringing in My words unto this city for evil, and not for good, and they have been before thee in that day.
YLT_Paraphrased: so said the Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel: Lo, I'm bringing my words to the city of evil, not good.
DRA_Original: Thus saith the Lord of hosts the God of Israel: Behold I will bring my words upon this city unto evil, and not unto good: and they shall be accomplished in thy sight in that day.

YLT_Original: And I have delivered thee in that day -- an affirmation of Jehovah -- and thou art not given into the hand of the men of whose face thou art afraid,
YLT_Paraphrased: I gave you an affirmation of Jehovah -- and you don't have to worry about the men who look like you.
DRA_Original: And I will deliver thee in that day, saith the Lord: and thou shalt not be given into the hands of the men whom thou fearest:

YLT_Original: for I do certainly deliver thee, and by sword thou fallest not, and thy life hath been to thee for a spoil, for thou hast trusted in Me -- an affirmation of Jehovah.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm sure you'll be delivered, and you'll be dead, and you'll be dead, and you'll be dead, and you'll be dead, and you'll be dead.
DRA_Original: But delivering, I will deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword: but thy life shall be saved for thee, because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith the Lord.

YLT_Original: As a lily among the thorns,
YLT_Paraphrased: a lily among the thorns, a lily among the thorns.
DRA_Original: I am the flower of the field, and the lily of the valleys.

YLT_Original: So  my friend among the daughters!
YLT_Paraphrased: my friend's daughter is my friend's daughter!
DRA_Original: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

YLT_Original: As a citron among trees of the forest, So  my beloved among the sons, In his shade I delighted, and sat down, And his fruit  sweet to my palate.
YLT_Paraphrased: I sat down, and his fruit was sweet to my mouth, and I sat down.
DRA_Original: As the apple tree among the trees of the woods, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow, whom I desired: and his fruit was sweet to my palate.

YLT_Original: He hath brought me in unto a house of wine, And his banner over me  love,
YLT_Paraphrased: he brought me to a wine house, and his flagrant love,
DRA_Original: He brought me into the cellar of wine, he set in order charity in me.

YLT_Original: Sustain me with grape-cakes, Support me with citrons, for I  sick with love.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm sick of love, I'm sick of love, I'm sick of love.
DRA_Original: Stay me up with flowers, compass me about with apples: because I languish with love.

YLT_Original: His left hand  under my head, And his right doth embrace me.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's hugging me with his left hand and his right hand.
DRA_Original: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand shall embrace me.

YLT_Original: I have adjured you, daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes or by the hinds of the field, Stir not up nor wake the love till she please!
YLT_Paraphrased: by the roes or the field, don't stir up or wake up the love until she's happy!
DRA_Original: I adjure you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and the harts of the, fields, that you stir not up, nor make the beloved to awake, till she please.

YLT_Original: The voice of my beloved! lo, this -- he is coming, Leaping on the mountains, skipping on the hills.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's coming, he's jumping, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's running, he's
DRA_Original: The voice of my beloved, behold he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping over the hills.

YLT_Original: My beloved  like to a roe, Or to a young one of the harts. Lo, this -- he is standing behind our wall, Looking from the windows, Blooming from the lattice.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's standing behind the wall, looking out the windows, and he's looking like a roe, or a young man from the harts.
DRA_Original: My beloved is like a roe, or a young hart. Behold he standeth behind our wall, looking through the windows, looking through the lattices.

YLT_Original: My beloved hath answered and said to me, `Rise up, my friend, my fair one, and come away,
YLT_Paraphrased: "come, my friend, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear
DRA_Original: Behold my beloved speaketh to me: Arise, make haste, my love, my dove, my beautiful one, and come.

YLT_Original: For lo, the winter hath passed by, The rain hath passed away -- it hath gone.
YLT_Paraphrased: the winter is over, the rain has stopped, the rain has gone.
DRA_Original: For winter is now past, the rain is over and gone.

YLT_Original: The flowers have appeared in the earth, The time of the singing hath come, And the voice of the turtle was heard in our land,
YLT_Paraphrased: the flowers have appeared on the ground, the time of the singing has come, and the turtle's voice was heard in the country.
DRA_Original: The flowers have appeared in our land, the time of pruning is come: the voice of the turtle is heard in our land:

YLT_Original: The fig-tree hath ripened her green figs, And the sweet-smelling vines have given forth fragrance, Rise, come, my friend, my fair one, yea, come away.
YLT_Paraphrased: the fig-tree has grown green figs, and the fragrance of the green figs has risen, my friend, my dear.
DRA_Original: The fig tree hath put forth her green figs: the vines in flower yield their sweet smell. Arise, my love, my beautiful one, and come:

YLT_Original: My dove, in clefts of the rock, In a secret place of the ascent, Cause me to see thine appearance, Cause me to hear thy voice, For thy voice  sweet, and thy appearance comely.
YLT_Paraphrased: for your appearance, your appearance, and your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance, for your appearance
DRA_Original: My dove in the clefts of the rock, in the hollow places of the wall, shew me thy face, let thy voice sound in my ears: for thy voice is sweet, and thy face comely.

YLT_Original: Seize ye for us foxes, Little foxes -- destroyers of vineyards, Even our sweet-smelling vineyards.
YLT_Paraphrased: we're gonna destroy the vineyards, destroy the vineyards, destroy the vineyards.
DRA_Original: Catch us the little foxes that destroy the vines: for our vineyard hath flourished.

YLT_Original: My beloved  mine, and I  his, Who is delighting among the lilies,
YLT_Paraphrased: I love mine, and I love him, who's happy with the lilies.
DRA_Original: My beloved to me, and I to him who feedeth among the lilies,

YLT_Original: Till the day doth break forth, And the shadows have fled away, Turn, be like, my beloved, To a roe, or to a young one of the harts, On the mountains of separation!
YLT_Paraphrased: until the day of the break, and the shadows have fled, turn, like my beloved, to a young man, on the mountains of separation!
DRA_Original: Till the day break, and the shadows retire. Return: be like, my beloved, to a roe, or to a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.

YLT_Original: And Elihu answereth and saith:
YLT_Paraphrased: Elihu said: 'I'm not going to be able to do it, 'he said.
DRA_Original: And Eliu continued his discourse, and said:

YLT_Original: Hear, O wise men, my words, And, O knowing ones, give ear to me.
YLT_Paraphrased: listen, my words, and listen to me.
DRA_Original: Hear ye, wise men, my words, and ye learned, hearken to me:

YLT_Original: For the ear doth try words, And the palate tasteth to eat.
YLT_Paraphrased: the ear is trying to hear, the tongue is trying to eat.
DRA_Original: For the ear trieth words, and the mouth discerneth meats by the taste.

YLT_Original: Judgment let us choose for ourselves, Let us know among ourselves what  good.
YLT_Paraphrased: we choose ourselves, let's see what good we have.
DRA_Original: Let us choose to us judgment, and let us see among ourselves what is the best.

YLT_Original: For Job hath said, `I have been righteous, And God hath turned aside my right,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I've done it, and God has done it, and I'm sorry," said the job.
DRA_Original: For Job hath said: I am just, and God hath overthrown my judgment.

YLT_Original: Against my right do I lie? Mortal  mine arrow -- without transgression.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm lying on my right, mortal mine arrow -- without transgression.
DRA_Original: For in judging me there is a lie: my arrow is violent without any sin.

YLT_Original: Who  a man like Job? He drinketh scoffing like water,
YLT_Paraphrased: he drinks like water, he drinks like water, he drinks like water.
DRA_Original: What man is there like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

YLT_Original: And he hath travelled for company With workers of iniquity, So as to go with men of wickedness.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's traveled with a company of sinners, so he's going with the bad guys.
DRA_Original: Who goeth in company with them that work iniquity, and walketh with wicked men?

YLT_Original: For he hath said, `It doth not profit a man, When he delighteth himself with God.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "he doesn't make a man happy when he likes God."
DRA_Original: For he hath said: Man shall not please God, although he run with him.

YLT_Original: Therefore, O men of heart, hearken to me; Far be it from God to do wickedness, And  the Mighty to do perverseness:
YLT_Paraphrased: men of heart, Far be it from God to do evil, and the Mighty to do evil:
DRA_Original: Therefore, ye men of understanding, hear me: far from god be wickedness, and iniquity from the Almighty.

YLT_Original: For the work of man he repayeth to him, And according to the path of each He doth cause him to find.
YLT_Paraphrased: he pays him, and he's going to find him on the way.
DRA_Original: For he will render to a man his work, and according to the ways of every one he will reward them.

YLT_Original: Yea, truly, God doth not do wickedly, And the Mighty doth not pervert judgment.
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, really, God doesn't do bad, and the Mighty doesn't do anything bad.
DRA_Original: For in very deed God will not condemn without cause, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

YLT_Original: Who hath inspected for Himself the earth? And who hath placed all the habitable world?
YLT_Paraphrased: who's looking at the earth? And who's looking at the world?
DRA_Original: What other hath he appointed over the earth? or whom hath he set over the world which he made?

YLT_Original: If He doth set on him His heart, His spirit and his breath unto Him He gathereth.
YLT_Paraphrased: he sets his heart and soul on him, and he gathereth.
DRA_Original: If he turn his heart to him, he shall draw his spirit and breath unto himself.

YLT_Original: Expire doth all flesh together, And man to dust returneth.
YLT_Paraphrased: the flesh is all together, and the dust is all gone.
DRA_Original: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall return into ashes.

YLT_Original: And if [there is] understanding, hear this, Give ear to the voice of my words.
YLT_Paraphrased: if you understand, listen to my words.
DRA_Original: If then thou hast understanding, hear what is said, and hearken to the voice of my words.

YLT_Original: Yea, doth one hating justice govern? Or the Most Just dost thou condemn?
YLT_Paraphrased: do you hate justice or the Most Just?
DRA_Original: Can he be healed that loveth not judgment? and how dost thou so far condemn him that is just?

YLT_Original: Who hath said to a king -- `Worthless,' Unto princes -- `Wicked?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "worthless," Unto princes -- "Wicked?"
DRA_Original: Who saith to the king: Thou art an apostate: who calleth rulers ungodly?

YLT_Original: That hath not accepted the person of princes, Nor hath known the rich before the poor, For a work of His hands  all of them.
YLT_Paraphrased: he didn't take the prince, nor did he know the rich man before the poor.
DRA_Original: Who accepteth not the persons of princes: nor hath regarded the tyrant, when he contended against the poor man: for all are the work of his hands.

YLT_Original: a moment they die, and at midnight Shake do people, and they pass away, And they remove the mighty without hand.
YLT_Paraphrased: they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die, and they die
DRA_Original: They shall suddenly die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and they shall pass, and take away the violent without hand.

YLT_Original: For His eyes  on the ways of each, And all his steps He doth see.
YLT_Paraphrased: he sees all his steps, and all his steps he sees.
DRA_Original: For his eyes are upon the ways of men, and he considereth all their steps.

YLT_Original: There is no darkness nor death-shade, For workers of iniquity to be hidden there;
