YLT_Paraphrased: there is no darkness, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death, no death,
DRA_Original: There is no darkness, and there is no shadow of death, where they may be hid who work iniquity.

YLT_Original: For He doth not suffer man any more, To go unto God in judgment,
YLT_Paraphrased: he's not going to suffer any more, for God's sake, to go to God's judgment.
DRA_Original: For it is no longer in the power of man to enter into judgment with God.

YLT_Original: He breaketh the mighty -- no searching! And He appointeth others in their stead.
YLT_Paraphrased: he breaks the mighty - no searching! And he's appointing others.
DRA_Original: He shall break in pieces many and innumerable, and shall make others to stand in their stead.

YLT_Original: Therefore He knoweth their works, And He hath overturned by night, And they are bruised.
YLT_Paraphrased: he knows his work, and he's broken by night, and he's bruised.
DRA_Original: For he knoweth their works: and therefore he shall bring night on them, and they shall be destroyed.

YLT_Original: As wicked He hath stricken them, In the place of beholders.
YLT_Paraphrased: he struck them with a terrible He's struck them, and he's gone.
DRA_Original: He hath struck them, as being wicked, in open sight.

YLT_Original: Because that against right They have turned aside from after Him, And none of His ways have considered wisely,
YLT_Paraphrased: they turned away from him, and none of his ways were wise, and none of them were wise.
DRA_Original: Who as it were on purpose have revolted from him, and would not understand all his ways:

YLT_Original: To cause to come in unto Him The cry of the poor, And the cry of the afflicted He heareth.
YLT_Paraphrased: he hears the poor cry, the afflicted cry, and the poor cry.
DRA_Original: So that they caused the cry of the needy to come to him, and he heard the voice of the poor.

YLT_Original: And He giveth rest, and who maketh wrong? And hideth the face, and who beholdeth it? And in reference to a nation and to a man, [It is] the same.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's giving up, and he's
DRA_Original: For when he granteth peace, who is there that can condemn? When he hideth his countenance, who is there that can behold him, whether it regard nations, or all men?

YLT_Original: From the reigning of a profane man, From the snares of a people;
YLT_Paraphrased: from the snares of the people; from the people's snares.
DRA_Original: Who maketh a man that is a hypocrite to reign for the sins of the people?

YLT_Original: For unto God hath any said: `I have taken away, I do not corruptly,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I've taken it, I didn't do it, I didn't do it, I didn't do it."
DRA_Original: Seeing then I have spoken of God, I will not hinder thee in thy turn.

YLT_Original: Besides [that which] I see, shew Thou me, If iniquity I have done -- I do not add?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "if I've done something wrong, I don't want to add?"
DRA_Original: If I have erred, teach thou me: if I have spoken iniquity, I will add no more.

YLT_Original: By thee doth He recompense, That thou hast refused -- That thou dost choose, and not I? And what thou hast known, speak.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's paying you back, that you didn't choose, and he doesn't care about you?
DRA_Original: Doth God require it of thee, because it hath displeased thee? for thou begannest to speak, and not I: but if thou know any thing better, speak.

YLT_Original: Let men of heart say to me, And a wise man is hearkening to me.
YLT_Paraphrased: he says to me, and a wise man will listen to me.
DRA_Original: Let men of understanding speak to me, and let a wise man hearken to me.

YLT_Original: Job -- not with knowledge doth he speak, And his words  not with wisdom.
YLT_Paraphrased: he doesn't speak, but he doesn't know, and he doesn't know what he's talking about.
DRA_Original: But Job hath spoken foolishly, and his words sound not discipline.

YLT_Original: My Father! let Job be tried -- unto victory, Because of answers for men of iniquity,
YLT_Paraphrased: father, let's try to defeat the evil, for the sake of the good of men,
DRA_Original: My father, let Job be tried even to the end: cease not from the man of iniquity.

YLT_Original: For he doth add to his sin, Transgression among us he vomiteth, And multiplieth his sayings to God.
YLT_Paraphrased: he's adding to his sin, and he's multiplying his words to God.
DRA_Original: Because he addeth blasphemy upon his sins, let him be tied fast in the mean time amongst us: and then let him provoke God to judgment with his speeches.

YLT_Original: And concerning the things sacrificed to idols, we have known that we all have knowledge: knowledge puffeth up, but love buildeth up;
YLT_Paraphrased: we know that we all know what we sacrificed to idols: Knowledge is not enough, but love is growing;
DRA_Original: Now concerning those things that are sacrificed to idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up; but charity edifieth.

YLT_Original: and if any one doth think to know anything, he hath not yet known anything according as it behoveth  to know;
YLT_Paraphrased: if anyone thinks he knows anything, he doesn't know anything, so he doesn't know anything;
DRA_Original: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he hath not yet known as he ought to know.

YLT_Original: and if any one doth love God, this one hath been known by Him.
YLT_Paraphrased: if anyone loves God, he knows who he is.
DRA_Original: But if any man love God, the same is known by him.

YLT_Original: Concerning the eating then of the things sacrificed to idols, we have known that an idol  nothing in the world, and that there is no other God except one;
YLT_Paraphrased: we know that the idols are nothing more than a piece of meat, and that there's no other God except one;
DRA_Original: But as for the meats that are sacrificed to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no God but one.

YLT_Original: for even if there are those called gods, whether in heaven, whether upon earth -- as there are gods many and lords many --
YLT_Paraphrased: even if there's a god, whether on Earth or in the sky - as there are gods -
DRA_Original: For although there be that are called gods, either in heaven or on earth (for there be gods many, and lords many);

YLT_Original: yet to us  one God, the Father, of whom  the all things, and we to Him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom  the all things, and we through Him;
YLT_Paraphrased: for us, one God, the Father, the one who's everything, and we're all to him.
DRA_Original: Yet to us there is but one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we unto him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.

YLT_Original: but not in all men  the knowledge, and certain with conscience of the idol, till now, as a thing sacrificed to an idol do eat , and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.
YLT_Paraphrased: the knowledge, and some with conscience, is not to be eaten, and their conscience is weak, and they are defiled.
DRA_Original: But there is not knowledge in every one. For some until this present, with conscience of the idol: eat as a thing sacrificed to an idol, and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.

YLT_Original: But victuals do not commend us to God, for neither if we may eat are we in advance; nor if we may not eat, are we behind;
YLT_Paraphrased: if we don't eat, we don't get God's approval, not even if we can eat; nor if we can eat, we're not there;
DRA_Original: But meat doth not commend us to God. For neither, if we eat, shall we have the more; nor, if we eat not, shall we have the less.

YLT_Original: but see, lest this privilege of yours may become a stumbling-block to the infirm,
YLT_Paraphrased: if you don't want to be a stumbling block to the sick, see, if you don't want to be a stumbling block to the sick.
DRA_Original: But take heed lest perhaps this your liberty become a stumblingblock to the weak.

YLT_Original: for if any one may see thee that hast knowledge in an idol's temple reclining at meat -- shall not his conscience -- he being infirm -- be emboldened to eat the things sacrificed to idols,
YLT_Paraphrased: if any of you can see the idol in the temple of the idol, he will not be able to eat the things sacrificed to idols, he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak -- he will be weak --
DRA_Original: For if a man see him that hath knowledge sit at meat in the idol's temple, shall not his conscience, being weak, be emboldened to eat those things which are sacrificed to idols?

YLT_Original: and the brother who is infirm shall perish by thy knowledge, because of whom Christ died?
YLT_Paraphrased: because of whom Christ died, your knowledge will destroy him, for whom he died?
DRA_Original: And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ hath died?

YLT_Original: and thus sinning in regard to the brethren, and smiting their weak conscience -- in regard to Christ ye sin;
YLT_Paraphrased: you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin, you sin
DRA_Original: Now when you sin thus against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.

YLT_Original: wherefore, if victuals cause my brother to stumble, I may eat no flesh -- to the age -- that my brother I may not cause to stumble.
YLT_Paraphrased: if my brother is going to fall, I can't eat meat - to the age - that my brother I can't cause him to fall.
DRA_Original: Wherefore, if meat scandalize my brother, I will never eat flesh, lest I should scandalize my brother.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm telling you, Moses, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you,
DRA_Original: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

YLT_Original: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, When a man maketh a wonderful vow, by thy valuation the persons  Jehovah's.
YLT_Paraphrased: when a man makes a great promise, he says, "If he does, he's going to be a great man."
DRA_Original: Speak to the children of Israel, and thou shalt say to them: The man that shall have made a vow, and promised his soul to God, shall give the price according to estimation.

YLT_Original: When thy valuation hath been of the male from a son of twenty years even unto a son of sixty years, then hath been thy valuation fifty shekels of silver by the shekel of the sanctuary.
YLT_Paraphrased: then the price of the silver was 50 shekels of silver, and the price of the silver was 50 shekels of silver.
DRA_Original: If it be a man from twenty years old unto sixty years old, he shall give fifty sides of silver, after the weight of the sanctuary:

YLT_Original: And if it  a female -- then hath thy valuation been thirty shekels;
YLT_Paraphrased: if a woman -- then you have a price of thirty shekels.
DRA_Original: If a woman, thirty.

YLT_Original: and if from a son of five years even unto a son of twenty years -- then hath thy valuation been of the male twenty shekels, and for the female, ten shekels;
YLT_Paraphrased: so the male is worth twenty shekels, and the woman is worth ten shekels; and the male is worth twenty shekels.
DRA_Original: But from the fifth year until the twentieth, a man shall give twenty sicles: a woman ten.

YLT_Original: and if from a son of a month even unto a son of five years -- then hath thy valuation been of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy valuation  three shekels of silver;
YLT_Paraphrased: your valuation is a male silver, and for the woman's silver is three shekels of silver;
DRA_Original: From one month until the fifth year. for a male shall be given five sides: for a female three.

YLT_Original: and if from a son of sixty years and above -- if a male, then hath thy valuation been fifteen shekels, and for a female, ten shekels.
YLT_Paraphrased: if a man, then he's worth fifteen shekels, and for a woman, ten shekels.
DRA_Original: A man that is sixty years old or upward, shall give fifteen aisles: a woman ten.

YLT_Original: `And if he is poorer than thy valuation, then he hath presented himself before the priest, and the priest hath valued him; according to that which the hand of him who is vowing doth reach doth the priest value him.
YLT_Paraphrased: if he's poorer than your valuation, then he's before the priest, and the priest will take him to the priest's hand.
DRA_Original: If he be poor, and not able to pay tile estimation, he shall stand before tile priest: and as much as he shall value him at, and see him able to pay, so much shall he give.

YLT_Original: `And if [it is] a beast of which they bring near an offering to Jehovah, all that  giveth of it to Jehovah is holy;
YLT_Paraphrased: if it's a beast that's near to the offering of God, it's holy;
DRA_Original: But a beast that may be sacrificed to the Lord, if any one shall vow, shall be holy,

YLT_Original: he doth not change it nor exchange it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good; and if he really change beast for beast, -- then it hath been -- it and its exchange is holy.
YLT_Paraphrased: it's not going to change anything, not even exchange, and if he really changes the beast, it's holy.
DRA_Original: And cannot be changed, that is to say, neither a better for a worse, nor a worse for a better. And if he shall change it: both that which was changed, and that for which it was changed, shall be consecrated to the Lord.

YLT_Original: `And if [it is] any unclean beast of which they do not bring near an offering to Jehovah, then he hath presented the beast before the priest,
YLT_Paraphrased: if the unclean animal is not brought to the altar, then he shall present the beast before the priest, and he shall be offered to the Lord.
DRA_Original: An unclean beast, which cannot be sacrificed to the Lord, if my man shall vow, shall be brought before the priest:

YLT_Original: and the priest hath valued it; whether good or bad, according to thy valuation, O priest, so it is;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest is valued by the priest, according to your valuation, O priest.
DRA_Original: Who judging whether it be good or bad, shall set the price:

YLT_Original: and if he really redeem it, then he hath added its fifth to thy valuation.
YLT_Paraphrased: if he really does, then he'll add the fifth to your price.
DRA_Original: Which if he that offereth it will give, he shall add above the estimation the fifth part.

YLT_Original: `And when a man sanctifieth his house, a holy thing to Jehovah, then hath the priest valued it, whether good or bad; as the priest doth value it so it standeth;
YLT_Paraphrased: if a man is sanctified by his house, he is a holy thing to God, as the priest would have it; and he will be valued by the priest as much as the priest would have valued him.
DRA_Original: If a man shall vow his house, and sanctify it to the Lord, the priest shall consider it, whether it be good or bad, and it shall be sold according to the price, which he shall appoint.

YLT_Original: and if he who is sanctifying doth redeem his house, then he hath added a fifth of the money of thy valuation to it, and it hath become his.
YLT_Paraphrased: he will add a fifth of the money to the price of the house, and he will be his.
DRA_Original: But if he that vowed, will redeem it, he shall give the fifth part of the estimation over and above, and shall have the house.

YLT_Original: `And if of the field of his possession a man sanctify to Jehovah, then hath thy valuation been according to its seed; a homer of barley-seed at fifty shekels of silver;
YLT_Paraphrased: if a man is a man, he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and he will be a man, and
DRA_Original: And if he vow the field of his possession, and consecrate it to the Lord, the price shall be rated according to the measure of the seed. If the ground be sowed with thirty bushels of barley, let it be sold for fifty sides of silver.

YLT_Original: if from the year of the jubilee he sanctify his field, according to thy valuation it standeth;
YLT_Paraphrased: according to your valuation, he will sanctify the field of the year of the Jubilee;
DRA_Original: If he vow his field immediately from the year of jubilee that is beginning, as much as it may be worth, at so much it shall be rated.

YLT_Original: and if after the jubilee he sanctify his field, then hath the priest reckoned to him the money according to the years which are left, unto the year of the jubilee, and it hath been abated from thy valuation.
YLT_Paraphrased: if he sanctifies his field, then he shall be counted by the years of his life, and the money shall be taken from the valuation of the year of the Jubilee.
DRA_Original: But if some time after, the priest shall reckon the money according to the number of years that remain until the jubilee, and the price shall be abated.

YLT_Original: `And if he really redeem the field -- he who is sanctifying it -- then he hath added a fifth of the money of thy valuation to it, and it hath been established to him;
YLT_Paraphrased: if he really redeem the field -- he who is sanctifying him -- then he'll add a fifth of the money you've paid him.
DRA_Original: And if he that had vowed, will redeem his field, he shall add the fifth part of the money of the estimation, and shall possess it.

YLT_Original: and if he do not redeem the field, or if he hath sold the field to another man, it is not redeemed any more;
YLT_Paraphrased: if he doesn't sell the field, or if he sells it to someone else, it's not redeemed;
DRA_Original: And if he will not redeem it, but it be sold to any other man, he that vowed it, may not redeem it any more:

YLT_Original: and the field hath been, in its going out in the jubilee, holy to Jehovah as a field which is devoted; to the priest is its possession.
YLT_Paraphrased: the field is holy to the Lord as a field dedicated to the priest.
DRA_Original: For when the day of jubilee cometh, it shall be sanctified to the Lord, and as a possession consecrated, pertaineth to the right of the priests.

YLT_Original: `And if the field of his purchase (which  not of the fields of his possession)  sanctify to Jehovah --
YLT_Paraphrased: if the purchase of the field of the purchase (which is not the field of the owner) is not a part of the field of the owner's possession.
DRA_Original: If a field that was bought, and not of a man's ancestors' possession, be sanctified to the Lord,

YLT_Original: then hath the priest reckoned to him the amount of thy valuation unto the year of jubilee, and he hath given thy valuation in that day -- a holy thing to Jehovah;
YLT_Paraphrased: the priest has counted the amount of your valuation for the year of Jubilee, and he gave you the price of the year of Jubilee.
DRA_Original: The priest shall reckon the price according to the number of years: unto the jubilee: and he that had vowed, shall give that to the Lord.

YLT_Original: in the year of the jubilee the field returneth to him from whom he bought it, to him whose  the possession of the land.
YLT_Paraphrased: the field is returned to him from whom he bought it, to the one who has the right to the land.
DRA_Original: But in the jubilee, it shall return to the former owner, who had sold it, and had it in the lot of his possession.

YLT_Original: And all thy valuation is by the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs is the shekel.
YLT_Paraphrased: the price of the shrine is twenty shekels of the shekel.
DRA_Original: All estimation shall be made according to the side of the sanctuary. A sicle hath twenty obols.

YLT_Original: `Only, a firstling which is Jehovah's firstling among beasts -- no man doth sanctify it, whether ox or sheep; it  Jehovah's.
YLT_Paraphrased: only, the firstborn of the beasts, whether ox or sheep, is the first of the beasts, not a man.
DRA_Original: The firstborn, which belong to the Lord, no man may sanctify and vow: whether it be bullock, or sheep, they are the Lord's.

YLT_Original: And if among the unclean beasts, then he hath ransomed  at thy valuation, and he hath added its fifth to it; and if it is not redeemed, then it hath been sold at thy valuation.
YLT_Paraphrased: if he is among unclean beasts, then he will be sold at your price, and he will add the fifth to him; and if he doesn't, then he will be sold at your price.
DRA_Original: And if it be an unclean beast, he that offereth it shall redeem it, according to thy estimation, and shall add the fifth part of the price. If he will not redeem it, it shall be sold to another for how much soever it was estimated by thee.

YLT_Original: `Only, no devoted thing which a man devoteth to Jehovah, of all that he hath, of man, and beast, and of the field of his possession, is sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy to Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: only, no devoted thing that a man would have sold or sold, of all that he has, of man and beast, and of the field of his own possession, is holy to God.
DRA_Original: Any thing that is devoted to the Lord, whether it be man, or beast, or field, shall not be sold, neither may it be redeemed. Whatsoever is once consecrated shall be holy of holies to the Lord.

YLT_Original: `No devoted thing, which is devoted of man, is ransomed, it is surely put to death.
YLT_Paraphrased: it's not a thing, which is devoted to man, it's definitely killed.
DRA_Original: And any consecration that is offered by man, shall not be redeemed, but dying shall die.

YLT_Original: And all tithe of the land, of the seed of the land, of the fruit of the tree, is Jehovah's -- holy to Jehovah.
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy to God's holy
DRA_Original: All tithes of the land, whether of corn, or of the fruits of trees, are the Lord's, and are sanctified to him.

YLT_Original: `And if a man really redeem  of his tithe, its fifth he addeth to it.
YLT_Paraphrased: if a man really pays his tithe, he'll add the fifth.
DRA_Original: And if any man will redeem his tithes, he shall add the fifth part of them.

YLT_Original: `And all the tithe of the herd and of the flock -- all that passeth by under the rod -- the tenth is holy to Jehovah;
YLT_Paraphrased: the tenth is the holy of the herd and the flock -- everything that passes under the rod -- the tenth is holy to God.
DRA_Original: Of all the tithes of oxen, and sheep, and goats, that pass under the shepherd's rod, every tenth that cometh shall be sanctified to the Lord.

YLT_Original: he enquireth not between good and bad, nor doth he change it; and if he really change it -- then it hath been -- it and its exchange is holy; it is not redeemed.'
YLT_Paraphrased: he does not change, but he does not change, and if he really changes it -- then it's -- it's holy.
DRA_Original: It shall not be chosen neither good nor bad, neither shall it be changed for another. If any man change it: both that which was changed, and that for which it was changed, shall be sanctified to the Lord, and shall not be redeemed.

YLT_Original: These  the commands which Jehovah hath commanded Moses for the sons of Israel, in mount Sinai.
YLT_Paraphrased: the commands of God's commandments on Mount Sinai, in the Sinai Mountains.
DRA_Original: These are the precepts which the Lord commanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai.

YLT_Original: And on the first of the sabbaths, Mary the Magdalene doth come early (there being yet darkness) to the tomb, and she seeth the stone having been taken away out of the tomb,
YLT_Paraphrased: Mary Magdalene, the Magdalene of the Magdalene, comes to the tomb at the first of the Sabbath, and she sees the stone taken out of the tomb.
DRA_Original: And on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalen cometh early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre; and she saw the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

YLT_Original: she runneth, therefore, and cometh unto Simon Peter, and unto the other disciple whom Jesus was loving, and saith to them, `They took away the Lord out of the tomb, and we have not known where they laid him.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "they took the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they buried him," he said to Simon Peter and the other disciple who loved him.
DRA_Original: She ran, therefore, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and saith to them: They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.

YLT_Original: Peter, therefore, went forth, and the other disciple, and they were coming to the tomb,
YLT_Paraphrased: then the other disciple came, and they came to the tomb.
DRA_Original: Peter therefore went out, and that other disciple, and they came to the sepulchre.

YLT_Original: and the two were running together, and the other disciple did run forward more quickly than Peter, and came first to the tomb,
YLT_Paraphrased: the two of them ran together, and the other disciple was faster than Peter, and he was the first to go to the tomb.
DRA_Original: And they both ran together, and that other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

YLT_Original: and having stooped down, seeth the linen clothes lying, yet, indeed, he entered not.
YLT_Paraphrased: he dropped the linen clothes, but he did not really want to. He was still in the air, but he did not want to.
DRA_Original: And when he stooped down, he saw the linen cloths lying; but yet he went not in.

YLT_Original: Simon Peter, therefore, cometh, following him, and he entered into the tomb, and beholdeth the linen clothes lying,
YLT_Paraphrased: then Peter entered the tomb and saw the linen clothes lying there, and he was taken aback.
DRA_Original: Then cometh Simon Peter, following him, and went into the sepulchre, and saw the linen cloths lying,

YLT_Original: and the napkin that was upon his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but apart, having been folded up, in one place;
YLT_Paraphrased: the napkin on his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but in the back, folded up, and lay on the ground;
DRA_Original: And the napkin that had been about his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but apart, wrapped up into one place.

YLT_Original: then, therefore, entered also the other disciple who came first unto the tomb, and he saw, and did believe;
YLT_Paraphrased: then he entered the other disciple who came to the tomb, and he saw, and he believed.
DRA_Original: Then that other disciple also went in, who came first to the sepulchre: and he saw, and believed.

YLT_Original: for not yet did they know the Writing, that it behoveth him out of the dead to rise again.
YLT_Paraphrased: he didn't know the writing, that he would be able to rise from the dead.
DRA_Original: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

YLT_Original: The disciples therefore went away again unto their own friends,
YLT_Paraphrased: the disciples then returned to their friends, and the disciples returned to their friends.
DRA_Original: The disciples therefore departed again to their home.

YLT_Original: and Mary was standing near the tomb, weeping without; as she was weeping, then, she stooped down to the tomb, and beholdeth two messengers in white, sitting,
YLT_Paraphrased: she stood near the tomb, and she was crying, then she stooped and looked at the tomb, and she saw two men in white robes.
DRA_Original: But Mary stood at the sepulchre without, weeping. Now as she was weeping, she stooped down, and looked into the sepulchre,

YLT_Original: one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had been laid.
YLT_Paraphrased: the head, the feet, the body of Jesus, lay on the ground.
DRA_Original: And she saw two angels in white, sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had been laid.

YLT_Original: And they say to her, `Woman, why dost thou weep?' she saith to them, `Because they took away my Lord, and I have not known where they laid him;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "woman, why do you cry?" She asked, "because they took my Lord and I don't know where they're taking him?"
DRA_Original: They say to her: Woman, why weepest thou? She saith to them: Because they have taken away my Lord; and I know not where they have laid him.

YLT_Original: and these things having said, she turned backward, and seeth Jesus standing, and she had not known that it is Jesus.
YLT_Paraphrased: she turned, and she saw Jesus standing, and she didn't know it was Jesus.
DRA_Original: When she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing; and she knew not that it was Jesus.

YLT_Original: Jesus saith to her, `Woman, why dost thou weep? whom dost thou seek;' she, supposing that he is the gardener, saith to him, `Sir, if thou didst carry him away, tell me where thou didst lay him, and I will take him away;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "woman, why do you cry?" He asked, if she was a gardener.
DRA_Original: Jesus saith to her: Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, thinking it was the gardener, saith to him: Sir, if thou hast taken him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

YLT_Original: Jesus saith to her, `Mary!' having turned, she saith to him, `Rabbouni;' that is to say, `Teacher.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "Mary!" Said the Rabbi, turning to her, "Rabbouni!" That's what it means, "Teacher."
DRA_Original: Jesus saith to her: Mary. She turning, saith to him: Rabboni (which is to say, Master).

YLT_Original: Jesus saith to her, `Be not touching me, for I have not yet ascended unto my Father; and be going on to my brethren, and say to them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father, and to my God, and to your God.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "don't touch me, for I don't have to go to my father, and I'm going to my brothers, and I'll tell them, I'm going to my father.
DRA_Original: Jesus saith to her: Do not touch me, for I am not yet ascended to my Father. But go to my brethren, and say to them: I ascend to my Father and to your Father, to my God and your God.

YLT_Original: Mary the Magdalene cometh, telling to the disciples that she hath seen the Lord, and  these things he said to her.
YLT_Paraphrased: the Magdalene came to the disciples and told them that she had seen the Lord and what he had told her.
DRA_Original: Mary Magdalen cometh, and telleth the disciples: I have seen the Lord, and these things he said to me.

YLT_Original: It being, therefore, evening, on that day, the first of the sabbaths, and the doors having been shut where the disciples were assembled, through fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and saith to them, `Peace to you;'
YLT_Paraphrased: then Jesus came and stood in the middle of the night, and the door was shut, and the Jews were afraid of him.
DRA_Original: Now when it was late that same day, the first of the week, and the doors were shut, where the disciples were gathered together, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them: Peace be to you.

YLT_Original: and this having said, he shewed them his hands and side; the disciples, therefore, rejoiced, having seen the Lord.
YLT_Paraphrased: he showed them his hands and side, and the disciples were delighted to see him.
DRA_Original: And when he had said this, he shewed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad, when they saw the Lord.

YLT_Original: Jesus, therefore, said to them again, `Peace to you; according as the Father hath sent me, I also send you;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "Peace be with you, as the Father sent me," he said again, "I've also sent you."
DRA_Original: He said therefore to them again: Peace be to you. As the Father hath sent me, I also send you.

YLT_Original: and this having said, he breathed on , and saith to them, `Receive the Holy Spirit;
YLT_Paraphrased: "take the Holy Spirit; "Receive the Holy Spirit."
DRA_Original: When he had said this, he breathed on them; and he said to them: Receive ye the Holy Ghost.

YLT_Original: if of any ye may loose the sins, they are loosed to them; if of any ye may retain, they have been retained.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "if you want to lose your sins, they'll be released to you; if you keep them, they'll be retained."
DRA_Original: Whose sins you shall forgive, they are forgiven them; and whose sins you shall retain, they are retained.

YLT_Original: And Thomas, one of the twelve, who is called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came;
YLT_Paraphrased: when Jesus came, Thomas, one of the twelve, was not there;
DRA_Original: Now Thomas, one of the twelve, who is called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

YLT_Original: the other disciples, therefore, said to him, `We have seen the Lord;' and he said to them, `If I may not see in his hands the mark of the nails, and may put my finger to the mark of the nails, and may put my hand to his side, I will not believe.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "if I don't see the nails on his hands, I can't see the mark of the nails," he said.
DRA_Original: The other disciples therefore said to him: We have seen the Lord. But he said to them: Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the place of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.

YLT_Original: And after eight days, again were his disciples within, and Thomas with them; Jesus cometh, the doors having been shut, and he stood in the midst, and said, `Peace to you!'
YLT_Paraphrased: and then he came again, and Thomas and Jesus stood in the middle, and he said, "Peace!" And then he was gone.
DRA_Original: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus cometh, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said: Peace be to you.

YLT_Original: then he saith to Thomas, `Bring thy finger hither, and see my hands, and bring thy hand, and put  to my side, and become not unbelieving, but believing.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "come on, Thomas, let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let's see your hands, and let
DRA_Original: Then he saith to Thomas: Put in thy finger hither, and see my hands; and bring hither thy hand, and put it into my side; and be not faithless, but believing.

YLT_Original: And Thomas answered and said to him, `My Lord and my God;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "my God and my God," Thomas said, "and my God and my God."
DRA_Original: Thomas answered, and said to him: My Lord, and my God.

YLT_Original: Jesus saith to him, `Because thou hast seen me, Thomas, thou hast believed; happy those not having seen, and having believed.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "because you saw me, Thomas, you've seen me, and you've believed it," he said.
DRA_Original: Jesus saith to him: Because thou hast seen me, Thomas, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and have believed.

YLT_Original: Many indeed, therefore, other signs also did Jesus before his disciples, that are not written in this book;
YLT_Paraphrased: in fact, the book itself, which is not written in this book, is also a sign of Jesus before his disciples;
DRA_Original: Many other signs also did Jesus in the sight of his disciples, which are not written in this book.

YLT_Original: and these have been written that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing ye may have life in his name.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you can believe that Jesus is God's son and that you can have his life in his name."
DRA_Original: But these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God: and that believing, you may have life in his name.

YLT_Original: And Jesus was walking after these things in Galilee, for he did not wish to walk in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill him,
YLT_Paraphrased: for he wanted to go to Judea, but the Jews wanted to kill him, so he walked away from them.
DRA_Original: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee; for he would not walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

YLT_Original: and the feast of the Jews was nigh -- that of tabernacles --
YLT_Paraphrased: the Jews were celebrating the feast of the Jews - that's the feast of the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are celebrating the Jews - the Jews are
DRA_Original: Now the Jews' feast of tabernacles was at hand.

YLT_Original: his brethren, therefore, said unto him, `Remove hence, and go away to Judea, that thy disciples also may behold thy works that thou dost;
YLT_Paraphrased: "so, my brothers, you better go, and your disciples will see what you're doing, so that they can see what you're doing to them;
DRA_Original: And his brethren said to him: Pass from hence, and go into Judea; that thy disciples also may see thy works which thou dost.

YLT_Original: for no one in secret doth anything, and himself seeketh to be in public; if thou dost these things -- manifest thyself to the world;'
YLT_Paraphrased: if you do these things -- show the world -- if you're in public -- you'll be in the world;'
DRA_Original: For there is no man that doth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, manifest thyself to the world.

YLT_Original: for not even were his brethren believing in him.
YLT_Paraphrased: he didn't believe his brothers and sisters in the faith.
DRA_Original: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

YLT_Original: Jesus, therefore, saith to them, `My time is not yet present, but your time is always ready;
YLT_Paraphrased: "I don't have time, but you have time, and I'm ready for you," he said.
DRA_Original: Then Jesus said to them: My time is not yet come; but your time is always ready.

YLT_Original: the world is not able to hate you, but me it doth hate, because I testify concerning it that its works are evil.
YLT_Paraphrased: I don't hate you, but I'm afraid of you, because I'm afraid of what you're doing.
DRA_Original: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth: because I give testimony of it, that the works thereof are evil.

YLT_Original: Ye -- go ye up to this feast; I do not yet go up to this feast, because my time hath not yet been fulfilled;'
YLT_Paraphrased: go to the feast, I don't have time to go, 'cause I haven't yet had my time.
DRA_Original: Go you up to this festival day, but I go not up to this festival day: because my time is not accomplished.

YLT_Original: and saying these things to them, he remained in Galilee.
YLT_Paraphrased: he stayed in Galilee, and he told them the things he had told them.
DRA_Original: When he had said these things, he himself stayed in Galilee.

YLT_Original: And when his brethren went up, then also he himself went up to the feast, not manifestly, but as in secret;
YLT_Paraphrased: when his brothers came, he went to the feast, but he was not visible;
DRA_Original: But after his brethren were gone up, then he also went up to the feast, not openly, but, as it were, in secret.

YLT_Original: the Jews, therefore, were seeking him, in the feast, and said, `Where is that one?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "where's the one?" Said the Jews, and they searched him.
DRA_Original: The Jews therefore sought him on the festival day, and said: Where is he?

YLT_Original: and there was much murmuring about him among the multitudes, some indeed said -- `He is good;' and others said, `No, but he leadeth astray the multitude;'
YLT_Paraphrased: there was a lot of murmuring among the crowd, some of them said -- 'He's good;' and others said -- 'No, but he's going to be a fool.'
DRA_Original: And there was much murmuring among the multitude concerning him. For some said: He is a good man. And others said: No, but he seduceth the people.

YLT_Original: no one, however, was speaking freely about him, through fear of the Jews.
YLT_Paraphrased: but he spoke freely about him, for fear of the Jews.
DRA_Original: Yet no man spoke openly of him, for fear of the Jews.

YLT_Original: And it being now the middle of the feast, Jesus went up to the temple, and he was teaching,
YLT_Paraphrased: Jesus went to the temple, and he taught, and then he went to the temple.
DRA_Original: Now about the midst of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

YLT_Original: and the Jews were wondering, saying, `How hath this one known letters -- not having learned?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "how did he know letters - not knowing them?" Said the Jews, wondering.
DRA_Original: And the Jews wondered, saying: How doth this man know letters, having never learned?

YLT_Original: Jesus answered them and said, `My teaching is not mine, but His who sent me;
YLT_Paraphrased: "I'm not teaching you, but the one who sent me," he said.
DRA_Original: Jesus answered them, and said: My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

YLT_Original: if any one may will to do His will, he shall know concerning the teaching, whether it is of God, or -- I do speak from myself.
YLT_Paraphrased: if anyone can do his will, he will know what he is, whether it is God's or -- I'm speaking from my own.
DRA_Original: If any man do the will of him; he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.

YLT_Original: `He who is speaking from himself his own glory doth seek, but he who is seeking the glory of him who sent him, this one is true, and unrighteousness is not in him;
YLT_Paraphrased: he who speaks his glory, he's looking for glory, but he's looking for glory in the one who sent him.
DRA_Original: He that speaketh of himself, seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh the glory of him that sent him, he is true, and there is no injustice in him.

YLT_Original: hath not Moses given you the law? and none of you doth the law; why me do ye seek to kill?'
YLT_Paraphrased: why do you want to kill Moses? 'Cause he didn't give you the law?'
DRA_Original: Did Moses not give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the law?

YLT_Original: The multitude answered and said, `Thou hast a demon, who doth seek to kill thee?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you have a demon, who wants to kill you?" The crowd answered.
DRA_Original: Why seek you to kill me? The multitude answered, and said: Thou hast a devil; who seeketh to kill thee?

YLT_Original: Jesus answered and said to them, `One work I did, and ye all wonder,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I've done a job, and you're all wondering what I'm doing," he said.
DRA_Original: Jesus answered, and said to them: One work I have done; and you all wonder:

YLT_Original: because of this, Moses hath given you the circumcision -- not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers -- and on a sabbath ye circumcise a man;
YLT_Paraphrased: you have circumcised Moses, not that he's Moses, but the father of the fathers -- and on the Sabbath you're circumcised.
DRA_Original: Therefore, Moses gave you circumcision (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and on the sabbath day you circumcise a man.

YLT_Original: if a man doth receive circumcision on a sabbath that the law of Moses may not be broken, are ye wroth with me that I made a man all whole on a sabbath?
YLT_Paraphrased: are you upset that I made a man a whole on a sabbath?
DRA_Original: If a man receive circumcision on the sabbath day, that the law of Moses may not be broken; are you angry at me because I have healed the whole man on the sabbath day?

YLT_Original: judge not according to appearance, but the righteous judgment judge.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the judge is not judged according to appearance, but the righteous judge. "
DRA_Original: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge just judgment.

YLT_Original: Certain, therefore, of the Jerusalemites said, `Is not this he whom they are seeking to kill?
YLT_Paraphrased: "they don't want to kill him, do they?" Said the Jerusalemite.
DRA_Original: Some therefore of Jerusalem said: Is not this he whom they seek to kill?

YLT_Original: and, lo, he doth speak freely, and they say nothing to him; did the rulers at all know truly that this is truly the Christ?
YLT_Paraphrased: he speaks freely, and they don't tell him anything, but he's really talking about God, and they're not telling him anything.
DRA_Original: And behold, he speaketh openly, and they say nothing to him. Have the rulers known for a truth, that this is the Christ?

YLT_Original: but this one -- we have known whence he is; and the Christ, when he doth come, no one doth know whence he is.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "no one knows where he is, and the Christ, when he comes, no one knows where he is."
DRA_Original: But we know this man, whence he is: but when the Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.

YLT_Original: Jesus cried, therefore, in the temple, teaching and saying, `Ye have both known me, and ye have known whence I am; and I have not come of myself, but He who sent me is true, whom ye have not known;
YLT_Paraphrased: "you know me, and you know where I'm from, and I don't come from myself, but He who sent me," he cried, and he was crying.
DRA_Original: Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching, and saying: You both know me, and you know whence I am: and I am not come of myself; but he that sent me, is true, whom you know not.

YLT_Original: and I have known Him, because I am from Him, and He did send me.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I've known him since I was a kid, and he sent me. "
DRA_Original: I know him, because I am from him, and he hath sent me.

YLT_Original: They were seeking, therefore, to seize him, and no one laid the hand on him, because his hour had not yet come,
YLT_Paraphrased: he was therefore sought, and no one touched him, because he had not yet arrived, and he was not yet.
DRA_Original: They sought therefore to apprehend him: and no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

YLT_Original: and many out of the multitude did believe in him, and said -- `The Christ -- when he may come -- will he do more signs than these that this one did?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "the Christ - when he's coming - will he do more signs than the one he did?" Said many of them.
DRA_Original: But of the people many believed in him, and said: When the Christ cometh, shall he do more miracles, than these which this man doth?

YLT_Original: The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers that they may take him;
YLT_Paraphrased: the Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring, and the Pharisees and the priests sent them to him;
DRA_Original: The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning him: and the rulers and Pharisees sent ministers to apprehend him.

YLT_Original: Jesus, therefore, said to them, `Yet a little time I am with you, and I go away unto Him who sent me;
YLT_Paraphrased: "but I'll be with you for a minute, and then I'm going to go to my friend who sent me.
DRA_Original: Jesus therefore said to them: Yet a little while I am with you: and then I go to him that sent me.

YLT_Original: ye will seek me, and ye shall not find; and where I am, ye are not able to come.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you'll find me, and you won't find me, and where I'm going, you won't find me."
DRA_Original: You shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither you cannot come.

YLT_Original: The Jews, therefore, said among themselves, `Whither is this one about to go that we shall not find him? -- to the dispersion of the Greeks is he about to go? and to teach the Greeks;
YLT_Paraphrased: "so we will go to the Greeks, and we will not find him?" The Jews asked themselves.
DRA_Original: The Jews therefore said among themselves: Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?

YLT_Original: what is this word that he said, Ye will seek me, and ye shall not find? and, Where I am, ye are not able to come?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "you're looking for me, and you won't find me?" And he said, "Where I'm going, you won't find me?"
DRA_Original: What is this saying that he hath said: You shall seek me, and shall not find me; and where I am, you cannot come?

YLT_Original: And in the last, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, `If any one doth thirst, let him come unto me and drink;
YLT_Paraphrased: "if anyone is thirsty, come to me and drink," Jesus said, "if anyone is thirsty, come to me."
DRA_Original: And on the last, and great day of the festivity, Jesus stood and cried, saying: If any man thirst, let him come to me, and drink.

YLT_Original: he who is believing in me, according as the Writing said, Rivers out of his belly shall flow of living water;'
YLT_Paraphrased: the writing said that the river of living water was flowing out of the belly of the River.
DRA_Original: He that believeth in me, as the scripture saith, Out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

YLT_Original: and this he said of the Spirit, which those believing in him were about to receive; for not yet was the Holy Spirit, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
YLT_Paraphrased: he said, "The Spirit of the Spirit, which the believers believed in him, was not yet, because Jesus was not yet fully exalted.
DRA_Original: Now this he said of the Spirit which they should receive, who believed in him: for as yet the Spirit was not given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.

YLT_Original: Many, therefore out of the multitude, having heard the word, said, `This is truly the Prophet;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "it really is the Prophet," they said, "and it's true."
DRA_Original: Of that multitude therefore, when they had heard these words of his, some said: This is the prophet indeed.

YLT_Original: others said, `This is the Christ;' and others said, `Why, out of Galilee doth the Christ come?
YLT_Paraphrased: "this is the Lord," said one, "why, out of Galilee, the Lord is coming?
DRA_Original: Others said: This is the Christ. But some said: Doth the Christ come out of Galilee?

YLT_Original: Did not the Writing say, that out of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem -- the village where David was -- the Christ doth come?'
YLT_Paraphrased: the writing says, "From the seed of David, from the village of Bethlehem, the Lord came."
DRA_Original: Doth not the scripture say: That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem the town where David was?

YLT_Original: A division, therefore, arose among the multitude because of him.
YLT_Paraphrased: the multitude, therefore, arose from him, because of him.
DRA_Original: So there arose a dissension among the people because of him.

YLT_Original: And certain of them were willing to seize him, but no one laid hands on him;
YLT_Paraphrased: some of them wanted to grab him, but no one touched him;
DRA_Original: And some of them would have apprehended him: but no man laid hands on him.

YLT_Original: the officers came, therefore, unto the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, `Wherefore did ye not bring him?'
YLT_Paraphrased: "then why did you not bring him?" The officers asked, and the Pharisees answered, "Wherefore?"
DRA_Original: The ministers therefore came to the chief priests and the Pharisees. And they said to them: Why have you not brought him?

YLT_Original: The officers answered, `Never so spake man -- as this man.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "never mind the man - as he did," the officers answered.
DRA_Original: The ministers answered: Never did man speak like this man.

YLT_Original: The Pharisees, therefore, answered them, `Have ye also been led astray?
YLT_Paraphrased: "have you also been deceived? 'Said the Pharisees.
DRA_Original: The Pharisees therefore answered them: Are you also seduced?

YLT_Original: did any one out of the rulers believe in him? or out of the Pharisees?
YLT_Paraphrased: does anyone believe in him or the Pharisees?
DRA_Original: Hath any one of the rulers believed in him, or of the Pharisees?

YLT_Original: but this multitude, that is not knowing the law, is accursed.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "this multitude, that doesn't know the law, is cursed."
DRA_Original: But this multitude, that knoweth not the law, are accursed.

YLT_Original: Nicodemus saith unto them -- he who came by night unto him -- being one of them,
YLT_Paraphrased: he said to them -- He who came to him by night -- He's one of them.
DRA_Original: Nicodemus said to them, (he that came to him by night, who was one of them:)

YLT_Original: `Doth our law judge the man, if it may not hear from him first, and know what he doth?'
YLT_Paraphrased: if he doesn't hear from him first, he'll know what he's doing, and he'll know what he's doing?'
DRA_Original: Doth our law judge any man, unless it first hear him, and know what he doth?

YLT_Original: They answered and said to him, `Art thou also out of Galilee? search and see, that a prophet out of Galilee hath not risen;'
YLT_Paraphrased: "did not the prophet rise from Galilee?" He asked, and he looked at him.
DRA_Original: They answered, and said to him: Art thou also a Galilean? Search the scriptures, and see, that out of Galilee a prophet riseth not.

YLT_Original: and each one went on to his house, but Jesus went on to the mount of the Olives.
YLT_Paraphrased: Jesus went to the mount of Olives, but he went to the house.
DRA_Original: And every man returned to his own house.

YLT_Original: The word that hath been unto Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying:
YLT_Paraphrased: the word of the Lord to Jeremiah, saying:
DRA_Original: The word that came from the Lord to Jeremias, saying:

YLT_Original: `Hear ye the words of this covenant, and ye have spoken unto the men of Judah, and unto the inhabitants of Jerusalem,
YLT_Paraphrased: you have spoken to the people of Judah, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem, and the people of Jerusalem
DRA_Original: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak to the men of Juda, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem,

YLT_Original: and thou hast said unto them, Thus said Jehovah God of Israel: Cursed  the man who doth not obey the words of this covenant,
YLT_Paraphrased: you said, "Thus says the Lord of Israel: Cursed is the one who does not abide by the word of the Covenant."
DRA_Original: And thou shalt say to them: Thus saith the Lord the God of Israel: Cursed is the man that shall not hearken to the words of this covenant,

YLT_Original: That I commanded your fathers, In the day of My bringing them out from the land of Egypt, Out of the iron furnace, saying, Hearken to My voice, and ye have done them, According to all that I command you, And ye have been to Me for a people, And I am to you for God,
YLT_Paraphrased: when I brought them out of Egypt, I told them to listen to my voice, and they did it, according to what I've told you.
DRA_Original: Which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying: Hear ye my voice, and do all things that I command you: and you shall be my people, and I will be your God:

YLT_Original: In order to establish the oath that I have sworn to your fathers, To give to them a land flowing with milk and honey, as this day. And I answer and say, `Amen, O Jehovah.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "amen, O God," I answer and say, "Amen, O God."
DRA_Original: That I may accomplish the oath which I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. And I answered and said: Amen, O Lord.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah saith unto me, `Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: Hear ye the words of this covenant, And ye have done them.
YLT_Paraphrased: "proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, and say: Hear the word of the Covenant.
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to me: Proclaim aloud all these words in the cities of Juda, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: Hear ye the words of the covenant, and do them:

YLT_Original: For I certainly testified against your fathers, In the day of My bringing them up out of the land of Egypt -- till this day, Rising early and testifying, saying, Hearken to My voice,
YLT_Paraphrased: I've been testifying against your father in the day of my arrival in Egypt -- until today, when I'm rising early and testifying, saying, Hearken to my voice.
DRA_Original: For protesting I conjured your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt even to this day: rising early I conjured them, and said: Hearken ye to my voice:

YLT_Original: And they have not hearkened nor inclined their ear, And they walk each in the stubbornness of their evil heart, And I bring on them all the words of this covenant, That I commanded to do, and they did not.'
YLT_Paraphrased: they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't listen, they don't
DRA_Original: And they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear: but walked every one in the perverseness of his own wicked heart: and I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did them not.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah saith unto me: `A conspiracy is found in the men of Judah, And in the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
YLT_Paraphrased: "the men of Judah and Jerusalem are found to be conspirators.
DRA_Original: And the Lord said to me: A conspiracy is found among the men of Juda, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

YLT_Original: They have turned back to the iniquities of their first fathers, Who refused to hear My words, And they have gone after other gods to serve them, The house of Israel, and the house of Judah, Have made void My covenant, that I made with their fathers.
YLT_Paraphrased: they have turned to the sins of their fathers, who have refused to hear my words, and they have gone to the house of Israel, and the house of Judah, and the house of Judah, have broken my promise.
DRA_Original: They are returned to the former iniquities of their fathers, who refused to hear my words: so these likewise have gone after strange gods, to serve them: the house of Israel, and the house of Juda have made void my covenant, which I made with their fathers.

YLT_Original: Therefore thus said Jehovah: Lo, I am bringing in unto them evil, That they are not able to go out from, And they have cried unto Me, And I do not hearken unto them.
YLT_Paraphrased: so I'm bringing bad things to them, that they can't escape, and they're crying to me, and I'm not listening.
DRA_Original: Wherefore thus saith the Lord: Behold I will bring in evils upon them, which they shall not be able to escape: and they shall cry to me, and I will not hearken to them.

YLT_Original: And the cities of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem have gone, And they have cried unto the gods, To whom they are making perfume, And they give no deliverance at all to them, In the time of their vexation.
YLT_Paraphrased: the cities of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, they fled, and they cried to the gods, to whom they were making perfume, and they gave them no help.
DRA_Original: And the cities of Juda, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall go, and cry to the gods to whom they offer sacrifice, and they shall not save them in the time of their affliction.

YLT_Original: For -- the number of thy cities have been thy gods, O Judah, And -- the number of the streets of Jerusalem Ye have placed altars to a shameful thing, Altars to make perfume to Baal.
YLT_Paraphrased: the number of your cities, O Judah, is your gods, and the number of the streets of Jerusalem is your shrine.
DRA_Original: For according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Juda: and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem thou hast set up altars of confusion, altars to offer sacrifice to Baalim.

YLT_Original: And thou, thou dost not pray for this people, Nor dost thou lift up for them cry and prayer, For I do not hearken in the time of their calling unto Me for their vexation.
YLT_Paraphrased: you don't pray for them, nor do you want to raise the cry and pray for them, for I'm not listening to them.
DRA_Original: Therefore, do not thou pray for this people, and do not take up praise and prayer for them: for I will not hear them in the time of their cry to me, in the time of their affliction.

YLT_Original: What -- to My beloved in My house, Her doing wickedness with many, And the holy flesh do pass over from thee? When thou dost evil, then thou exultest.
YLT_Paraphrased: when you do bad, you're happy to be happy, and the holy body is passing out of your house?
DRA_Original: What is the meaning that my beloved hath wrought much wickedness in my house? shall the holy flesh take away from thee thy crimes, in which thou hast boasted?

YLT_Original: `An olive, green, fair, of goodly fruit,' Hath Jehovah called thy name, At the noise of a great tumult He hath kindled fire against it, And broken have been its thin branches.
YLT_Paraphrased: he called his name, At the noise of a great crowd, he lit a fire, and the thin branches were broken.
DRA_Original: The Lord called thy name, a plentiful olive tree, fair, fruitful, and beautiful: at the noise of a word, a great fire was kindled in it and the branches thereof are burnt.

YLT_Original: And Jehovah of Hosts, who is planting thee, Hath spoken evil concerning thee, For the evil of the house of Israel, and of the house of Judah, That they have done to themselves, To provoke Me to anger, to make perfume to Baal.
YLT_Paraphrased: Jehovah, who planted you, spoke bad about you, and the house of Israel, and the house of Judah, that they have done to themselves, to provoke me to anger, to make perfume.
DRA_Original: And the Lord of hosts that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee: for the evils of the house of Israel, and the house of Juda, which they have done to themselves, to provoke me, offering sacrifice to Baalim.

YLT_Original: And, O Jehovah, cause me to know, and I know, Then Thou hast showed me their doings.
YLT_Paraphrased: oh, my God, I know, and I know, so you've shown me what they're doing.
DRA_Original: But thou, O Lord, hast shewn me, and I have known: then thou shewedst me their doings.

YLT_Original: And I  as a trained lamb brought to slaughter, And I have not known That against me they have devised devices: We destroy the tree with its food, and cut him off From the land of the living, And his name is not remembered again.
YLT_Paraphrased: I'm a trained lamb, and I'm not aware of the devices they've built to destroy the tree, and I'm not aware of their names.
DRA_Original: And I was as a meek lamb, that is carried to be a victim: and I knew not that they had devised counsels against me, saying: Let us put wood on his bread, and cut him off from the land of the living, and let his name be remembered no more.

YLT_Original: And O Jehovah of Hosts, judging righteousness, Trying reins and heart, I do see Thy vengeance against them, For unto Thee I have revealed my cause.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I see the cause of your vengeance, for I have revealed it to you, O God of the Hosts.
DRA_Original: But thou, O Lord of Sabaoth, who judgest justly, and triest the reins and hearts, let me see thy revenge on them: for to thee I have revealed my cause.

YLT_Original: Therefore, thus said Jehovah concerning the men of Anathoth, who are seeking thy life, saying: Do not prophesy in the name of Jehovah, And thou dost not die by our hands.
YLT_Paraphrased: so Jehovah said to the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, saying: Do not prophesy in the name of Jehovah, but you won't die.
DRA_Original: Therefore thus saith the Lord to the men of Anathoth, who seek thy life, and say: Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of the Lord, and thou shalt not die in our hands.

YLT_Original: Therefore, thus said Jehovah of Hosts: `Lo, I am seeing after them, The chosen ones die by sword, Their sons and their daughters die by famine,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I see the chosen ones die by sword, their sons and daughters die of hunger, "he said.
DRA_Original: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts: Behold I will visit upon them: and their young men shall die by the sword, their sons and their daughters shall die by famine.

YLT_Original: And they have no remnant, For I bring evil unto the men of Anathoth, The year of their inspection!'
YLT_Paraphrased: they don't have any remnants, for I'm bad for Anathoth, the year of their inspection!'
DRA_Original: And there shall be no remains of them: for I will bring in evil upon the men of Anathoth, the year of their visitation.

YLT_Original: And the lot for the sons of Joseph goeth out from Jordan  Jericho, to the waters of Jericho on the east, to the wilderness going up from Jericho in the hill-country of Beth-El,
YLT_Paraphrased: from Jordan to the east, to the desert of Beth-El, the sons of Joseph are leaving the lot.
DRA_Original: And the lot of the sons of Joseph fell from the Jordan over against Jericho and the waters thereof, on the east: the wilderness which goeth up from Jericho to the mountain of Bethel:

YLT_Original: and hath gone out from Beth-El to Luz, and passed over unto the border of Archi  Ataroth,
YLT_Paraphrased: he went to Beth El, and then to Luz, and then to the border of Archi Ataroth.
DRA_Original: And goeth out from Bethel to Luza: and passeth the border of Archi, to Ataroth,

YLT_Original: and gone down westward unto the border of Japhleti, unto the border of Beth-Horon the lower, and unto Gezer, and its outgoings have been at the sea.
YLT_Paraphrased: the sea was at the edge of the Japhleti, the Beth-Horon, the Gezer, and its outflow was on the sea.
DRA_Original: And goeth down westward, by the border of Jephleti, unto the borders of Beth-horon the nether, and to Gazer: and the countries of it are ended by the great sea:

YLT_Original: And the sons of Joseph -- Manasseh and Ephraim -- inherit.
YLT_Paraphrased: the sons of Joseph -- Manasseh and Ephraim -- inherit.
DRA_Original: And Manasses and Ephraim the children of Joseph possessed it.

YLT_Original: And the border of the sons of Ephraim is by their families; and the border of their inheritance is on the east, Atroth-Addar unto Beth-Horon the upper;
YLT_Paraphrased: the sons of Ephraim are on the east, Atroth-Addar to Beth-Horon, the upper;
DRA_Original: And the border of the children of Ephraim was according to their kindreds: and their possession towards the east was Ataroth-addar unto Beth-horon the upper.

YLT_Original: and the border hath gone out at the sea, to Michmethah on the north, and the border hath gone round eastward  Taanath-Shiloh, and passed over it eastward to Janohah,
YLT_Paraphrased: the border was broken by the sea, and the border was broken by the sea, and the border was broken by the sea, and the border was broken by the sea.
DRA_Original: And the confines go out unto the sea: but Machmethath looketh to the north, and it goeth round the borders eastward into Thanath-selo: and passeth along on the east side to Janoe.

YLT_Original: and gone down from Janohah  Ataroth, and to Naarath, and touched against Jericho, and gone out at the Jordan.
YLT_Paraphrased: he was taken down by Janohah Ataroth, and Naarath, and Jericho, and he was gone from the Jordan.
DRA_Original: And it goeth down from Janoe into Ataroth and Naaratha: and it cometh to Jericho, and goeth out to the Jordan.

YLT_Original: From Tappuah the border goeth westward unto the brook of Kanah, and its outgoings have been at the sea: this  the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim, for their families.
YLT_Paraphrased: the border is west to the brook of Kanah, and its outflow is flowing into the sea: this is the inheritance of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim.
DRA_Original: From Taphua it passeth on towards the sea into the valley of reeds, and the goings out thereof are at the most salt sea. This is the possession of the tribe of the children of Ephraim by their families.

YLT_Original: And the separate cities of the sons of Ephraim  in the midst of the inheritance of the sons of Manasseh, all the cities and their villages;
YLT_Paraphrased: the cities and their villages, the sons of Ephraim, all the cities and their villages;
DRA_Original: And there were cities with their villages separated for the children of Ephraim in the midst of the possession of the children of Manasses.

YLT_Original: and they have not dispossessed the Canaanite who is dwelling in Gezer, and the Canaanite dwelleth in the midst of Ephraim unto this day, and is to tribute -- a servant.
YLT_Paraphrased: they did not destroy the Canaanite who was in Gezer, and the Canaanite who was in Ephraim, and he was to be a servant.
DRA_Original: And the children of Ephraim slew not the Chanaanite, who dwelt in Gazer: and the Chanaanite dwelt in the midst of Ephraim until this day, paying tribute.

YLT_Original: Brethren, if a man also may be overtaken in any trespass, ye who  spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of meekness, considering thyself -- lest thou also may be tempted;
YLT_Paraphrased: brothers, if a man is also to be taken in a breach, you who are spiritual restoreers, consider yourself -- lest you also be tempted;
DRA_Original: Brethren, and if a man be overtaken in any fault, you, who are spiritual, instruct such a one in the spirit of meekness, considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

YLT_Original: of one another the burdens bear ye, and so fill up the law of the Christ,
YLT_Paraphrased: the burden is borne by the one who bears it, and so the law of God is fulfilled.
DRA_Original: Bear ye one another's burdens; and so you shall fulfill the law of Christ.

YLT_Original: for if any one doth think  to be something -- being nothing -- himself he doth deceive;
YLT_Paraphrased: if any one thinks he's something -- he's deceiving himself -- he's deceiving himself.
DRA_Original: For if any man think himself to be some thing, whereas he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.

YLT_Original: and his own work let each one prove, and then in regard to himself alone the glorying he shall have, and not in regard to the other,
YLT_Paraphrased: he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will be proud of himself, and he will
DRA_Original: But let every one prove his own work, and so he shall have glory in himself only, and not in another.

YLT_Original: for each one his own burden shall bear.
YLT_Paraphrased: each one of them is carrying his own burden.
DRA_Original: For every one shall bear his own burden.

YLT_Original: And let him who is instructed in the word share with him who is instructing -- in all good things.
YLT_Paraphrased: let him who's taught the word share with him who's teaching him -- everything good.
DRA_Original: And let him that is instructed in the word, communicate to him that instructeth him, in all good things.

YLT_Original: Be not led astray; God is not mocked; for what a man may sow -- that also he shall reap,
YLT_Paraphrased: God is not mocked, for what a man may sow -- that's what he'll reap.
DRA_Original: Be not deceived, God is not mocked.

YLT_Original: because he who is sowing to his own flesh, of the flesh shall reap corruption; and he who is sowing to the Spirit, of the Spirit shall reap life age-during;
YLT_Paraphrased: he who is sowing his own body, he will reap the corruption of his body; and he who is sowing the Spirit, he will reap the life of his soul.
DRA_Original: For what things a man shall sow, those also shall he reap. For he that soweth in his flesh, of the flesh also shall reap corruption. But he that soweth in the spirit, of the spirit shall reap life everlasting.

YLT_Original: and in the doing good we may not be faint-hearted, for at the proper time we shall reap -- not desponding;
YLT_Paraphrased: we may not be faint-hearted, for at the right time we will reap -- not despairing;
DRA_Original: And in doing good, let us not fail. For in due time we shall reap, not failing.

YLT_Original: therefore, then, as we have opportunity, may we work the good to all, and especially unto those of the household of the faith.
YLT_Paraphrased: then, as we have the opportunity, we can work together, especially to those of the faith household.
DRA_Original: Therefore, whilst we have time, let us work good to all men, but especially to those who are of the household of the faith.

YLT_Original: Ye see in how large letters I have written to you with my own hand;
YLT_Paraphrased: I wrote you a big letter with my hand.
DRA_Original: See what a letter I have written to you with my own hand.

YLT_Original: as many as are willing to make a good appearance in the flesh, these constrain you to be circumcised -- only that for the cross of the Christ they may not be persecuted,
YLT_Paraphrased: they are bound to be circumcised only for the cross of the cross, and they will be punished only if they appear in the flesh.
DRA_Original: For as many as desire to please in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised, only that they may not suffer the persecution of the cross of Christ.

YLT_Original: for neither do those circumcised themselves keep the law, but they wish you to be circumcised, that in your flesh they may glory.
YLT_Paraphrased: they don't want you to be circumcised, but they want you to be circumcised, so they can glory in your flesh.
DRA_Original: For neither they themselves who are circumcised, keep the law; but they will have you to be circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.

YLT_Original: And for me, let it not be -- to glory, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which to me the world hath been crucified, and I to the world;
YLT_Paraphrased: for me, it's not -- to glory, except for the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, which I'm on the world to the world;
DRA_Original: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ; by whom the world is crucified to me, and I to the world.

YLT_Original: for in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation;
YLT_Paraphrased: no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision, no circumcision
DRA_Original: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.

YLT_Original: and as many as by this rule do walk -- peace upon them, and kindness, and on the Israel of God!
YLT_Paraphrased: as many as this rule will be, peace and kindness, and on the Holy Land of God!
DRA_Original: And whosoever shall follow this rule, peace on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

YLT_Original: Henceforth, let no one give me trouble, for I the scars of the Lord Jesus in my body do bear.
YLT_Paraphrased: so I'm not gonna be a problem for anyone, for I have scars on my body from the Lord Jesus.
DRA_Original: From henceforth let no man be troublesome to me; for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus in my body.

YLT_Original: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ  with your spirit, brethren! Amen.
YLT_Paraphrased: with your spirit, my brothers, we are blessed with the grace of God.
DRA_Original: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brethren. Amen.

YLT_Original: And it cometh to pass, in that year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, spoken unto me hath Hananiah son of Azur the prophet, who  of Gibeon, in the house of Jehovah, before the eyes of the priests, and all the people, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: in the fourth year of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fifth month, he spoke to me, Hananiah son of Azur, the prophet of the Lord.
DRA_Original: And it came to pass in that year, in the beginning of the reign of Sedecias king of Juda, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananias the son of Azur, a prophet of Gabaon spoke to me, in the house of the Lord before the priests, and all the people, saying:

YLT_Original: `Thus spake Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon;
YLT_Paraphrased: so the king of Babylon, God of Israel, said, I've broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
DRA_Original: Thus saith the Lord of hosts the God of Israel: I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

YLT_Original: Within two years of days I am bringing back unto this place all the vessels of the house of Jehovah that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon hath taken from this place, and doth carry to Babylon,
