YLT_Paraphrased: I'll bring all the ships of the house of Jehovah Nebuchadnezzar from this place to Babylon in two years, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon, and I'll take them to Babylon,
DRA_Original: As yet two years of days, and I will cause all the vessels of the house of the Lord to be brought back into this place, which Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried them to Babylon.

YLT_Original: And Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and all the removed of Judah, who are entering Babylon, I am bringing back unto this place -- an affirmation of Jehovah; for I do break the yoke of the king of Babylon.'
YLT_Paraphrased: I bring you to this place, the king of Judah, and all the Judahites who have fled to Babylon, I bring you to the place of the Lord.
DRA_Original: And I will bring back to this place Jechonias the son of Joakim king of Juda, and all the captives of Juda, that are gone to Babylon, saith the Lord: for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.

YLT_Original: And Jeremiah the prophet saith unto Hananiah the prophet, before the eyes of the priests, and before the eyes of all the people who are standing in the house of Jehovah,
YLT_Paraphrased: before the eyes of the priests and the people who stood in the temple, before the eyes of the people who stood in the temple.
DRA_Original: And Jeremias the prophet said to Hananias the prophet in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of the Lord:

YLT_Original: Yea, Jeremiah the prophet saith, `Amen! so may Jehovah do; Jehovah establish thy words that thou hast prophesied, to bring back the vessels of the house of Jehovah and all the removal from Babylon, unto this place.
YLT_Paraphrased: "amen, so may God do it, for the sake of the house of Jehovah, and all the removal from Babylon to this place, to the house of God.
DRA_Original: And Jeremias the prophet said: Amen, the Lord do so: the Lord perform thy words, which thou hast prophesied: that the vessels may be brought again into the house of the Lord, and all the captives may return out of Babylon to this place.

YLT_Original: `Only, hear, I pray thee, this word that I am speaking in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people.
YLT_Paraphrased: only, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, I beg you,
DRA_Original: Nevertheless hear this word that I speak in thy ears, and in the ears of all the people:

YLT_Original: The prophets who have been before me, and before thee, from of old, even they prophesy concerning many lands, and concerning great kingdoms, of battle, and of evil, and of pestilence.
YLT_Paraphrased: from the time of the old, even before you, the prophets have prophesied about many places, and many kingdoms, and many battles, and many pestilence.
DRA_Original: The prophets that have been before me, and before thee from the beginning, and have prophesied concerning many countries, and concerning great kingdoms, of war, and of affliction, and of famine.

YLT_Original: The prophet who doth prophesy of peace -- by the coming in of the word of the prophet, known is the prophet that Jehovah hath truly sent him.'
YLT_Paraphrased: the prophet who prophesies peace - the prophet who is known by God - is the prophet who has really sent him. "
DRA_Original: The prophet that prophesied peace when his word shall come to pass, the prophet shall be known, whom the Lord hath sent in truth.

YLT_Original: And Hananiah the prophet taketh the yoke from off the neck of Jeremiah the prophet, and breaketh it,
YLT_Paraphrased: Hananiah the prophet of Jeremiah, and he breaks the yoke from his neck.
DRA_Original: And Hananias the prophet took the chain from the neck of Jeremias the prophet, and broke it.

YLT_Original: And Hananiah speaketh before the eyes of all the people, saying, `Thus said Jehovah, Thus I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, within two years of days, from off the neck of all the nations;' and Jeremiah the prophet goeth on his way.
YLT_Paraphrased: "so I'm breaking the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king Nebuchadnezzar, within two years, from the neck of all the people," Hananiah said.
DRA_Original: And Hananias spoke in the presence of all the people, saying: Thus saith the Lord: Even so will I break the yoke of Nabuchodonosor the king of Babylon after two full years from off the neck of all the nations.

YLT_Original: And there is a word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah after the breaking, by Hananiah the prophet, of the yoke from off the neck of Jeremiah the prophet, saying,
YLT_Paraphrased: after the break, Hananiah the prophet, the prophet of the prophet Jeremiah, said, "There's a word of God to Jeremiah."
DRA_Original: And Jeremias the prophet went his way. And the word of the Lord came to Jeremias, after that Hananias the prophet had broken the chain from off the neck of Jeremias the prophet, saying:

YLT_Original: `Go, and thou hast spoken unto Hananiah, saying, Thus said Jehovah, Yokes of wood thou hast broken, and I have made instead of them yokes of iron;
YLT_Paraphrased: you said, Hananiah, so I made a wooden yoke, and I've replaced them with iron;
DRA_Original: Go, and tell Hananias: Thus saith the Lord: Thou hast broken chains of wood, and thou shalt make for them chains of iron.

YLT_Original: For thus said Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, A yoke of iron I have put on the neck of all these nations to serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they have served him, and also the beast of the field I have given to him.'
YLT_Paraphrased: so I have put on the neck of all these nations, God of Israel, the iron I have put on the neck of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they have served him, and the beast of Nebuchadnezzar king
DRA_Original: For thus saith the Lord of hosts the God of Israel: I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, to serve Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon, and they shall serve him: moreover also I have given him the beasts of the earth.

YLT_Original: And Jeremiah the prophet saith unto Hananiah the prophet, `Hear, I pray thee, O Hananiah; Jehovah hath not sent thee, and thou hast caused this people to trust on falsehood.
YLT_Paraphrased: "oh, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you, Hananiah, I beg you
DRA_Original: And Jeremias the prophet said to Hananias the prophet: Hear now, Hananias: the Lord hath not sent thee, and thou hast made this people to trust in a lie.

YLT_Original: Therefore thus said Jehovah, Lo, I am casting thee from off the face of the ground; this year thou diest, for apostacy thou hast spoken concerning Jehovah.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "for this year, for the sake of your sins, you have spoken of Jehovah, Lo, I'm taking you off the ground. "
DRA_Original: Therefore thus saith the Lord: Behold I will send thee away from off the face of the earth: this year shalt thou die: for thou hast spoken against the Lord.

YLT_Original: And Hananiah the prophet dieth in that year, in the seventh month.
YLT_Paraphrased: in the seventh month, Hananiah was fasting.
DRA_Original: And Hananias the prophet died in that year, in the seventh month.

YLT_Original: Words of Nehemiah son of Hachaliah. And it cometh to pass, in the month of Chisleu, the twentieth year, and I have been in Shushan the palace,
YLT_Paraphrased: the twenty-first year of the month, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace, and I was in Shushan's palace
DRA_Original: The words of Nehemias the son of Helchias. And it came to pass in the month of Casleu, in the twentieth year, as I was in the castle of Susa,

YLT_Original: and come in doth Hanani, one of my brethren, he and men of Judah, and I ask them concerning the Jews, the escaped part that have been left of the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem;
YLT_Paraphrased: I ask him about the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the Jews, the
DRA_Original: That Hanani one of my brethren came, he and some men of Juda; and I asked them concerning the Jews, that remained and were left of the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem.

YLT_Original: and they say to me, `Those left, who have been left of the captivity there in the province,  in great evil, and in reproach, and the wall of Jerusalem is broken down, and its gates have been burnt with fire.'
YLT_Paraphrased: "those who were left behind, who were left in captivity, and they were burned by fire, and the walls of Jerusalem were broken down, and the gates were burned with fire."
DRA_Original: And they said to me: They that have remained, and are left of the captivity there in the province, are in great affliction, and reproach: and the wall of Jerusalem is broken down, and the gates thereof are burnt with fire.

YLT_Original: And it cometh to pass, at my hearing these words, I have sat down, and I weep and mourn  days, and I am fasting and praying before the God of the heavens.
YLT_Paraphrased: I sat down, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I cried, and I
DRA_Original: And when I had heard these words, I sat down, and wept, and mourned for many days: and I fasted, and prayed before the face of the God of heaven.

YLT_Original: And I say, `I beseech thee, O Jehovah, God of the heavens, God, the great and the fearful, keeping the covenant and kindness for those loving Him, and for those keeping His commands,
YLT_Paraphrased: "I beg you, God, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the great and the terrible, the
DRA_Original: And I said: I beseech thee, O Lord God of heaven, strong, great, and terrible, who keepest covenant and mercy with those that love thee, and keep thy commandments:
